Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gennaro72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel in NYC: was simply great! I stayed in a double room ( and it was not the cheapest room of course....) I stayed there for work reasons and my company paid my bill....so ! The location is perfect, and same for the facility. The view from the room is wonderful. The lobby is very nice, and the breakfast area is amazing. They also have a nice balcony on Broadway where you can see the famous "car traffic" of New York City smoking a cigarette! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We experienced good service. I like the room because it's clean and has more space compared to other hotels. This hotel is very accessible everywhere you want to go in NYC. Wi-fi is okay.

Reviews.Title: “as expected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: overall of the hotel is fair , it is on good location so we can reach MoMA , underground and Time Square by minute.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: ajota83
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this hotel. I would say that it is mainly functional, with renewed rooms but a bit small, i could say like a modular cabin. Bed is soft and comfortable. It is placed practically in Times Square and I found it not expensive comparing with hotels around of similar class. Very nice restaurant to have a breakfast looking at Times Square. Lobby is not at the street level, so you always have to take the elevator from the entrance at the street. If possible ask for rooms far from elevators, cause they are a little noisy. At the departure i left the luggage at the locker service, good and cheap. Probably i would repeat to spend one or two nights. Anyhow, i would think better if i´d pretend to spend more nights or if i´d need it to work at the room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: madammalibu
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 night stay at Novotel Times Square our 1st time to New York. This hotel is amazing, the staff are V friendly and helpful, its very clean the food is good, and the beds are very comfy!! I cannot see what people find negative to put on this hotel!! The four of us who went have very high standards. The location is the best right next to Broadway, 15 mins walk from 5th avenue, 25 mins from Empire State and same for Rockerfella Centre. Central Park is no more than 25-30 mins walk. Bit difficult learning the street system of NY, but we found everyone in NY was willing to help and point us in the right direction!! I have to say a big thankyou to Arielle for answering all our questions prior to our stay! We went for my 40th Birthday trip and one day I will return to NY and won't stay anywhere else than the Novotel. The four of us who went all agreed it was a fab hotel!!!! Tip: Do the downtown cruise $18 well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: WestYorkshireTulip1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, good location in the heart of times square. We were originally allocated a room on the 32nd floor. On inspection was it not only too high, but the room we felt was in desperate need of a refurb, the wardrobe door was shattered and broken. We asked to be moved to a lower floor and luckily we were placed on the 9th floor - room 908, the room was so much better, modern, clean and comfortable it was like being a different hotel we were relieved that we asked to move and to be fair the receptionist arranged this very quickly for us and in a friendly manner. The bar was really nice, service excellent, we had a snack in the restaurant which was very nice. I would stay again but only in one of the refurb rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not Such a Great Room”
Reviews.Author: mek99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the 19th floor which was in big need of renovation. The carpet was dirty, the coffee table was rusted, the love seat in the room was very dirty, and the bathroom needed to have tile re-grouting. Even the electrical plate near the sink was cracked. The only thing that made the stay tolerable was that the bed was very comfortable and we were able to sleep without any noise disturbances. To be fair, our cousins stayed on another floor in a refurbished room which was clean and pleasant in every way. When my husband mentioned that our room was not very nice when we were checking out, we were told that the hotel is undergoing renovation and that we were in a room which had not yet been redone. Fortunately for us, we did not have to spend very much time in our room and, as mentioned, the sleeping was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mazzieg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, handy location if you want to be near Times Square, Starbucks, diner and convenience stores all close by. Rooms are large and the gym is great! We found staff to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and good room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Jane E
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York. When we arrived the room was not ready although it was 6.45p.m. however the receptionist was very considerate and even offered free cocktails at the bar whilst we waited. The room was ready within half an hour. Stayed on the 10th floor in a room that times Square can be seen from. Very clean and tidy and massive bed. The balcony by the restuarant was an added bonus but would not recommend it in the winter. There is so much to see and do in New York we did not spend much time at the hotel only to rest in the afternoon. All the New Yorkers seemed very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: AnaClaudiaVenga
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very comfortable and new, the staff is great and very helpful. Our room didn't have a Times Square view but it had an awesome Hudson River view nonetheless. But I guess nothing beats the fact that the location is incomparable in NYC. You are staying at Times Square, period. It's totally worth the price. We've stayed in other hotels that are also near, but Novotel is, like I said before, incomparable. There's a Duane Reade in the same building and a Starbucks right across the street. And also just around the corner there is Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: Great room, I stayed here with my family on a week trip to New York. The staff where very accommodating, There was no entertainment in the hotel and the Bar was expensive, but other than this the hotel was a very nice base for our visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jerrywojo01
Reviews.Content: was very impressed with this property in times square...room was very clean and neat...and the room was large for 2 people..high floor overlooking broadway was great...everything in working order...32" flat screen tv...large and comfortable bed. It has a roof top bar which is neat when the weather is nice...had gone there for drinks with friend last summer and decided to book a stay at the hotel...only drawback is the 2 elevators from the ground floor to lobby get crowded at times...large and clean lobby to relax in....Gallaghers steak house is next door....short stroll to all of times square at 52nd st. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “staff not as friendly as i thought”
Reviews.Author: frances327
Reviews.Content: we stayed in novotel in january for my husbands 40th birthday.the hotel is in a good location .it is clean .we had a great view and the best sleep ive ever had in a hotel bathroom was in need of an update but did the job.it seamed expensive to eat in so we used cosmic diner for our breakfasts turn left as you leave hotel walk to bottom of street and its on the right hand corner.thought it was a scandle that you had to pay for wifi so didnt but got it free in irish bar called hurleys lol .staff were polite but not friendly unless you were french. we wernt even asked if we enjoyed our stay when we were leaving.we had a nice time but found it expensive .the bus tours are brill and Ellis island was fantastic.shops expensive but prices did varey so shop about next door could be cheeper.

Reviews.Title: “great location 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. There are 2 slow lifts to get ppl to the lobby area, but then u have to change lifts to get to your room. For the in room wifi, there is a little catch, u will be charge for each device..i.e. if u log in with yr iphone, you will be charged. if u then log in with your ipad, then u will be charged again. this point was not clearly specified, unlike the novotels in asia pacific. apart from that it is a good value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, not great for business”
Reviews.Author: KLD72
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is very centrally located and the rooms are comfortable. However, if you come New York for business I would not choose the Novotel. First, the desk is very small and the lighting by the desk is inadequate. Second, you have to pay extra for Internet in the room. Third, the hotel decided to conduct a prolonged fire alarm test without informing guests beforehand. The test lasted for more than two hours and was extremely disruptive - announcements over the intercom, intermittent beeps, men entering the room to set off the fire alarm in the room. The hotel did not provide advance notice to the guests - no signs by the elevators, no information upon check-in. Fourth, it takes a long time to get in and out of the hotel. The hotel is only accessible by elevator, which are slow and crowded. It especially takes a long time to get out of the hotel in the morning, when a lot of people crowd around the elevators. In sum, a good hotel for tourists but Novotel does not seem to care about its business guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGeographer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Novotel just North of Times Square for 4 nights - and would return. The hotel is smack in the middle of the Theatre District and offers easy access to all major mid-town amenities. The hotel is up to the somewhat predictable standards of the Novotel chain - so you won't take any risks. I feel that I ought to mention a couple of (minor) drawbacks - so here we go: (1) the internet access costs $9.95 per day and is lousy: every page takes a minute or so to load and you might as well forget about anything that requires speed of any kind; (2) the hotel is 40+ stories high but to get to the lobby, you first have to take one of two small-ish elevators from street level. If you arrive just following a larger group, your wait to advance to the lobby could be longer than wished for; (3) the mid-town location is great for sights but will cost you - New York is at its most expensive here, even involving a normal breakfast in a diner or deli. That said, it's a clean place with lovely views from the higher rooms (especially if you can convince them that you merit a room with a Southern view onto Times Square - but even the East or West views are spectacular...) I'd come back when in town with the kids: they will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel that is good value for its location”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and would highly recommend it for travellers who want a good hotel but don't want to buy the cost of, say, the Sheraton or the Hilton nearby. The hotel is clean and tidy and the rooms a decent size (especially if, like me, you are travelling solo). I am not sure of the "stunning city view" (which was more of a view of people's offices opposite) but, being only a couple of blocks from Times Square, the hotel is in an excellent location. Breakfast is a bit pricey (once you've added tax and gratuity) but extensive, with pancakes, waffle, bacon, egg, sausages, croissants, donuts, fresh fruit, etc. The Duane Reader drug store underneath the hotel do quite good food to takeway and, of course, there are plenty of other places to choose from too. Wi-fi is about $40 for the week, which seemed pricey until I asked people how much they were paying in nearby hotels. More. All-in-all, very pleased with my stay and choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: sharonsime
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Tribeca but i booked this with the location in mind for my 18 year old son. We arrived at the hotel at 12.30pm after a short walk from 42nd St Port Authority Newark Airport Bus. After reading some of the reviews i wasn't hopeful that we would be able to check in at this time. The staff were really helpful and was able to check us straight in giving us a room away from the ice machine and lifts on the 20th floor. They were very informative on checking in explaining the costs of breakfasts and drinks and also gave us alternative options outside the hotel. The room was spacious and very clean, we had no traffic sound. We didnt pay for the internet option as we didnt really need it and Starbucks was just across the road which offered free access which pleased my son. The hotel has 3 Apple Macs in the lobby it was just a matter of picking the right time to use them for printing boarding passes out for our next flight. For Breakfast we used Cranberry Deli west 45th street (Between 6th & Broadway) which is approximately 15 mins walk from the hotel and just off Times Square. You can get a filling breakfast and a drink from here for around $4 and they offer something for everyone. We also had dinner a couple of doors up at perfect pint Irish bar which offered good food and was good value. There is a DuaneReade drugs store below the hotel where we purchased beer/drinks rather than pay the hotel prices. All in all we had a good stay, liked the location and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: lisa h
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here on several occaisions and loved it. The location is perfect for exploring and seeing the sights. The rooms are clean...the views are fantastic and to be honest i havent got a bad word to say about it. I will definately be goin back as being in the middle of times square is not exactly a bad place to be when your in the city that never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ARCHIE0410
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you pay for and this a prime example. The rooms are relatively basic but have the mod cons needed, such as television, mini-bar (not that I would ever use it with the prices they charge!), hair dryer, iron and safe. The hotel isn't glamorous, the lobby is busy and functional. I didn't try the breakfast as there's a McDonalds downstairs (not my normal style but fraction of the cost as we are a family of 4). WIFI is chargeable per device which is a complete rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: caroblond
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, been to NYC several times and chose this hotel for its central location, not disappointed! We had a great view down on Times Square. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: looby674
Reviews.Content: i toally enjoyed staying here in feb 2012 , so central its easy to navigate to wherever you want to go to . Its right on Times square but still quiet enough that you can get sleep when you need it easily . I went over with a friend this year and we wanted to shop and do all the tourist bits without using so much subway and this hotel allowed it with ease i usually stay on 103rd street so to stay in the middle of Times square was a little worrying at first but you would never know from the hotel as soon as you turn onto 52nd street to go in the hotels revolving doors a smiling doorman is always there to help you then get your elevator straight up to the beautiful open plan front desk , bar and restaurant with giant windows looking out onto Times square a balcony ....which in warmer months i would definately enjoy being on more often ....has loads of seating and we wrapped to enjoy the views before heading out most nights .What with central park 5 streets up and Rockefeller centre 2 avenues over , times square on our doorstep and the no.1 subway line on 50th just 2 minutes away we never had a bored minute or had to plan our travels too much and if you do the concierge service has answers to any problems , brilliant service fantastic stay . The rooms were clean warm and comfortable although with everything so close you dont spend a lot of time in them and the housekeeping is fantastic , i will be returning next year with the kids as i know now that they will be catered for easily in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for four nights and we were not disappointed. The rooms were clean and during the stay efficiently serviced. The restaurant has excellent views across Time Square so a pleasure to take breakfast there. Staff were friendly and helpful. The business centre was equiped with printer so able to print online tickets and boarding passes which is always useful. Only comment is that the bar prices were simply too high and they felt like a rip off. Otherwise hotel met my full expectations and would very happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Misty1313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got engaged in 2009 in New York and we stayed at this hotel so we decided to stay here again when we got married! On arrival, the desk staff were charming and when I mentioned we were getting married, she immediately upgraded us to room 3105 on the 31st floor and gave us free WI FI for the duration of our stay.The view was incredible- looking straight down into Times Square and the room was spacious with everything we needed. The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of most of the major tourist spots but it it's expensive. A glass of Stella at the bar cost me 11dollars! The buffet breakfast is great and sets you up for the day , but is 48 dollars for two!needless to say, we didn't touch the mini bar.Make use of the 24 hour McDonalds and the Duane Reade stores underneath the hotel for drinks and snacks. There is also a very good Irish pub accross the road. All in all, we had the most wonderful time and wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York. loved every single minute!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hoel”
Reviews.Author: fbfab
Reviews.Content: Novotel is in a great location, just a stroll into times square and from there everything is in your reach, the hotel rooms were fantastic with great views of times square, the bar area and dining area of the hotel were very cold the air conditioning a little too high for my liking and I didnt really like siting freezing trying to enjoy a drink, this is the only down side I found at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore the big apple”
Reviews.Author: tomanem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 4 nights. Check in was easy - staff seemed friendly and responsive to our needs etc - They have a bag drop if you need to check out early but have a late flight etc, and security at the reception. Room was clean and tidy, with enough room, good facilities/bathroom, large windows and queen size comfy bed etc. The hotel is literally a 5 mins walk from the heart of Times Square. It is within walking distance of other attractions such as the Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, Central Park, Macy's etc - they are a good walk but its the best way to explore this city! There are plenty of restaurants and diners within a 5 mins walk in any direction out of the hotel - there is something for everyone! The nearest subway is 2 blocks down - 2 mins walk, this has excellent links to other areas of NYC, mainly the south ferry terminal and Battery Park where you need to be to go to the statue of liberty. We paid $28 each for a 7 day unlimited pass on the subway and MTA busses - well worth it! Would recommend - prices for the rooms was reasonable, just watch out for hotel prices on food and drink - it's always better to eat out!

Reviews.Title: “hell of a view”
Reviews.Author: Teesy04
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel over valentines day 2011. the location was perfect just a few blocks walk from port authority bus station and the closest subway station is one block away. all the main broadway shows are within a few blocks from the hotel. when you get to the entrance of the hotel you have to go up in the lifts to the reception and the lobby. the staff are welcoming and friendly and the lobby is large and there is a small shop if you are in urgent need of anything. there are 2 computers in the lobby for internet access and a large balcony with amazing views onto times square for all the smokers. the rooms are spacious and modernly decorated and the bed is big and comfortable. the room has basic funrishings but how long are you going to be spending in the room anyway? it has everything you need for a comfortable stay including a fantastic view. there is a duanne reid on the corner below the hotel that will have everything you need if you forget anything and there are a number of nice restaurants close by. i would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ro8ert
Reviews.Content: I have to say I read some reviews on here and was a little dubious about the hotel, however I have to say I couldnt of asked for a better hotel. The room was very spacious and we had a brilliant view of times square, I Reccomend you ask for a times square view. Also it is in a great location, the subway is literally opposite and times sqaure 5min walk, staff polite and very friendly, will be returning and staying at this hotel. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find....Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Floridawillsgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently made our annual visit to NYC and decided to try staying at a different hotel than our usual spot.....We were pleasantly surprized with Novotel and would stay there again! The front desk staff were pleasant and most helpful. Lobby was clean and bright (somewhat modern upscale). Our first room assigned was the "amazing city view" but was out of order due to the safe not working. Hotel security immediately found us a new room.....WOW - we had the most amazing view of Broadway/Time Square!!! The rooms were clean and decorated modestly. Bed was clean and comfy. For the price we found this hotel to be spot on!! Pros: Price to Value Excellent Location: Walking distance to great restaurants, 5th Avenue, Central Park and the theatre district. Next door to Wicked/Gershwin Overall - Great Hotel Cons: Heat did not work properly; ran constatnly - When we ask them to fix it....NO PROBLEM! When we came back we found the window opened--HAHA! It was not a big issue!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice great location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveHolidaysuk1
Reviews.Content: The novotel is in an amazing location to all the main ny attractions, central park, rockefella centre, empire state and of course times square. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms really clean and modern. The bed was HUGE and really comfy. Overall great hotel, stayed in jan 2011 and going back this feb, would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, comfy bed and location was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Kezie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights at the Novotel, it is brilliantly located, footsteps from the main hustle and bustle of the vibrant times square. Rooms are spacious, clean and beds are very big and comfy! We got an excellent price for the hotel and flights with Thomas Cook for this time of year. But I have rated down on value due to the cost of eating in the hotel or even sitting in the lounge to have a drink being so highly priced. With a breakfast buffet being $22 per person. But with so much being within a stones throw of the hotel it is not needed but would have been nice to have the option. Ellen's stardust diner is literally opposite the hotel and does a fab breakfast much much cheaper. The hotel has a terrace balcony outside which over looks times square which is great for photo opportunities and views are spectacular. Lobby and lounges are very clean and modern. Staff were friendly, but we did have one incidence where a pair of earrings went missing out of our room off the bedside table and the only person who entered our room was a maid so whether they were swept up whilst changing the bed I'm not sure but this was the only downfall to our holiday. The security manager did visit us and advised he was submitting a report to their insurance company, but we as yet have heard nothing. So use the safe provided for every valuable you have, it was only by pure mistake that I forgot to put the earrings back in after a shower that they went missing. Upon day of leaving we had a late flight and check out is at 12, but the hotel does offer bag keeping service for $1 per bag for the whole day. Which I thought was very reasonable. Otherwise you can pay for late check out but it is $100 until 6pm. The only thing I think the room would benefit from would be a tea and coffee making facilities. But we got cold drinks from the pharmacy underneath the hotel which was very reasonable in price but the room lacked a proper fridge facility. Other amenities included a gym and business area with wifi that can be used for 20minutes per login for free, but you can login using the same details over and over again. Paying to have wifi in the room is very highly priced at $40 for the week on one device. Useful for checking details on things you plan to do whilst on the trip. Such as schedules for boat and bus trips of which I would recommend both. But starbucks has free wifi, and with a starbucks on every block it is very easy to access. Overall we had a fab holiday only spoilt by the earring incident. But I would definitely recommend the hotel for location and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: h00ked0nvegas
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this hotel for the last week. It was our first trip to NYC and the location was outstanding. We walked everywhere from Central Park to 5th Avenue and around Times Square and in between. We were in Room 2003 and had an awesome view of Times Square. Bed was on the harder side, but pretty comfy. Thick pillows. Bathroom was older and small but clean. Had in-room safe. One downside was that sometimes the thermostat worked and sometimes it didn't. There was a bodega (corner store) in the first floor of the building that had everthing from pharmacy items to food essentials. We also grabbed quick breakfasts at the deli across the street. Starbucks was across the street for coffee. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. There were a few computers in the lobby for internet access. Even though we were in noisy Times Square our room was almost sound-proof from street noise. Heard a few noisy guests in hall once.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MsFirstClass
Reviews.Content: This was a real let down. We were told free internet, the only free net is when you have to stand in the public lobby and log in every 20 min.It costs to get wifi in your room!how stupid. Rooms are dated and the "amazing city view" we were promised was just a view, nothing special. There is no room in the mini bar for your own stuff and no tea and coffee facilities. Wish I'd gone somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth N
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9pm as my flight from London was delayed, however checking in so was swift with no hassle. Frank at the reception was Top draw he was very helpful and professional. I asked for a Times Square View Room and couldn't believe my Luck when I was offered one on the 20th Floor. It makes it all the difference as the View at night time is grand. Bedroom is very spacious and very modern. I had slight problems with the heating at about 2am but called up reception and the electrician was there in a flash to sort it out- very impressive. However the Carpet at the entrance of my room was slightly stained but hey i was so excited and didn't pay much notice. Novotel is on 52nd Street and only about 5 mins walk to Times Square its so so close but yet far enough from the Madness at time Square. The closest Subway is on 53rd street, 2mins walk from Novotel - it takes 2 changes to JFK which will cost you $7.50 and a 45min ride. Breakfast is about $21 so if your saving up there's breakfast at Applebies a block away for roughly $11. There is also free Internet provided in the lobby, however sometimes busy but theres a Starbucks opposite the hotel where internet if free so if you've got a laptop, happy days!! Rita was helpful when I asked for a late check out because again my flight was delayed- she was very understanding and helpful to this effect. I'll be sure to stay here again as my overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Central to all the action”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJAM
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel mainly for it's location. The rooms are small but as we were on the go all day we did not care. The bar was good as was the view from the deck looking down to Time Square. The help desk will supply you a map and away you go 100 meters and you are on the subway. Breakfast was ok. Location location location - great Irish pubs close by, a great steak restaurant next door, plenty of shopping a stones throw away. I often stay at Ibis hotel because they are in good location, however the rooms are small. This hotel if it was in any other part of the world would be an Ibis.when I return to NY I would certainly return. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “location perfect, rooms great”
Reviews.Author: FurryTB
Reviews.Content: location hard to beat. Compared to other NYC hotels, the rooms are huge to. The corridors and carpets may be a little tired but that is a very small negative in what otherwise is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair value”
Reviews.Author: is_tripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just a block away from Times Square, Tickets guichet, Theaters. Rooms are new, well decorated, and clean. Restaurant is much better than the averages delis near.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: prink_123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Novotel Times Square three times, the most recent time being last week. I keep returning because: The location is terrific, close to the theatres, Central Park; shopping; the restaurant is reasonably priced and bright, with a great view of Times Square; the rooms are reasonably priced, especially for that area; rooms are quiet; the HVAC system is quiet and actually allows you to set the room temperature wherever you want it; staff are friendly and helpful. It is time, however, for the Novotel to spruce up a bit. Carpets and paint in rooms and hallways are looking old and dirty. Bathrooms are utilitarian.

Reviews.Title: “never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: bizzyinn
Reviews.Content: once again booked at the Novotel we were treated to a delightfull suprise ! we had been booked in to their show room we experienced a boutique style room with a wet room including a switch reverse glass shower screen the staff were as welcoming as usual many thanks to Arrielle for her thoughtful attention we ate in the restaurant my skirt steak was really tender and my wife enjoyed her pizza the hotel is central for Times Square and easy access for the subway coming from JFK jump on the skytrain and get the e train to station 50th st nearest to the hotel once again my favourite stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location close to Times Square, Central Park, Madison Square Gardens & Broadway Shows”
Reviews.Author: beegeebow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights from the 2nd January 2012. It is the perfect location for cruising through Times Square and seeing all the sites. An easy walk to Central Park and the museums and galleries on the east and west sides. Longer though still easy walk to Madison Square Garden for sports and also Grand Central Station, Empire State Building and Rockefeller Centre. Many Broadway theatres within a few hundred meters walk. Taxis to Soho, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge and attractions in the south end of Manhatten Island were $10-20. The rooms are fairly plain although well-equipped and very clean. A room with Times Square views is a must to make the most of the New York experience. The restaurant (Nicole) had excellent dinner and views if you prefer to eat in, although many other restaurants very close along Broadway and 8th Avenue. The breakfast buffet was good although a bit expensive if you only want a light meal of fruit or cereal and not the full suite of cooked items. Service was exceptional. Some reviews mention thin walled rooms however I had no issue with excessive noise and the block out blinds ensure the Times Square lights don't keep you up all night. The entry to the lobby was no issue either with a lift needed to go up three levels to the entry. The concierge was very helpful with bags and taxis. Security was high with a guard checking room swipe cards at night near the entry to the lifts. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, outstanding customer service, large room”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from New York where we stayed at the Novotel, Times Square. I have never written a review on a hotel before but feel that because we enjoyed it so much we would have the honour or recommending the Novotel to future visitors. The hotel is perfectly located on 51st street, it looks onto Times Square however it is far enough away not to be in the thick of all the illuminations etc. It has several very convenient subway stations in the immediate vicinity. The Rockafella building is around the corner and so are the theatres. There are many bars and Central Park is only a couple of blocks walk. The hotel itself is extremely well presented, from the lobby to the bar which is spotless throughout. The service and help at the desk was excellent. We needed a phone card and the staff told us where to get one, how much to pay and even how to use it when we brought it back to the hotel. They could not do enough for us. We upgraded before we left to a room with a view of the skyscrapers, we were on the 33rd floor, but that was OK because the elevator has a TV in it. The room we had was large, it had a King size bed, a two seater sofa and a HD plasma TV as well as safe, wardrobe, double desk unit and good sized on suite. The room was cleaned everyday at a convenient time and we were made to feel most welcome by the housekeepers. The terrace is amazing in the evening for the views of Times Square and the various skyscrapers. The lobby also has free internet access and several computers which can be used by the guests. Overall a fantastic hotel, an excellent price and location and one of the best we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of times square !”
Reviews.Author: giorgiadettoni
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, great location, rooms could do with a refurb .. But over all good. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “novotel hotel review”
Reviews.Author: hannahmcx
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with a few friends and we had a 2 night stay, we had asked for a times square view room but we where told there was none available, the staff where so nice but maid never came near our room once. air con was brill and view even from the side rooms where lovely, literally a stone throw away from times square so i understand how its so pricey. wouldnt eat food in the hotel, had a look at the menu and the food was just to expensive. lovely and friendly staff overall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Olivia O
Reviews.Content: Staying here you are literally a stones throw from times square and a 10 minute walk upto Central Park. Room was a good size and we had a fantastic view from our room on 29th floor. Very clean. Everything you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisdm2312
Reviews.Content: Before i leave my review can i just say that it annoys me how some people are pathetically petty when it comes to disliking places, this hotel is wonderful. We stayed here between the 12th and 16th of jan, after a nightmare of a queue at jFK immigration (2 hours 20 mins) we were made up to finally arrive at the hotel. I prepaid for a car to pick us up (dial 7, theyre brill) once we got there we got up to the lobby easy and checked in with no fuss. We also got a complimentary room upgrade overlooking times square. We made our way a SHORT distance to the lifts and found our room easy, room 1104. The room was pretty big for new york standards, very clean carpets, bathroom, bedding etc. Shower was nice and powerful. The view from the room was perfect. Location wise, couldnt have been better, easy to get too all attractions and got a taxi easy to and from battery park. if i asked the staff for anything they were very helpful. Didnt eat here as theres too many diners etc nearby, check out the olympic diner. Very cheap and does the best breakfast. Value for money is great, im hopefully re-booking this hotel next year on my return to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor service and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Iain G
Reviews.Content: On arrival after long flight - bellboys did not help with luggage. Although two were standing talking at the hotel entrance. Had to struggle to Reception on 5th floor without assistance. 1st room offered was dirty with filthy carpets and mould all over bathroom. Alternative room was only slightly better. Carpet cleaner and less mould. Bathroom also had a craced sink. No other room offered. Again no help changing rooms from14th to 21st floor. On departure again no help from bellboys although plenty around. Hotel very central hence reason for choosing it. For quality of service offered, this hotel deserves more than a 1or 2star rating and certainly does not warrant the prices charged. These prices were similar to those of the Waldorf Astoria and there is no comparison between the hotels!

Reviews.Title: “spend a few dollars more and forget the Novotel NY”
Reviews.Author: crazyvibes Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just of time square, Spacious rooms in need of revamp. Poor bathroom with problems water evacuation . Common space lacks any character and is very gloomy. One exception... modern, well equiped and airy fitness. Below par, unfriendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well overdue for a renovation. Price ok.”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Novotel. Rooms are good size and comfortable but nothing special. OK for the price in NY. NY is not cheap...so you cannot compare these to Asian hotels on price. The Good : Location is about a 5 min walk north of Times Square and within easy walking distance of Rockerfeller centre and Central Park. Subway is close. It is also close to on and off Broadway shows and some great restaurants (Stage Deli is just around the corner and is a must do!) Plenty of shopping close by and not too far from Macy's or Bloomingdales. Mind you, we did not mind walking around as New York is so interesting. The bed was comfortable and saved the room a bit. The terrace outside the restaurant is worth a look for some great times square views and photos. Close by (just on the corner) is a Duane Reade which is very, very handy (supermarket and pharmacy). If you walk up to central park up broadway however (about a 10 min walk) make sure you go to Wholefoods in the Time Warner centre (take note Coles ands Woolworths - this chain of supermarkets embarrasses you both). The staff in general were friendly and nice. Found one person - Ian, at the front desk who was great! The bad : The rooms are about 5 years overdue for renovation and seriously need to be redone. The bathroom is ok, but again needs to be renovated. There is a mini bar that is sensor activated and you have to pay for a fridge if you want one (not good at these hotel prices). The hotel enters via 2 elevators from street levels then you have to cross the lobby to get to the main elevators. Not a huge issue but is a pain at times especially after a long day out and about. The breakfast is overpriced and not great. In all reality with so many delis and Cafes close by, dont bother with the breakfast, just go out and enjoy the NY food. Wifi is not free, which is really lagging behind, but they do offer a few Macs downstairs in the lobby for free which is nice if you can get on one. Overall : If I came back to NY I would reconsider this hotel. Price vs location works well for this hotel, if it gets renovated would go up in rating as long as the prices stayed the same. But would also consider something like W Hotel which is in an even better location even though it costs about 20% more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Barbers26
Reviews.Content: Great location right by Times Square - noisy but all part of the NYC experience. Friendly staff. Not the cheapest hotel in the world but plenty of places nearby including a 24 hour supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “CANNOT BEAT THIS LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKH059
Reviews.Content: Just a $30 cab ride from LGA, this hotel is a gem. You are steps away from Times Square. The rooms are clean, the staff is very helpful, free internet in lobby and business room. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel but tons of choices just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: socksandsandals
Reviews.Content: Myself and friend stayed here for 4 nights in January 2012 as we were having a girly shopping holiday. We booked through Thomas Cook, room only, the website would only let us book a double room but we emailed and asked for two beds and they were happy to accommodate this for no extra charge. We didn't eat at the hotel, so only came into contact with the reception, security and concierge staff who were pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean, modern-looking and spacious enough for us both with a hairdryer, safe and iron provided. We stayed on the 10th floor, overlooking Broadway and didn't notice any street noise or any noise from other guests. The hotel was ideally located for Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, Hells Kitchen, Broadway shows and close to subway stations. Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate but there is a deli about a minute's walk down Broadway where we stopped for bagels each morning and there are loads of restaurants and bars locally. Try the Russian Vodka Room across the road from the hotel on 52nd street for happy hour cocktails but get there before 5 as it fills up really quickly. A good hotel, but I thought it was strange getting a lift from the street to the lobby and having to walk across the lobby to get another lift to the rooms. Not sure whether it's just me but I found the shower head quite low and couldn't raise it to where it would be most comfortable for me. (I'm 5"7). I would stay here again if I was to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Colin41187069
Reviews.Content: Really shocked at the negative comments on this hotel so don't let them put you off. We stayed here for 10 nights in November last year and didn't have one complaint. The rooms are clean and comfortable, as is the rest if the hotel and the location is fantastic!!! As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel restaurant is quite expensive but the view over Times Square is amazing so as a one off, it's worth every penny! We would most definitely reccomend this hotel to anybody travelling to New York who is looking for a good standard hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “first and last time..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I can only say one thing, donÂ´t go there, they will rip you off, and the service in the restaurant, is not something you can complain about, because the isÂ´nt any.... One morning I had to wait for about 10 minutes to get coffee, and next to me the staff was having a big argument in the kitchen, and some where outside smooking. Typical france culture, even that everybody in the restauant, was mexican and middle east employes, who didÂ´nt understand much.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DeborahPage79
Reviews.Content: A very short walk to Times Square. Lovely (spacious!) room that was clean, well maintained & had an amazing view of NYC. Ate breakfast there as it was included in our booking but this was a (minor) hassle each day as they still insisted on giving us the bill for food each morning & we had to point out it had already been paid!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Your staff was truly amazing. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The doormen were outstanding and helped direct us when we most needed it! We ate at the steakhose next door and we loved it. The rooms were located where we could see Times Square and we loved going on the balcony during the ball drop. Great Job!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, a great base for exploring NYC!”
Reviews.Author: BeatleBugUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for my honeymoon and was 100% happy with it! We asked for an upgrade and were given a room on the 32nd floor with a fantastic view, it was still one of the standard rooms and I thought it was lovely. Very clean en-suite, flat screen TV, we were given free wifi for the full stay and there were also three iMac computers in the lobby for guest's use. The staff were very friendly and the concierge was very helpful, we did not eat at the hotel as the staff reccommended so many good (and cheaper) places nearby. The location is just north of times square and so we always felt very safe going out around the hotel at night - also we did not suffer from any kind of noise at night. Don't be put off that the lobby is on the ninth floor - the lifts at the entrance do not take you anywhere else and so you cannot get lost (however I did not see any stairs so may not be suitable for people who avoid lifts). Also, this just made the hotel feel very safe and secure. We got a very reasonable price for the room and based on the quality of what we recieved for this I would recommend to anybody. Do note that (as is usual in USA) there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - this didn't bother me but it did bother my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: rdooz
Reviews.Content: Novotel is really just okay. We did a quick overnight this weekend to see a show at Carnegie Hall and chose Novotel based largely on reviews, location, and price. Clean? Yes - the room was in good shape (we were on the 29th floor) and the main lobby was inviting and comfortable. Sadly, our room was not. The heating/cooling system constantly blew warm air, despite setting the thermostat to a chilly 60 degrees. It wasn't obscenely uncomfortable; just really stuffy on a unseasonably warm January day/night. Overall: I've had far worse hotel experiences, but in NYC - at this class - Novotel was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 4*, but could do with some sharpening up”
Reviews.Author: GenerallyWandering
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about, but nothing to write home about. Location is not quite on Times Square, but good. The view of times square is good, but not spectacular. The rooms are adequate but a bit worn. The service was not bad, but at times confused. Adequate for business, but you get the feeling of charter tourist groups invading at times. All in all, a good choice but not the best Novotel or location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: carrotsWirral
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, if you want to be in the thick of the times square area. We had a room on a high floor, which offered a good view, and the windows were well sound-proofed and shut out the new york noise. The kind size room was an OK size, by new york standards, and it was clean but could have done with some maintenance (eg. wardrobe door broken). No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, and no free tea/coffee in reception/lounge. Due to the size of the hotel it was very busy and quite impersonal. The staff were polite but not over friendly. Reasonable value for money, by new york standards.

Reviews.Title: “Passable 3-star room with brilliant Times Square view”
Reviews.Author: BradJill
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Novotel Times Square during winter. Reservations were made through their website a few months in advance. Location is very good, being walking distance to many attractions (Rockefeller, NY Public Library/Bryant Park...) and the subway station. Check in was efficient. We came in early and had our luggage stored with them. However we had another room reserved for family, and this was not available until 5pm. Front desk gave a couple of drink vouchers for this inconvenience. The room was more spacious than we had expected, with comfy king size bed and sofa (with a pull-out bed), and the bathroom was a good size too. It was a passable 3 star hotel room showing its age and wear (peeling paint in the bathroom ceiling, jiggly doorknob...). The safe accommodated a laptop, iPad and DSLR camera (could probably fit an additional camera lens). Wifi was free for the holiday season, otherwise there's a surcharge. Room cleaning was fine. The only problem we had with the room was the lack of temperature control. We were informed that there was no air conditioning during the winter, only heating. So our room got particularly warm in the evenings, which was not neutralized by the partially opened window. We stayed for the Times Square view, and paid for it. Our room was on the 25/F and we spent an evening just watching the lights and screens below. One would think the price steep if one considers the standard of the room, which also did not include breakfast (or wifi if you stayed outside the holiday season), but upper end hotels are even more expensive so this oddly turns out the more reasonable deal. It may be noteworthy for others that the hotel room does not have floor to ceiling views of Times Square. You can only see it if you sit or stand by the window. For us this was a one time "indulgence" of a room-with-Times-Square-view, and not worth repeating. It was a fun tourist experience, and Times Square was easy for evenings out.

Reviews.Title: “Top tourist location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: therudies86
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week or so, including New Years Eve. My wife booked a Times Square view room, which was excellent for NYE, as it meant we could see everything that was going on (even open the windows a bit to hear the noise), but stayed clear of the crowds. Aprt from the view / location, there wasn't much going for the place. The building and fitout are tired, staff are variable in their approach (some good, others surly). We were on the 10th floor, which is about 4 floors above street level - and found it quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: seanmacauley
Reviews.Content: This was a really good hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful as most people tend to be if you are friendly to them. Stayed on 26th floor so views were pretty good. Room was contemporarily decorated and plenty of space. Bar & restaurant were quite pricey but you are about 50ft from Broadway so what do you expect from a hotel there? We didn't eat there at all but when you are in NYC why would you eat in the restaurant of a hotel chain anyway. Free wifi which is always a bonus. The only criticism was that there was no tea/coffee making facility in the room but maybe thats a british thing anyway. And there was a starbucks just down the road. On the whole a really good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Fine budget choice for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: I try to avoid Times Square when in NY, and Novotel would not be my first choice in New York, but business-related appointments forced me to this location and a budget-friendly hotel choice. While the decor is a bit tired and perhaps a level below typical business class standards, it's a fine choice. My room was quiet and thankfully looked a little more updated that the hallways and common areas. There is a mini-bar and safe, although the safe is in an awkward location. The towels and bedding are fine. Shampoo and soap in the bathroom but no lotion. Great views down Broadway to Times Square from rooms 02 and 03. I'd avoid rooms 08 as they are by the ice machine. I recommend nearby Vice Versa restaurant on 51st between 8th and 9th and Thalia at 8th and 50th.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: seiira
Reviews.Content: Tired, needs a update. But was in a great location. Room was small & cramped, and not alot of hanging space we stayed for 10 nights. Stayed on the 18th floor ..... not much of a view Will not stay there again. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A few years back- but great stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Summer of '06, and just never got around to writing anything on it on the internet. Had a very high floor and a great view of times square. Awesome mini-bar in the room and a great location near bars, clubs, and music venues. Les Paul was playing down the street from us so that was a plus. Overall a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ace hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craigc1984
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, location and service, couldn't of asked for a better hotel, mini bar expensive but that's self fault, bar and restraunt very expensive. Overall very good and well done

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Berkeleymorecambe
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Xmas and found the location to be great. On the doorstep of Times square and withing easy walking distance of nearly all the main attractions. Places like the Empire state building look miles away on the map but only a 10-15 min walk. And you get to see the shops en route. We stayed on the 28th floor so away from the noise on the street. The only problem was that the lifts were not working properly and one morning i had to wait 25 MINUTES for a lift to come up. It seems 2 of the 4 were out of order and at a busy time like this, they should have been sorted out. Found it odd that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Maybe its because we are used to it and have not been to the USA before. The breakfast was ok in the hotel if you were willing to wait for things to be replenished. Better places outside to eat. Some cheaper and some more expensive. The Stardust diner opposite was good but a bit dearer. Where else can you go for breakfast at 7am and the staff are singing whilst serving you???. It was a great place to visit but was a bit on the dear side. If you go, ask for the waiter Matt. He was very friendly and would make a point of coming to speak to you if you went back.(ask him about the Frank Sinatra singer who took over his microphone) Found the hotel staff friendly enough. The barman was brilliant and very helpful. The en-suite was dated and the silicone around the bath was mouldy but otherwise good enough for what we wanted. All in all, a good hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “good for a first time in NY”
Reviews.Author: Beth G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first visit to NY in March 2008. the location close to times square, broadway and the touristy bits of 5th avenue, rockefeller etc was great to get that 'city never sleeps' feel, without too much road noise. stepping out every day to the neon and noise of times square is something of a baptism of fire - not a location I would choose again, but definitely an experience I'd recommend to other first timers. if you're travelling from the UK you'll suffer with waking early and not wanting to go out late in the evening due to jet lag; so being central for a long sightseeing walk, but close to home after a trip to the theatre works well, and if you can't face going out the hotel bar (which feels very much like a hotel bar - nothing flash) does have the benefit of having views down broadway to times square so you don't feel like a total party pooper! The room (a double double) was a great size, particularly by NY standards, as was the bathroom which had a shower over bath.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: stev79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a most amazing location within easy walking distance of Times Square. My wife and I stayed at the hotel in August 2012 and we just happened to be there at the same time as Hurricane Irene. Our room was simple but clean and had all of the necessary hotel amenities that would be expected of a major chain such as the Novotel. Given that we were confined to our room for about 24 hours due to the hurricane we were quite comfortable. The staff were very conscious of the needs of hotel guests and did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. There are hundreds of restaurants in close proximity of the hotel along with many iconic New York tourist attractions including Times Square, Central Park and the Empire State Building. I would have no hesitation staying at this hotel again and in my opinion it represents good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Snazzy Setting”
Reviews.Author: VladBJr Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is a teeny soupcon of Europe smack in the middle of Times Square. It is an obvious magnet for French and other Euopeans seeking a bit of cultural warmth and shelter in an iconically American setting. The staff is friendly and reliable, and the rooms are quite adequate. We were on the top (33rd) floor, which probably was the right move in terms of avoiding street-level noise. Further down the tower is probably a bit more 'interactive' in that regard. All in all, worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: S1m0n123
Reviews.Content: Rooms are definitely not soundproofed, like they are advertised! Am on 25th floor, it's 1:30 am and traffic noise dying down but am right next to the lifts and ice maker. Do not stay in room next to lifts if you want any sleep. Check in early, to avoid disappointment. Will try to get room changed tomorrow, hotel currently full. Location is excellent, hotel is average, and a little overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Adrian K
Reviews.Content: The staff were always very helpful and polite. The lobby areas are nice, but the rooms are a bit dated. We had three rooms with views of times square on various levels. The view was great, and added to the experience of New York for all of us. The hotel is in a great location right on Times Square and next to the hop on tourist bus stops. Once we had our bearings it was easy to walk to attractions like the Rockerfella centre and the Empire State building. The breakfast was great, however on the day we left after eating breakfast here my wife was violently sick all day. Can't say it was definitely the breakfast here because I was fine, but she hadn't eaten anything else that day. We definitely would go back here if we visited NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if You Like to Run!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyandCorey
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Novotel for work and absolutely love the location for my greatest personal pleasure: running! Just a skip away from Central Park, it's easy to get out and run. And when the days are too long to run outside, this hotel has a well-equipped gym with new treadmills. The rooms are okay. It's worth it to join the Accor club and try to get up-graded to a higher floor where the views are better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robyn N
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to New Yorak , we were very pleased with the Novotel. Short walk from some of the best sights and places to visit. The room was quite large and comfortable but a little shabby, especially the carpets. Don"t bother to book breakfast at the Hotel. Although perfectly adequate there are so many good places to eat around the Hotel. The Majestic Deli and Applebees were two places the had healthy, cheap options. Staff were pleasant and helpful and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Gentle staffs and Great View”
Reviews.Author: Marcioxes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Times Square with my wife for 5 nights. The hotel is close to the mains atractions, has helpfull staffs and the room is comfortable. The bathroom is not big enough but clean. The Hotel has not much luxury, but the is comfortable and has a restaurant with a great view to Times Square that is not expensive! I would stay at Novotel when I come back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “No control of your own Heat and AC”
Reviews.Author: whitneyconnie
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 5th of December and found the room to be very warm after calling the front desk we discussed giving the room time to cool down scene we just arrived there. I then called later that night about the room being warm and after waiting for over an hour I called the front desk to let them know we would be going out for the evening after we returned there was no change in the room temp and we were very tiredI called the front deck again and complained, we were tired and went to bed. Next morning December 6th called front desk and the lady said that the cooling system was not on the night before? but would be turned on later? We went out sightseeing for the day and when we returned the room was still warm they offered to do nothing again we were tired from sightseeing and went to bed. Dec 7th I stopped and spoke to a manager on the way out about the room temp and when we arrived back at the hotel I called down they later sent a maintenance man to look at the AC, he found the AC filter very dirty and also confirmed the AC for the building had not been on and that they can only provide AC or heat but not both at the same time. We got dressed to go out for dinner and on the way down I spoke to one of the managers named Ryan and he assured me that they do have AC and heat and that a lady requested a extra blanket for her room because it was so cold? He offered us a fan for when we got back and a free breakfast the next day. After returning we called down and asked for a fan or room change and the other manager now on shift could not do it and said it was against policy and code to do so, he said we could unlock and open our windows and then later called back and said they were going to turn on the AC because he had been getting complaints from others about the temperatures in the rooms. There web sites states they have modern facilities with heat and AC this is not true at all so before you make your booking to stay here you may want to consider this issue. I myself will never stay at this hotel again. It does have a great view and the place is nice and outdated but without a good nights sleep our stay in New York was not pleasent at all.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my aching back”
Reviews.Author: Diva3inFrance
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Novotel approximately 6 times. Love the new look and everything about this lovely property, but the mattress this time was horrible. Haven't stayed here since Dec. of 2009. This time my back and ribs were actually sore from the mattress that was like a board and the pillows equally as uncomfortable. I did find one pillow in the cabinet that was different from the others and much better. Don't know if we can come back due to the uncomfortable sleeping situation. BTW, the staff is very friendly and helpful, but at a minimum the mattresses MUST be changed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central Time square hotel”
Reviews.Author: wobs1968
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this Novotel Hotel. On this occasion it was for my wife's 50th Birthday, we had such a fantastic stay the first time and the room had the most beautiful view overlooking the Hudson river , that I wanted to stay in the same room for a treat for my wife. When I contacted the Hotel, they could not have been more accommodating. I did could not remember the room number, so the Manager assured me he would do everything he could to find the room we were in from there records. He kept by his word and we stayed in the fantastic room again, not only this but he also had complementary cocktails for us on arrival to celebrate my wife's Birthday. I thought this was a lovely touch. The Hotels restaurant and cocktail bar has the most fantastic view of time square and there is also an outdoor balcony with the best view at night with all the lights that you see on T.V. The hotel is perfectly situated in the centre of Manhattan, and the price to stay here is very reasonable taking all the above into account. The only negative thing I can think of is the bar and restaurant are quite highly priced as for most of the city hotels, but there are plenty of other choices very close by that are more reasonably priced. All in all this hotel is a great choice and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: crazisheep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in April..and loved the location. Literally walk out onto the lead up to Times Square but are surrounded by shops/bars etc. Can walk from here to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Empire State and much more. Room was great..although ours had a bit of noise from the air con unit outside, it didnt spoil our stay. Reception staff were a little inattentive, but again, didnt really need them so they didnt dampen our trip.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevoCardiff
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to NYC.I stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The location , just off times sq was perfect.I stayed on the 32nd floor and had great views. The room was clean,comfy and quiet, is there anything else you require of a new york hotel.The reception area was fine and check in easy and rapid.There are 3 computers in the lobby with 20 mins free internet, ideal for checking e-mails , checking in for flights or making your friends jealous on facebook.We had breakfast in the hotel, which was fine.the staff were fine and helpful. When I visit again < I will be looking to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel! read on for other recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Joanna-999
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who had sent many people here before so I had high expectations and I was not disappointed - for the very reasonable price it was the perfect place. We paid for a room with a Times Square view requesting to be on a high floor. We were on floor 27. The room was pretty big with a huge bed, it was quiet (considering the mayhem only a few minutes away!) and very clean. The bed was comfy the bathroom ample size and plenty of hanging/storage space. The location could not have been any better. Within minutes you are bang in the centre of Times Square. We didnt have breakfast as the chap on reception recommended we went over the road to a 24hour diner. It is called the Cosmic Diner and is on the corner of 8th av & 52nd street. Huge menu to choose from, very clean, perfect to fill your tum for a full days sightseeing/shopping. For a FANTASTIC view of the empire state whilst supping a drink in a heated outdoor rooftop bar you must try 230 Fifth (between 26 & 27 streets). They even supply robes if it gets a little chilly. If you are after a brilliant show, try WICKED at the Gershwin theatre. Even though I was extremely nervous I can't recommend enough to try a helicopter tour. We did one that lasted 20 minutes www.newyorkhelicopter.com. Unless you book ahead try to choose a clear day and head to Wall Street Heliport at Pier 6. It was a smooth ride up and down the Hudson to Central Park and the views are breathtaking. other quick recommends: head to the very top of the Rock Macy's - disappointing but worth a trip anyway Amazing but expensive shops - Barneys, Bergdorf Goodman, Sacks, Bloomingdales, Fun times - try your hand at playing on the BIG piano at FAO Shwartz Stroll through Central Park Try the playwright pub on the corner of 46th street and 8th av for a really friendly laid back pint or two. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice, the rooms were huge compared to many other NYC hotels which cost the same or more (which is why I chose it, of course). I had a king with city view but the room was almost a suite, it had a small sofa and coffee table besides the bed, quite a large space. Everything was very nice and the location cannot be beat. It is only 2 short blocks from the subway so easy to get to from Penn Station, for example, and easy to go to/from on your visit. I chose the location as I was doing a lot of theater that weekend, so it worked, but easy to take the 50th St crosstown bus to Madison Ave if you want to take the M1-4 buses or take the subway to/from LInconln center, etc. My only demerits are that they have an ominous sign on the minibar about charging you if some automatic sensor can tell you moved something (no big deal for a weekend, I was thinking of using it for some drinks of my own, but didn't). So I didn't look in it to see if there was empty space or not as I didn't want to get into issues at checkout, but that seems a little petty. My only real complaint is that I didn't like the pillows. They were very thick and rather hard (not sure what they were made of), so your neck would have to be raised maybe 6 inches if you used them. I don't use a thick pillow like that at home and cannot.sleep that way so I had to sleep without any pillow, which is not optimal either. Everything else was fine, comfortable (the mattress was good, not too hard like some hotels can have), nice decor, and great location so I could have given then 5 stars but to me that means perfection and they weren't perfect. PS The "amazing city" view is nothing special and not so amazing, just buildings, of course, but better than looking at a close wall. I wasn't going to pay to look at Times Square lights, didn't care about that at all, I wasn't there much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Never seen such a view”
Reviews.Author: Johannes061
Reviews.Content: New York is special, but the Novotel is extra special. The hotel is on Broadway and from the terras (on the 5th floor) you have a wondelful view: Time Square! Nice hotel and friendly people. I can recommand this place and we'll be back ! Jan en Gerda Doone, Waddinxveen NL

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for first time visitors to New York.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be great choice for recent girl friends' trip to NY. Just off Broadway but within easy walking distance to catch tours, subways and theatre. Quiet at night with great beds. Even had viewing of Macy's Day parade from our room tho a block away (good for stormy day). Can't comment on food as we ate elsewhere. When we had a computer problem we were immediately offered business guests' office space. Too bad about charge for WiFi and we were even charged for 1-800 phone call. Found ALL New Yorkers to be friendly and helpful...just pull out a map and a new friend showed up to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault this Hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Shenty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel, New York for a 5 night break for my birthday and couldnâ€™t have chosen a better hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent for Times Square/Broadway. On arrival we were early to check in (check in is 3.00p.m. check out is 12 noon). Reception was extremely friendly and called a bellboy to hold our cases. My husband had asked for a high room and we got upgraded to the 28th floor (foc) with great views of Hudson River. The room was clean and the king size bed comfortable. Room has a TV, iron and ironing board, Minibar which is full and will charge your room direct via reception if anything is removed. If you want to use the fridge for your own use then ask at reception for the items to be removed. The bathroom (with bath) and shower was well equipped with shower gel, shampoo, shower cap, soap and a hairdryer. Fresh towels were left daily. Only downside to the bathroom was the mould around the bath. Cant comment on the food as always ate out but did bring a pizza back to the room one night which was perfectly acceptable by the hotel. We did use the bar where the staff was again very friendly. (Drinks very expensive though). We will definitely be going back to New York and will definitely consider the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: fivestarcam
Reviews.Content: Pretty ordinary hotel.. Staff were rude and unhelpful. Seemed to be a lot of French people staying there who are also very rude, especially when going in and out of elevators. Rooms are poor quality. And although we booked a room with a view of times square we were not given this and were told to take it up with the provider.

Reviews.Title: “Extended weekend in NY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. The hotel is very functional, but rooms are somewhat impersonal. The wireless internet worked fine. Service at the restaurant (breakfast) is better than it used to be a couple years ago but still has some room for further improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: My and my partner have stayed at the novotel broadway twice, and would honestly stay nowhere else in new york!ideally located right in the heart of the city, with large comfortable rooms and pleasent staff. The only possible negatives are firstly the need to take two lifts to actually ger to your room, and secondly the bar is pretty expensive even for its location.but thats really nit picking!u wont regret staying in this hotel,ok its not as luxurious or snooty as some hotels in the city,but in my opinion it ticks all the right boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a trip to NYC, we stayed 5 nights at Novotel and here is what we thought: Pros: - Great location, right on Times Square, if you want to stay in this area - Efficient service - Our room was pretty big for NYC - We didn't hear any noise from the street or the other rooms - I loved the glass wall between the shower and the bedroom that switches from transparent to opaque just by pressing a button ! Cons: - The guests were almost exclusively french, we prefer hotels with more international customers - The rooms and corridors decoration was a little bit depressing, it felt more like a cheap Holiday Inn Express than a >300USD/night hotel - Our room smelled very bad, I don't know where it came from but it didn't give an impression of cleanliness - In the hotel we spent our time waiting for the lifts or packed with a dozen of other guests in the lift. There are 4 lifts for around 40 floors, definitely not enough at peak hour. On top of that you have to take another lift to go from the lobby to the street level. - It was the first time in my experienced-traveller life I was charged to leave my luggage at the hotel for a couple of hours the day of my departure !! I'm used to tip the bellboy for this service, but I hated to be charged a 1USD fee per bag (even laptops and small shopping bags). In conclusion, we didn't think it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: always a good stay and good service,,,,just a movie problem in the room...15 min. into a movie it shuts off and i end up paying for a movie that i didnt get to watch.. this has happened 4 times in 3 months,

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: levado
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to Times Square in midtown New York, so close to all amenities. The worst thing is the set of two lifts you need to use to get to your room, first a very slow lift at the entrance to the building which takes you up five floors to reception, where you need to get out and transfer to another lift to take you to your room. I found it inconvenient and time-consuming to have to use two separate lifts. The lift to my room going all the way up to the 33rd (and last) floor was fortunately far faster than the one taking me only five floors up to reception. Breakfast wasn't included in the USD 300/night room rate. The rooms are fine, but they are just alright and not top luxury. There is a large selection of films and channels to be seen on the flat-screen TV in the room. The bathroom is clean and spacious enough, as is the room and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not as good as the last time I was there....cheap bed, pillows. For $300+ night you expect more. TV remote didn't work, sinks and tub plugged. the location is great, central but far enough away from the zoo in time square.

Reviews.Title: “Typically good Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location in theatre district off Broadway and close to Times Square close to restaurants of Hells Kitchen and easy walk to Central Park Friendly helpfull staff in all areas Well situated near subway stations No negatives

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: kh100
Reviews.Content: Super convenient location to Times Square and nearby restaurants. Our room on the 30th floor was not too loud and we could sleep with the windows ajar. Bed was very comfortable, and we had a great nights sleep. Bathroom was recently renovated but basic and small - with low water pressure in the shower. Not exciting, but a value-oriented place to stay. Wifi worked fine and was reasonably priced. Very cosmopolitan crowd and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from novotel”
Reviews.Author: Sechysgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location. The room was good, bed was comfortable. Sheets felt scratchy and there was alot of black mould in the shower. The bathroom floor looked like it hadn't been swept as there was glass on the floor. Service at Reception on check in was excellent- kind, patient and helpful. Atmosphere in hotel was good. Rooms were quiet and could be darkened, great for sleeping. Skyscraper view was nice with a view of river. Internet free in lobby. Porters at the entrance were nice and looked after our luggage, even got us a private driver to the airport for the same price as a taxi. Housekeeping could have been slightly more prompt with our requests. Overall though, good value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but waiter, there's a hair in my soup!”
Reviews.Author: willd1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location, and because of the brand name. Check in was prompt, the rooms are small but reasonably clean and modern and the views of Times Square are pretty nice. The 24 hour fitness centre is also reasonably well stocked out.
