The cleaning staff are pleasant. The concierges were unhelpful and generally just delegated questions (definitely not Michael J Fox). The only real complaint I'd levy against them is that while at breakfast, my wife found a (pubic) hair in her coffee cup that she'd been drinking from. When I alerted the waiter to this, he looked puzzled for a minite, and then, as though some divine light bulb switched on, he got the dirty cup, and swapped it with a clean cup with the unoccupied seat next to us, without another word. Nothing more was said, although I did catch another waitress on the same morning scowling at us (???). I'm really sorry to the waitstaff we offended in drawing their attention to a PUBIC hair we found in their coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights in New York staying at this Novotel. It is in a great position in the theatre district, a stones throw from Times Square and was an excellent base (location-wise) to explore the city. Disappointed upon arrival to have been allocated a very smelly smoking room (particularly as my other half has a Novotel loyalty card and his profile expressly states non-smoking!) - to be fair, they did change us to another room once we'd gone back down to the lobby, but after a long-haul flight and dragging your luggage up in the lift, you really don't need this! The staff were generally rather supercilious - whether this was because the majority of guests appeared to be French and we were English, I can't be sure, but it was perceptible. The second room was ok, but lacked basic things that would have made our stay more pleasant ... for example there was no mirror above the desk/dressing table, so application of make-up, hair straightening etc had to be done in the bathroom or in front of a mirrored wardrobe door (with no plug or surface except the floor to put your stuff on!). On the subject of wardrobe, insufficient number of coathangers were provided - half a dozen for 2 people for a 6 night stay. More importantly, the room was dirty ... there was loads of dust, including on an electric transformer plug which belonged to the telephone on which I was able to write my name it was so thick! Drew this to the attention of a member of staff, but it was still the same when we left 6 days later despite the room having been 'cleaned' daily. On the first day, found a very long hair on the tiles in the shower ... either it belonged to a previous guest or my husband has some questions to answer! I probably should have made more of a fuss, but frankly didn't want to let anything spoil my vacation so put up with a less than pristine room. It was an unusually mild week so it was disappointing that the 'air conditioning' blew out warm air ... but at least while it was on, it disguised the sound of the lift which was just through the wall from our room. Resorted to alcohol to block this out in the end! On the plus side, the bed was comfy. The breakfast buffet was good, although pricey (but this is a city, so I suppose to be expected) and we ate an evening meal in the restaurant one night which we enjoyed. The Cosmopolitan Martini cocktail is highly recommended - see comment re blocking out lift noise - a few of these and you just don't care ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: scott080
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the second time a few weeks back rooms are ideal for what you need location is superb staff cant do enough for you it really is central for everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wendleech1
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 days at the Novotel Times Square. The location is fantastic and the room was clean and in comparison with other New York hotels was larger than most. The only problem was the room was very hot and the air conditioning wasn't great. The staff were all very pleasant , in particular Heather that works behind the bar. I would definetely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a pleasure to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Its Time Square location is very convenience for city walking around time square and nearby area. The subway entrances also are very closed by. Safe and sound area even aafter midnight. Services are just fine not really could say as they always be busy with guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: malkymac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my girlfriend and had a room on the 15th floor. Room was very nice with everything you could possibly need provided.Cant comment on the food as we didnt use the restaurant or bar but if you are looking to go to NYC for a few days and get this hotel at a good rate then you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Would 100% stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Sian_Eirian
Reviews.Content: Great location. It's very basic but when your staying in NYC why would you spend all your time at the hotel?!? It was clean, comfertable and only around the corner from Times Square! Great service & amazing view from my room window. Made my trip to NY even better :)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Frances P
Reviews.Content: On arrival I and my son when struggling with our bags and although the security guard was on the door he did not offer any assistance. On booking into the hotel our room was not ready even though it was 10pm. We were given a temporary room and the next day when our correct room was ready we were not offered any assistance in moving our luggage to the new room. Before checking out we enquired about keeping our room for a couple of extra hours but they advised that they were fully booked and did not have a room available but we were advised that our luggage could be left in a room downstairs. We paid for this but our luggage was left in the doorway of the hotel and not put away in any room. Anyone could have lifted any of our bags.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay for us. We had great views of time square. I would stay here again and ask for the same rooms. The windows had double pull down blinds which were perfect for blocking out the lights and made sleeping easy. Some improvements on the ability to grab a cup of tea or coffee need to be looked into. No facility in the room to do this. There was no room in the fridge for any personal items, sometimes you need to put some things in a fridge. The choice to have refreshments or an empty fridge would be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Time Square is a good hotel located in an excellent position. The rooms are a little bit dated but so are other hotels in the area. I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza, The Marriott and The Sheraton. Its value for money. The staff were friendly, gave good advise and most of them were professional. Without mentioning names, the guy at the A/club desk is a professional and comments came from his heart. The food wasnt bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base For New York”
Reviews.Author: KevinK822
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the Novotel in Jan and its a great base for New York as its only 5 mins walk to Times Square, the room we had was ok but had great view but the mini bar was broken and needed updated but was fine, would stay here again 100% , we never used the cafe or bar also has a little shop which sell card and keyrings etc etc ... So well worth thinking about staying here just because of where it is

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room looked over Times Square which was fantastic they have double blinds on the windows as the lights from Time Square make you feel like its day. The hotel room was spacious and clean the bed was very comfortable. The Check in was quick but checkout was a bit disappointing as the gentleman was quite rude as was the concierge as the hotel mostly has French travellers and didnt care about other travellers as much.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Room Switch”
Reviews.Author: howefortunate
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Novotel before noon. A room was not available, but we were able to check in with our credit card, leave our luggage with the doorman and begin exploring New York City. When we returned around 5, we were told that the people who were staying in our room had a problem. Their tour bus had broken down. We were switched to a different room on a lower level without the king size bed we had reserved. We were not happy. As the people with the reservation for that night, we feel like we should have been placed into the room we reserved and the couple with the issue should have been moved to the room where we were put. The hotel is in a good location...in Times Square but not in the noisest part of it. They have 3 computers with free internet access in the lobby. Rooms were okay.

Reviews.Title: “its a novotel what more can u expect”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during fashion week the hotel is clean in a good location and the rooms r ok would i stay here again i doubt it

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok but service could be a lot better the waiters are not to friendly seemed like it was to much trouble to serve you. The room was not the cleanest the bathroom mirror had a large hand mark on it. We have stayed at Novotels in Australia and this would rate a lot lower than any of them

Reviews.Title: “Well recomended!!!”
Reviews.Author: LLM2010
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, so helpful, great rooms and amazing hotel, ian on the front desk was so helpful and the doormen couldnt do enough for you, amazing location 110% spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern Near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. This super sleek hotel is very clean and spacious. Two queen size beds and a work space as well as a nicely sized bathroom made this hotel the perfect choice for 4 people. The front desk it very helpful and the bell hops bend over backwards to try and secure the ever elusive open cab for you. This location is close to Times Square and also within walking distance of Columbus Circle and Central Park. There are a ton of great dining and shopping options within steps of this door. Our room was a great deal and I would stay here again if I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateGuy
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. Staff was good. Room was very spacious for that location. Room was clean and the view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Thierry G
Reviews.Content: Great location very close to Times Square, felt very safe walking back from theatres to the hotel. Too bad wi-fi is not included in the price !! Great view from our room on 16th floor. Beds are quite small. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Time Sq”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: Great location, efficient staff. Room was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juliana B
Reviews.Content: Novotel is so well located... it couldn't be better! The room was alright, clean, silent. The staff was very nice and and helpful. The Times Square view from the terrace is great! In its category, I think it's an excellent hotel. I wil certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September 2011. Although we booked a King bed room we were initially given 2 doubles on the 10th Floor. Traffic and construction noise made sleeping impossible, so we asked to be moved. We ended up on the 19 floor which offered a bit more peace and quiet. Rooms are in need of a major upgrade. Bathrooms are old and tired, bordering on mouldy. Restaurant and bar were nice with a lovely view. Reception staff seem a bit disinterested. Our flight was cancelled and we ended up having to stay an extra night. We were given a key to an already occupied room! (and the couple in there said that they experienced the same thing a few hours earlier). Rooms are fairly large for NYC, but I'd be checking out alternative hotels before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel New York - Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival good information and advice on hotel and area given by staff at reception. Had a king size room with Times Square view, the room was very clean, large and the bed was very comfortable. The location of this hotel is excellent for Broadway and the subway is a short walk away. There are several dinners near by for breakfast as hotel charges about $24 each. Would recommend this hotel if a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Time to find a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlmglm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel on our first trip to NYC in 2006 & have stayed for every visit to New York since. The main reason we stayed here was the location & the fact we could select a room with a view. We don't mind paying a little more for the room if we are guaranteed a view of Times Square (which we were given every time we stayed). However on our last 2 or 3 trips we have noticed the room seems to be less & less maintained. During a trip there Oct 2, 2011 we decided it would be the last time staying there. We arrived 2 hours before check-in & were told no rooms were ready (no problem - we expected that). But when we got to our room - the bathroom was just gross! There was hair all over the floor, on the tile walls & all over in the shower & tub! The bath towels had stains on them. The lamps were literally falling apart (shade kept falling off ??) Our room was freezing & couldn't get the heat to work so called guest services & was told that there is no heat. She told me to turn off the A/C - helpful! Next time we visit New York we will definitely be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was cool, even if the night was expensive, but anyways, NYC is expensive! The rooms were not luxury and the internet is not free and overpriced! It's 40$/week/device. Hopefully, if you share your connection from wifi to bluetooth with another macbook, you can create a free wifi access. But the alarm in one of the 2 elevators from the lounge to the street doesn't work. They should fix it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sorry by my english. Price too high if we compare de quality of the people that work there. That Â´people is not interested in the guests feel fine, in general. IÂ´ve gone to accorÂ´s hotels in Brasilia, Buenos Aires, BelÃ©m, Salvador, Rio de Janeiro and o accorÂ´s hotel NY is the worst. My check-out was terrible: the woman done it in a hurry and I couldnÂ´t verify the things that I eat from Frigobar. IÂ´ve seen it after I left the hotel, only. Result: I payed by a lot of things that I didnÂ´t eat (juices, gatorade, totlization about US$ 30,00).

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Disturb”
Reviews.Author: maxgrazza
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, potentially very good hotel let down by some of the rudest staff I have ever encountered. I wouldn't have been surprised to see the staff wearing Do Not Disturb signs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: floss44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and if you spend a little more you get a great view straight down times square .On the corner of 52nd and broadway its very conveniant to all the theatres and the great restraunts on 9th avenue .The rooms are getting a little tired and could use an update . A good feature is that you can ask for a small fridge to be put in your room . We stayed for 8 nights and this proved to be great to keep drinks and snacks in . A major downside was the check in . Check in is at 3pm , we turned up at 4pm and our room still was not ready . By 530pm after sitting in the lobby for an hour and a half it still was not ready !I had to go back to the desk at least three times to complain until we were finally given a room at 6pm . There excuse was that airline crews used the hotel and didnt check out till late ! Not a reasonable excuse in my book .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: kbartaldo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three days before cruise. Wonderful location for getting around. Fabulous dinner recommendations from both concierge and bar staff. Easy walking distance to restaurants. Close to times sq vibe but quiet. We somehow got a small handicap room but no problem we were hardly in room. Only issue was wSit staff in am did not make clear you could order off menu in morning instead of expensive bur good buffet. I/we would stay here again and recommend it without any real qualifications.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our NYC trip!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for anything better for our trip to NYC - this hotel was perfect! It was a 5 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is located on 52nd street - there is a subway on 50th street broadway (about 5 mins away) and also on 42nd street times square - so it was great access to subways. We had a duane reed under the hotel - which is a great shop to buy crisps, sweets, bottles of water etc - there is a mcdonalds about 50 meters away - where we grabbed a cheap breakfast every morning and there is a starbucks on the other side of the road - what more could you want? :) Highly recommended and we would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mariaflanagan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Times Square New York is a super location to visit New York. The hotel is clean, staff indifferent, service OK. Bar and Lobby very nice to have a drink. Terrace superb. I think Wi-Fi should be free to paying guests - in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Broadway”
Reviews.Author: fredbThurins Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well ocated. It is comfortable, the room was very clean. The breakfast buffet has many choices. It is easy to wlak through Broadway or the 5th Avenue. It remains expensive but that's New York!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel in September”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size and very comfortable; the bathroom was somewhat small and the shower head was in need of repair; terrific location in the heart of Times Square and was close to everything; there were numerous high quality restaurants in the area; the staff was terrific and the service was superlative.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: KerryB13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the centre of Times Square. Lovely balcony in the bar area which you can see more of times square from. The rooms are very modern and very clean, quite spacious too. Stayed here for New Year and i was not disappointed! Could see the action from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned at the hub of NY”
Reviews.Author: FujairahFan
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience last year (Best Western President Times Square) we followed the recommendation of a friend who has stayed at the Novotel. We were totally impressed with the room and the friendliness of all the staff (were the other reviewers in the same hotel?!!?). Although we didn't use the restaurant, we did use the bar and the terrace. The concierge was a great help when my computer skills left me when trying to check in online for our return flight - thanks Yves, and the girls were most impressed with the tea making skills of the barman (very important to people from the North of England). Location could not be bettered, and despite the aqmazing buzz of being right next to Times Square, the room was a haven of peace. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great views of times square from terrace bar”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Novotel a great central point for all attractions and transport. We had a superior room and it was worth the extra money for the space. Our friends had a standard room and it was a lot smaller. Friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a self service”
Reviews.Author: Tchelooh
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a good choice because it's in the heart of the island, close to lots of interesting places, but the staff are NOT friendly. Their slogan could be "Do not disturb us"

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; Average Room for NYC”
Reviews.Author: KDGS-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value; walls are thin (could hear the guy snoring in the next room and girl showering on the other side) like they were in my room. Need better sound attinuation (no carpet in rooms, fabric floor covering like a weaved rug). Walkways off evelators need carpets cleaned desperately, dirty and gross. Check in staff excellent. Odd access to street (5th floor elevator ride)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Harrison1457
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2009. The hotel was in the best location you could wish for. It was located a short walk away from Times Square so you are right where the action is. The hotel was very clean and the bedrooms were nice. They were pretty basic but had everything you needed, lets face it you are not in your room for long when in New York anyway so a comfy bed is just what we needed!! We stayed in a high up room with lovely views of the manhattan skyscrappers. The reception was very busy when we checked in but the staff were friendly and welcomed us with the lovely amercian hospitality. We would definately stay at this hotel again and we thought the price was very good too for the location of the hotel. We have recommended this to our friends and they loved it too!

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: bruggsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for the first part of out honeymoon in the states. What a lovely, clean hotel with warm and engaging staff. The location was hard to beat, literally step out the front door and you are in broadway /time square. Room was perfect and had a lovely view over the manhattan skyscapers. Nice little rooftop bar to chill out after a day exploring the big apple. Wont hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and will use again when we return. Free internet in the foyer as well was great to catch up on facebook!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service + Best Location”
Reviews.Author: DeltaBoy3
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING SERVICE + BEST LOCATION, This is my 3rd visit to this hotel in 10 years, this time we stayed 5 nights. You can't beat this location as its only 1/2 block to Times Square and our room on the 29th Floor also had a magnificent view of Times Square. Its close to and within walking distance of everything the, Subway System, David Letterman Theater, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, Liquor store, Drug store, USS Intrepid Aircraft Carrier. Numerous Broadway Theaters were 1/2 to 6 blocks away. We got tickets the day of for "Wicked" in the second row for only $131. All the hotel staff were helpful, especially Arielle who answered our questions about where to go and what to see. We had breakfast in the restaurant and I recommend the breakfast oatmeal made with steel cut oats with freshly sliced banana and a toasted brown sugar topping....yummy !! The Wi-Fi was very fast. Bathroom amenities were great and included a nail file, sewing kit, 2 types of body wash, shampoo, bar soap etc and they are all certified green which is important to me. The bed was very comfortable and had a duvet. Good security as they have a doorman and security cameras too. If you're going to NY stay here, its the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCraig
Reviews.Content: We lucked out picking this one. Walking distance to everything, shows, stores and Time Square. Wicked was playing less than a short block away and Spiderman was two short blocks away. The restaurant off the lobby had slow service but the best porridge for breakfast ever (see the picture I took). The rooms are a 3 diamond standard (a little sparse, picture attached) but they do have a safe, flatscreen TV, nice bathroom amenities and the room was also very clean. They have a Free business centre to print off your boarding pass but you do have to pay for wifi in your room. The front desk staff were always very pleasant no matter what time you went past the desk and Arielle the Executive Assistant was extremely friendly and helpful with information, the attitude of the staff definitely comes as an example from upper management. Lots of European clients in the hotel making it feel very international. Just a quick walk away is Connolly's Pub (it was our favourite in the area) and then if you want to take the subway to MarkJoseph Steakhouse....WOW great food and service (261 Water Street)

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay, central location”
Reviews.Author: duchessdovecote
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here during Hurricane Irene incident, unfortunately due to Gold Medal Travel failing to look after us the holiday was a disaster. However we could not fault the hotel, especially Yves, who helped us attempt to book a flight home after ours was cancelled. The hotel is in a great place, we had a family room with 2 double beds and my in laws had a room for 2, theirs had been reburbed and was really nice, our room hadnt but was fine, nice and clean and spacious. Left to Gold medal we would had to stay a further week, but the hotel did try to guarentee our rooms and be as helpful as they could be in this awful situation. They also left a birthday card for our daughter and some chocolates which was a nice touch. I would book this hotel here again, nothing beats the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no problems, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Meahcat
Reviews.Content: Booked with travel agent and after reading reviews thought it was going to be cheap and nasty, but actually it was nice and would recommend. can't comment on staying with children as we didn't have any nor did we eat there as we wanted to try others. When we arrived we were allowed to check in 2 hours early and staff were very friendly. Room was fine, tv with sat, money safe, cleaned good everyday, our room over looked times square. there's a information desk which is open all day which they reccomend places and give leaflets. Nice bar terrace which over looks times square with great views. Location is brilliant, 2mins walk to central park, 8 to rockafella, 20 to empire, we walked everywhere even to ground zero and back. When you check out you can leave bags at hotel for as long as you want, no problems, would stay again, don't let other reviews put you off

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and best value for money for a trip in New York”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located, Novotel is an excellent hotel for family. Close to Times square (less than 5 mininute walk), view on Times square from our room and close to subways, you can reach downtown, uptown, Central park easily. The service was fine and friendly in ways that you feel well. Lot of facilities available but internet usage is not free! The breakfast buffet is perfect and the best value for money in NYC. We enjoyed staying at Novotel and stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “'The City that Never Sleeps'”
Reviews.Author: Floops56
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May 2011 and have to say the location is great!! Right around the corner from the theatres, shops, subway is close by - everything on your doorstep - except Tiffanys... Seriously though, had read reviews on TA and have always found them to be reliable so kinda knew what to expect. The check-in is on the 5th floor, no issues except we had booked a room with a wonderful view of 'Times Square' - well all depends on your interpretation of wonderful. Got moved to a room which, if you craned your neck, you got a view of Times Square but hey, who comes to NYC to stay in your room?? Just a few minutes walk from the Hotel there are subway stops-bit hard to navigate at times but value for money for travelling, vendors on street corners selling tours and the Hotel is within walking distance from the Port Authority Terminus for buses to Woodbury Common - the outlet stores - so worth a visit and bring an empty suitcase because you will need it for transporting all those designer goods home..... Had drinks one night at the Hotel and they are a bit expensive compared to say TGI's where you have happy hour but it is nice sitting on the balcony sipping a cocktail overlooking Times Square. The room has everything you would expect - shower in bath, toiletries, hair-dryer, ice station just at the top of each floor; we had a twin double room and no issues, clean laundry etc... Upon check-out the Hotel have the facility to leave your suitcases in a room until you are ready to leave but it is a bit at your own risk as everyone leaves their suitcase here and its not monitored. Just one other thing, double glazing does not drown out the noise of the taxis - it really is the city that never sleeps so you hear taxis tooting and sirens going all night - made me feel like I was in an episode of 'The District'. A short subway ride to Grand Central Station on the subway is a must for people watching too. All in all a value for money Hotel, close enough to most things or within a subway ride, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location and a standard 4* Accor hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMCJR
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been at Novotel New York Times Square last May 2011, and the word to resume my stay is LOCATION. The hotel is in the heart of Midtown, walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, etc. Also 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, MacyÂ´s, Grand Central Station and other well known NY ex libris are near by. The hotel is a 4* standard from Accor (theyÂ´re pretty much the same around the world) where efficiency is a most. The lobby is on the 5th floor and itÂ´s huge, very modern and nice with lots of natural light. The balcony sorroundings the floor gives you nice sights to Times Square. ThereÂ´s also a bar with good cocktails / snacks and the restaurant where the breakfast (itÂ´s not amazing and I consider over priced) is served . Staff is friendly and helpful (despite the confusion with the porterages while checking out). The room surprised me as it was bigger than IÂ´m used to in NY. It was recently renowed and provided an expected 4* facilities and amenities. The only fault I found during my stay was an yoghurt pack that were on the mini bar when I arrived (and it seemed to be there for a while) and stayed there until I went. I let it on purpose and informed the reception during the check out... Overall the hotel is a good choice to consider when looking for an hotel in Midtown, and the prices are competitive. I do recommend it for travellers who expect an standard stay with some confort .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Coco_nuts0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in Times Square. I went 3 times in three years in this hotel because this is realy a good value for money. You have to know that the hotels in NYC are expensive. The rooms have been refreshed and are nice. You can find very better hotels in NYC but not at this price. It is a good compromise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at walking distance to Time Square!”
Reviews.Author: Lizivipa
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. Lots of tourist. Room was great, but if you like a nice cold room, the a/c wasn't working right even though maintenance checked it. Great breakfast and lounge bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Nakitravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location with only a minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway shows! We were on the 26th Floor and had a wonderful view of the city. Staff were friendly and professional. The room was spacious and clean. We would recommend this hotel to other travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, shame about the customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: katies_hol
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were surprisingly spacious for such a central hotel, generally fairly clean and very convenient location for all the sights and subway! The customer service at the front desk was very disappointing, rude and unhelpful at any interaction we had with them despite our polite and friendly approach. This was really surprising as this has never been an issue with any other Novotel/ Accor hotel I have stayed in! It did really let the hotel down to the extent that I would not stay here again because of it. If the service had been polite (I don't want over the top, just polite in the event I HAVE to speak to someone at the front desk- for example if my key becomes de-magnetised and wont let me in!) then I would use this hotel again, but service which makes you dread something like that happening is clearly very wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: KasperJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and well functioning. there is a nice outside bar with a great view to Time Square. Our room was great, also with a nice view. The bed was big. If you want to stay close to central park and Times Square, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for eight nights from July 2 to July 10. It was very nice....large clean room...the hotel restaurant is resonable and the food is great. It is one block from Times Square and is just far enough away to be outside the hugh crowds. Interestingly enough the bed in the room doesn't come with a top sheet...we asked for one and it was sent up right away. We enjoyed the roof top bar. All in all I would strongley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay. Very accessible to times square and other points of interest. Food is bit expensive, good view from room, reception is very accomodating, if you are interested to watch broadway shows this hotel is the best location to stay. everything is just a stone throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: spark1es18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for my 30th birthday because it was very decently priced for the great location. The location is awesome, literally just around the corner from Times Square. The lobby is beautiful and check in was really easy, no problems at all and the front desk personnel were very nice. The only problems we had with the staff was the concierge, he didn't seem to have any idea what we were asking for when we wanted to know a good steak restaurant. He seemed surprised we were even asking. The room was nice larger than expected, but it had not been properly cleaned from the people who stayed their before us. There was an empty juice bottle next to the bed on one side, candy wrappers on the other side, and skittles scattered under the window. Otherwise the room seemed well maintained and the bathroom was clean, beds fresh. The beds were comfy but the temperature was iffy. We were there in January and had to open the windows to cool the room off, we weren't able to adjust the temperature. I think this may be an old building issue and not a maintenance problem. Overall we were satisfied with the hotel, the good outweighed the bad. I did read most of the reviews on this hotel prior to my trip and so I think maybe I was more prepared for a New York style hotel than some.

Reviews.Title: “accessibility for disability”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband uses a wheelchair (paraplegia) and we found the roll-in shower fantastic. the hotel is very central and in a se rue location. NB When visiting NY the Greyline tours are wheelchair accessinle

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate”
Reviews.Author: dansin1
Reviews.Content: Okay...could be cleaner. I tried not to think about the dirty situations. Each day I thought the areas that were dirty from before I arrived, would be cleaned. Did not happen..I have definitely stayed in worse places. Great location and will probably stay again if I get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: laurakmahon
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel at all. It's in the heart of literally everything. 1711 was our hotel room, King Size City View. Housekeeping came everyday with fresh bed sheets, and towels for the bathroom. Didn't hear any traffic, nor any other noises surrounding the hotel. The lobby & the balcony on the 7th floor is amazing. The views you get from the balcony onto times square are simply wonderful. I couldn't tell you what the staff where like at this hotel due to the fact that I didn't spend all my time there, but what I experienced from checking in and out, they were friendly and very welcoming. They were not rude in anyway and all the front desk men downstairs with the baggage also said everyday to have a lovely one! Food at the hotel is reasonably priced, but there are many restaurants around the area which you could visit. Overall, an amazing stay at Novotel Hotel & will defiantly be returning again!! Thank you for an amazing 7 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My flight arrived late and I arrived at 1:00 AM to find the room I was assigned was 2 double beds NOT the King I had reserved. The young lady at the desk said they would have another room for me the next day after 3:00 UGH! Pack up and move again. She was not accommodating at all and a bit put out that I should be inquiring about my original reservation. Not what I wanted after a very long and delayed flight. When I got to my room I called down to ask for a top sheet for the bed and was told hotel policy was that the duve` was all i could get. When pressed she (the same young lady at check in) annoyingly said to wait and put me on hold. In the time on hold I discovered I could remove the feather tic from the cover and use that as a top sheet. (It was very warm in NY) I hung up and never heard back. The next afternoon I went to the front desk and a very lovely young lady helped into my new room. When I inquired about another cover for the bed and what I was told the night (very early morning) before she looked at me very confused and said she would take care of it. Not 5 minutes after I was in my room a very nice man delivered a duve` cover as a top sheet for me and said if there was ANYTHING at all I needed to please let him know. (this is the Novotel I know) I was very pleased to see Gerard and Heather in the bar area that night!!! What wonderful people and so accommodating! Always wonderful to see familiar faces! The food at your hotel is wonderful but your staff leaves a lot to be desired. My second morning at the hotel I ordered oatmeal thinking it would be easy and fast. 30 minutes later as I was getting up from the table to leave for a business meeting it arrived. Unacceptable! I think I am most disappointed because we (my 2 colleagues and myself) chose your hotel over many others due to the wonderful service the year before. I am certainly willing to give this hotel another try because everyone has an off day. But would hope the service, especially late at night and at breakfast would be more welcoming and that reservations are honored for the room reserved. I would like to end by praising once again Gerard and Heather's service! I look forward to seeing them again on future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!! Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Nikkirobby
Reviews.Content: First of all, my boyfriend and I only paid Â£250 each for 5 nights in this hotel - which I'm sure you'll agree is amazing value for the middle of NYC! The location is just unbelievable, of course you know it's central but I was shocked at just how central! Across the street from Jersey Boys, and we could see Wicked from our window!! Before I bombard you with more positives, another huge aspect is how helpful the staff are, on our second last night we withdrew the last of our money only for the ATM not to give us it - obviously we were both completely panicking and upset and they couldn't do enough for us and rang everyone they could think of - the bank itself, a number on the ATM - even the company that made it! And were genuinely concerned for us, most staff wouldn't usually care! especially in somewhere so busy - and with much more important clientele staying than us. From beginning to end it was just faultless, when we walked into the foyer we thought we were in the wrong hotel! it was just gorgeous, the bar/restaurant is glass fronted The view is amazing, get yourself out onto the balcony, it was deserted with loads of comfy chairs and loungers and you can just watch Times Square go by. The room was just beautiful, cleaned everyday HUGE bed! Blackout curtain, breathtaking view, gorgeous (very posh) bathroom - I loved the light up mirrors! and I couldn't believe how quiet it was considering we were in the city that never sleeps. Loved the ice machine on our floor! that was a first for us and we always had ice tea at the end of our day before bed, really romantic haha! This was our first time in New York and this hotel made it so much more amazing, I still can't get over the value and recommend it to everyone! I wouldn't even consider looking at staying anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “business trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: AplusJ Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel for the 2nd time. great value - even given the fact it's located at the times square! rooms are big and clean, staff is very friendly and i enjoyed to start the day with a workout at the gym with a view over nyc. roof top bar is not really "roof top", but you have a great view on the times square! only a few minutes to walk to the most tourism points of manhattan. within a walking distance you find a lot of great restaurants therefore it is not necessary to eat at the hotel - and the value of the food isn't the best. not bad food... but also no really good... but expensive. will stay there during my next visit too!

Reviews.Title: “First time stay ...will not be back next time I visit NYC”
Reviews.Author: Trojan4Life
Reviews.Content: Location of Novotel is a good 10 blocks to the heart of Time Square. The hotel is in the same building as a McDonalds, Duane Reader, Victor's Cafe and Gallagers. The Dave Letterman show is just 2 blocks away from the hotel. Once you enter the hotel, you have to take an elevator to the the main lobby. When we were there, there were many French tourists that seems to stay at this hotel. The bell hop/door man isn't very friendly and courteous and neither is the staff who works in registration. I arrived at 6 am Sunday morning and attempted to see if I could check in earlier. The guy in the registration desk took my ID and credit card and told me that I couldn't check in until 3 pm. Seeing that I had the whole morning and afternoon to kill, I checked in my bag for safe keeping and walked around Time Square. I arrived back to the hotel at 1pm only because I grew tired from my red-eye flight and waited at their lobby. It was very upsetting that while I waited til "3 pm" to check in, there were numerous groups/people that were checking in at 1:30pm when they arrived at the hotel. It was only because I saw this while in the lobby that I finally was able to check in even though they weren't going to let me check in until the 3 pm time slot. The room was very small. Very small desk. The carpet was hard and not padded. The bathroom was very "minimalistic" and didn't have enough counter for 1 person's toiletries much less two or more. The shower must be a European style type with the shower head coming from the top and only had a 1.5 inch barrier on the floor to keep the water from wetting the rest of the tile floors. Personally, there were locations that were a lot closer to Time Square and I was disappointed overall with this hotel and would not stay at this particular one in future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop patio for a drink but...”
Reviews.Author: LMSnyc7
Reviews.Content: The food is terrible - overpriced and nearly inedible. No matter how hungry you think you are, don't do it. Walk one block to 9th ave. and there are many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Times Sqr”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For the price, you would expect a 5 star hotel. The public areas fit the bill of a 5 star hotel, but the rooms and customer service are a disappointment. The location is great, right in Broadway district and close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near times Square”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Novotel Times square was enjoyable except for the lousy dinner service in the restaurant...no service. trumped up waiters who had no polish....dont waste your time or money...heaps of other great eateries. Room comfortable but shabby...dirty carpet and cracked bath and basin posed health risks we felt. New York great so we didn't let these issues spoil our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Fab locaion!”
Reviews.Author: taha23
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great base, with easy access to all the sights this is your place! its set right on times square and barring a troubled checkin we would always look to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Already Booked Again”
Reviews.Author: kthorne1989
Reviews.Content: We had booked for a few days to take place in the week between christmas and new year. There was a snowstorm in New York that meant all incoming flights were cancelled. No worries we got onto the travel agent and rebooked the holiday flying out new years day. We got to the hotel and the check in foyer is upstairs so you get a lift upto there and we were greeted by a very pleasant man called Ian Stergar. He advised us on what we could do and where we could go and what to watch out for and recommended some places to eat. Anyway we were given a room on the 29th floor which was perfect, People tend to go on about the size of hotel rooms in New York but our room was bigger than most we stay at in England. It was just a superior king room but we could view over broadway and also Times Square so it was spectacular. We have rebooked and we are going for a week next year and would recommend to anyone who asked about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, miserable staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tracysagar
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in New York. The hotel was in a great location. We had a room on the 16th floor at the back so there was no noise from traffic which was great. The room was fine although the bathroom was a little worn. It would have been great to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The big downside to the hotel was the staff, they were all miserable. The outside bar area was busy and on the two occasions we went for a drink, we had to ask to be served and the barman on duty was surly and rude. Unfortunately the rest of the staff encountered were not much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but so-so rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a "deluxe Times Square View" room and the reservation offered a free upgrade. The romm we were offered did have a Times Square view, but was far from deluxe - it looked as though it had barely survived a rowdy party. The hotel did find us a room in good condition, but without the view. After much debate and protest we were credited $10 per night for the downgrade. After that the hotel was fine, except for slapdash housekeeping and periodic long lineups at reception.

Reviews.Title: “could see time square”
Reviews.Author: SheriBobLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel always has great service. Good breakfast buffet, close to shows and of course great resturants. I love that the lobby is off the street level.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The motel was very clean and welcoming. the staff welcomed us and any questions we had were able to assist. wel done. The motel was very clean and welcoming. the staff welcomed us and any questions we had were able to assist. wel done.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: taramahon
Reviews.Content: Not up to standard. Not particularly friendly. Room not maintained - mouldy food in the fridge. Complaints have been ignored. These honeymooners were very very unimpressed with the lack of service, empathy or professional pride. It was an expensive and comes from a brand that I recognize and had previously trusted to provide a high level of service and care.

Reviews.Title: “Nine floors above rush hour! Happy hour indeed!”
Reviews.Author: parkca01
Reviews.Content: Outdoor bar = FANTASTIC. Overlooking Times Square. Drinks: Pricier than Madison Square Garden (I'm not joking). Also, at 530pm, they closed off half of the deck for a private party. That kind of stunk. The room itself was on the opposite side of times square but still a decent view. Surprisingly, the hotel was quiet. I heard a bit of street traffic, but slept right through the overnight thunderstorm. The place is in a great location, the lobby and outdoor bar truly is stunning. Rooms are mediocre but if you're in NYC you're not really there for the hotel room. Elevators are a bit slow, there is a charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Cant get more central for New York”
Reviews.Author: Mickmc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Novotel Times Square and could barely fault it. Great location 2 blocks off times square and with 2 different subway stations within 2 blocks. Staff were helpful and the view from the bar balcony was exceptional (10 stories high overlooking times square). Only issue (and I'm splitting hairs here) was it took a 10 floor elevator ride to get to the lobby then a 10-20 floor ride from there to your room and reverse to get back to street level. But the room was excellent, clean and well maintained with a comfortable bed. Access to Times Square, the Rockefella Centre and Central Park is all easy by foot and the rest of Mannahattan can be reached by the 2 subway stations within 2 blocks, plus all the broadway theaters are within are few blocks. Overall, a great spot to explore New York from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Glauber1
Reviews.Content: Located almost at same distance from Times Square and from Central Park. Concierge well prepared. The staff wants to help you every time. We feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very good restaurant but not so good experience”
Reviews.Author: GuyVanHooveld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far from Times Square and the local attractions. There is an elevator to bring you to the reception. The restaurant is very good and reasonably priced compared to similar offerings in the neighbourhood. Breakfast is very classical. The view from the restaurant is very nice and there is a terrace. Rooms are good and not too large, but a serious turn down was the noise of the elevator (the room was close to the elevator and we could hear everything - the good news is that the elevator was not used a lot in the middle of the night). The safe was locked when we got the room and it took quite some time to get this solved. The staff is quite impersonal and quite inefficient as far as I am concerned. We had an issue with an Accor promotion (free breakfast for any reservation in the US in very large characters in numerous emails, "depending on availability" in very small characters - typical "borderline" marketing). The issue was in fact with Accor, not the hotel itself, but it has been a nightmare to get the attention of a manager to get the problem solved. At the end, they proposed half a solution by giving breakfast coupons for one day, which was a positive gesture from the hotel, but the original issue has not been addressed. We decided to leave it there and to concentrate on our trip. Overall the hotel is good, comfortable (except for the noise), the food is good, the location is good, but the service has been less professional than I would have expected. The best person to help us has been a person working for reservations. Another thing is that internet is not free, the price is not exaggerated for a week, but you need to pay per device which is ridiculous nowadays (We usually travel with two smartphones, a laptop, an iPad, this is the 21st century...). One last comment: the Novotel chain is French and several employees do speak French - this could be important/useful to French visitors.

Reviews.Title: “middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: starflyergold
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Novotel Times Square as my normal haunt the Sofitel was just too expensive. The hotel is centrally located at 52nd St/Broadway and ideally located for any tourist activities (if one must). The entrance at street level is rather glum and down heel, up an elevator to the 7th floor lands you on the lobby and restaurant floor. The lobby is bright and airy. Unfortunately at 1 pm my booked room was not ready and I was told by the altogether not too friendly receptionist at the separate A-Club check in counter that I would have to wait til 3 pm which is official check in time. I wasn't too happy about the lack of welcome or the wait time after a transatlantic flight but at least one of the other staff got on the case and after an hour I got my room. Despite the reservation stating "KING BED WONDERFUL TIMES SQUARE VIEW" the view was of the back of buildings onto 8th Av. so technically not what I had booked but I was happy to get to my room. A voucher for an A-Club Platinum drink was handed over at check in. The corridors are bland and slightly worn out as was the room. Wear and tare has not been kind to the hotel and while there was nothing seriously wrong with the room it certainly showed its age and lack of upkeep. The bathroom was standard tourist size and not exactly spotlessly clean. Toiletries were unbranded Novotel and nothing special. The bed was large with a thin duvet and a good choice of pillows. Sleep quality was ok though unfortunately the air condition (despite what the display said) had only two settings: off and arctic rendering the duvet too flimsy to be warm (outside temperature was 39c so aircon was a must). Internet access was only available via paid wifi and if like me you travel with more than one laptop and iphone you must pay for each gadget's access separately which was very expensive and not acceptable. Very positive (and better than the Sofitel) was the fact that all TV channels were available in HD. The restaurant served a decent buffet breakfast ($25) which was good and offered great views over Times Square. The best part of the hotel was the outside terrace which had plenty of seating (limited service during the day) and is available to smokers. Room service was good and well priced. I had a fantastic steak and frites one night which was better than the equivalent in the Sofitel. I had arranged for a late check out which was confirmed on the day of departure for which I was very grateful. The rates were very high and 4 nights came to $1840. However it should be noted that all hotels during this week were expensive or sold out. Verdict: The Novotel is a standard tourist hotel and while basic in many respects offers a decent service. It is not luxury or even upmarket but if you get a good rate it should be fine. Some more loving attention to maintenance, customer service (though some receptionists were great, the initial welcome was not) and cleaning would make it better. While A-Club Platinum members per rules get nothing other than points at Novotel I was offered a drinks voucher and late check out. Points were credited correctly within 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Mobile Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reunion041
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that the European Travel Agency sold this hotel to us as a "Four Star Hotel" which it is definitely NOT! My rate sgl occupancy was close to $300 the first night, and over $300 the second. No Coffee service in room, No comp Newspaper delivered to room, No refrigerator, No bathroom magnifying mirror, Carpet looked dirty and was threadbare with black stains in several areas. I did not receive requested wake-up call on June 8th making me late for an appt. No guest comment card in room. Left luggage with bellman for later flight. When we returned and gave Bellman our claim ticket, he brought one large piece of luggage together with our luggage that did not belong to us. In other words, we could have taken that luggage as well. I found this disturbing. Check-in was efficient, Breakfast Buffet very good. Restaurant and Bar Service also very good. However, to rate this a 4 star, it would have to have a distinctive setting with expanded amenities and exceptional service, to create a luxury experience. These services may include but not limited to automatic bed turn-down service, valet parking, 24 hour Room Service, Complimentary shoe shine, etc. I believe this hotel currently has a 3 star Mobile rating which is the only official Hotel rating system in America.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in N.Y. City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was up to our expectations.. Only points we wanted to be able to make Tea/Coffee in the room. No facilities. Also Refridgerator no room to put own drinks this not a huge problem as had no milk for above and there was ice available so this meant we could keep beer wine cold.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time at this hotel and it was as good as I remembered. Excellent location, and my request on booking for a view of Time Square was met. A good hotel for the price in New York with easy access to shops, and theatres.

Reviews.Title: “fab!!!comfortable beds ,soft towels ,lovely bath and shower nice staff amazin will o back”
Reviews.Author: MancesterKatleen
Reviews.Content: fab amazin!!re fab staff particular domestic !brill beds g oreous room 20017

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Louise_Loughlin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a brilliant location. Having stayed on 34th - 37th street on times previously visited the city 52nd street was the place to be. We had a great time. First night we were cold and asked for more duvets along with extra pillows as we only had one each and within minutes there was a knock on the door with what we asked for!! Subway across the road to take you to downtown attractions, bar is expensive but no more than you expect if staying in Times square. Sales were on in shops which really made a difference to our shopping budget. All in all would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: gaylest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for New York within walking distance to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square. The Business Centre was free which I found unique but very much appreciated. The staff were friendly and helpful, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfort all round”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemumtravel
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The room was comfortable and large enough for my husband and I and our 2 1/2 year old. The location is great and the views if times square, particularly at night are fantastic. We didn't eat at the restaurant but had room service a few times and were more than happy with the food and service. The rooms are cleaned well. The concierge wasn't all that friendly, which was a shame as all other staff we had dealings with were fantastic. No free Internet in rooms - which isn't the standard ant more - disappointing. Relied on Starbucks providing wifi during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel -with reservations”
Reviews.Author: cbburgess
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend stay at Novotel NYC times square (May 20-22). The location is great, the lobby is very attractive and the employees were all quite friendly. That being said, the rooms are bland and not well kept. Our bathroom faucet was so loose, it almost fell off. Vent covers were laying on the floor and drawer fronts fell off in our hands. While the windows open slightly from the top (which is a plus) one of the stoppers was missing on one window and I was afraid it was going to fall on one of our small children. The carpets were miserably stained in our room and throughout the hotel. My children found game pieces, m&ms and toenail clippers that must have belonged to previous guests-apparently housekeeping does not vacuum. We neatly grouped our beverage bottles for housekeeping to take away the second day-a family of four goes through a lot of water and iced tea-not to mention a few beers for dad! Housekeeping never touched them. All in all, we got a good deal on Expedia for this hotel- I would have been really dissapointed if we had paid a lot more. Also, how much time is really spent in your hotel room in NYC? However,, as a matter of principle they should do a better job. I would have said something upon checking out , but no one asked how our stay was. By that time I was just tired and had a long drive ahead of me to get home. Hope this review is helpful to someone!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: carolmurphyuk
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends just came back from a six night stay at this hotel. The location is brill so near everything. We booked last August and asked for a Superior Double Double room with a good view. We checked in and went to our room on the 15th floor, what a disappointment, carpet really shabby, room tiny, view of a noticeboard if we could have stretched our necks to the right we might have seen Broadway and Times Square, room was only set for two people, two towels, two glasses etc. We were so disappointed and got in touch with reception straight away, the female receptionist had an attitude, and could only offer us a larger room without a view, apparently room is only superior if it has a view of Times Square. We were then allocated a room on the 12th floor at the back of the hotel, room was the same as the first one only it was 3 foot longer and we were given a portable 3 foot bed to go in the gap between double bed and wall. Room was approx 15 foot long. Again only set for two people, but Housekeeping immediately brought us towels, glasses etc. I spent the week sleeping in the portable bed!!!! We were waiting for our luggage to be brought from the first room and decided to go out to eat, when we arrived back luggage still not there, plus we had a male traveller who had also been allocated to sleep in our room, we all went down to Reception to sort it!!!! We decided just to put up with the room. Hotel main areas were good would say 5 star but the rooms definitely only 3 star. The double room is really only for two people and not four adults.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: CTR
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Novotel New York Times Square - both trips being for a seven night stay - and on both occasions the experience was faultless! The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and are very well presented. All of the staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful and make a special effort to meet with particular requests wherever possible. We had a room on 29th floor, with an unobstructed view along Broadway into Times Square and beyond - such an incredible view really helped to 'set the scene' for a fantastic trip to such a vibrant city. The hotel's location is perfect - Times Square is adjacent, the Time Warner Center a short walk away - as is Central Park - and numerous theatres, bars and restaurants are nearby. Also in walking distance is the Rockefeller Center (visit to the 'Top of the Rock' was superb), Radio City Music Hall and Carnegie Hall. I definitely intend staying at this hotel again when I next visit Manhattan, and have recommended it to friends and colleagues: those who stayed there on my recommendation have also expressed their satisfaction with the Novotel New York Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Paulscott79
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great food great location. Breakfast a bit expensive but good quality

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever rude”
Reviews.Author: novotelhotelsucks
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was the worst ever. The maid stole my money and when I reported it to head security (William).I went to my room to retrieve the empty envelope that my money was in to give it to william, He was not there. So I told my story to Steve front desk manager and he said there is no William who works here. Then William showed up and Steve did not know who William was. the employees are rude and do not care about you at all. the # to the hotel is [-] it is no longer is service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Suggers
Reviews.Content: We stayed three night in NYC and this was our first trip. We decided to stay somewhere we thought central and picked this hotel because of this. We took a cab from Newark airport and it cost just under $100 inc a tip to transfer, pretty expensive but door to door convenience. The hotel is above the street level and to access reception on level 5 you take a lift. The lobby is pleasant and modern and we where on the 15th floor with a great view of times square. The room was great, with a large king bed and all the facilities you would want (expect coffee making!!). Almost right out of the front door and you are on Times Square and theatre land, although we coud not hear a think in the evening so no worries on that front for light sleepers. As for NYC, we took a day long tour with Real New York Tours and it was the best value for money I spent to whole trip. As a first timer we got to see everything together with a great guide who shared experience and knowledge that you would not get from a guide book. The place is huge and in three days we did not see everything we wanted. It rained hard the day we had planned for the statue of liberty so decided to take a look in the museums instead. The Guggenheim is a masterpiece and the American Museum of Natural History can take you all day to get round. They are both across from each other East and West of Central park. One evening we got a subway to Greenwich Village. We were comfortable with the subway as a result of the tour we took, another good reason!! We really loved the atmosphere in the village, it had a student feel to it and reminded us of Bohemian districts back home. Some great bars and music to be had down in this district as well. Have a great time in NYC, we will definately be heading back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Festival13
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucks for the following reasons: We were informed by housekeeping that that hotel HEAT was turned off as it was "summer" Well it is was not summer it was the one of the worst storms in US history - deaths due to the storm in New Jersey even! No heat at the Novotel NYC!!! We asked for Heat. NO! was reply - seriously NO HEAT at the NOVOTEL in April in NYC 2011.!!!!! We asked for extra blankets - we were provided, finally at midnight, an extra duvee and cover, which we had to prepare and combine ourselves - two parts = duvee and cover - yes let's remake the whole bed - ourseleves, cause that's what I do do best at midnight. This is NOT service!!! Really really bad! this hotel sucks! They are very unreasonable and not prepared to service clients. We also had an issue with the Accor club suite. Not one person on staff could figure out the coffee machine in the Accor lounge - to the point that they finally got us a simple coffee from the bar. One would think they could offer a simple cup of coffee.... somewhere on site. This hotel really sucks for service - and we were friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Broadway at is Best”
Reviews.Author: altermanni Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was for 4 nights with my daughter (16) and we enjoyed the stay very much. First of all , the Location is perfect. Walking distance to Time Square, Central Park, Empire State and Rockefeller Center. A lot of Theatres around the Hotel. We saw "American Idiot". Perfect. The room was also perfect, with view at the Time Square. No noise at all. We enjoyed also the breakfast. We dinned two evenings and it was very good. The best Bartender at the Bar is Bertrand. A very nice guy and he takes really care about the guest. For sure, when we will come back to New York we will stay again in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for first time stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Grouch_P
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to New York and the Novotel was a great choice. Right in the heart of Time Square and within walking distance of most attractions. The hotel has a lovely large lobby and very friendly and helpful staff both on reception and at the concierge desk. The outside balcony area has wonderful views and is a sun trap when the sun comes out. The bedrooms are roomy considering its central location and comfortable if a little worn in terms of decor but that is not something that should put anyone off from staying here. All in all great value, great service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for tourists/visitors interested in experiencing the Times Square area with all its unique sights and sounds. The staff is very courteous, and when my TV wasn't working a staff member was at the door in less than 5 minutes. Nice people. I am Platinum in the A-Club program and may have gotten an upgraded room, I'm not sure. It is nicely furnished - good working area, fast internet service, electrical service at desk level, sofa facing a nice TV and large mini-bar. The hotel is very stylish in its common areas - great bar/lobby but worn and a bit grungy at the edges. The bed was rumpled and lumpy looking, and and the cover was not fully tucked in at the bottom at my arrival. Did I arrive before the maid had finished making up the room? Did a late-check-out guest couple take another romp between the sheets before leaving? I had the same problem as another guest who commented on the board, with getting the room cool enough to sleep, and had to resort to opening the window. It is surprising how much noise there is 32 floors up. All-in-all, a decent tourist class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Quady83
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Excellent location right at Times Square and within walking distance of many sights (Empire State Building, Central Park, etc.). I would definitely book This hotel again if I wanted to stay midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre district”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to walk from. Spent hours out and about. A bit startled by the entrance first night when I arrived late, but the hotel turned out to be fine and the staff were all very helpful. Everything in NY seemed expensive but I suppose this was good value for what and where it was located. Would use it again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, very closed to Times Square & Subway. We do not eat in the hotel. Starbucks & Deli open 24 hours on Broadway 100 mt away from Hotel. WIFI not expensive. Room quiet & clean

Reviews.Title: “Greedy”
Reviews.Author: stefanoflow
Reviews.Content: Room internet wireless: 10$. Dinner at restaurant: overpriced and tasteless. Buffet breakfast: 20$ per person. Luggage storage: 1$ (per item). At the end, we felt lucky that they did not charge us for flushing the toilet. If you can live without these services, you may want to consider this hotel for OK rooms and great views from a high floor. For the future, we will look elsewhere for better hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: rrt559
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was good, it is in a very good location for the theatre and all that times square has to offer, the rooms are alright but certinalty nothing to write home about and the noise from outside at night is rather loud. I would recommened this hotel to others mainly due to its location. Please be aware that when checking out and asking for a taxi to the airport they dont try and shove you into a limo or unlicenced vehicle, that final experience slighty ruined my experience of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shushh
Reviews.Content: We used the Novotel as base to explore New York during our one week stay over Christmas. The biggest pro for staying here would have to be the location and the price. It is half a block away from Times Square. The subway stations were also very close. We were on the 15th floor and the traffic noise was there but was a soft constant hum and didn't disturb our sleep. The rooms were modern and spacious. I'll some of the cons but they are minor and did not detract from our stay. The bathroom was clean enough but they were bits of tiles that have been chipped off and the panelling for the powerpoint was coming off. The beds were relatively comfortable however, the doona was quite thin. The only other minor thing to take into consideration is that you have to take a lift to the lobby and then take another lift to the rooms. This did not bother us but it is something that some people might want to know before hand.

Reviews.Title: “Strike two!”
Reviews.Author: elaterra
Reviews.Content: We stayed there once and the toilet backed up in the middle of the night. No one used it. We were offered a certificate to stay there again and against my better judgement, we went. The hotel is not equiped with air conditioning in the winter. Not even on those warm days we had. We stayed on a day that was about fifty degrees outside. In the hotel was about 80 degrees. The only thing they could offer was a fan and to open the window. Nothing like spending the night listening to the sounds of Time Square while you sleep. Thank goodness those construction workers got to work early the next morning. I would have forgotten where I was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,cool location”
Reviews.Author: Savur
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - just off the Times Square. We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel and everything was Okay, except for one thing - from time to time the was no clod water in the room with only hot one. It constantly took more then a minute to get cold water in the faucet, that was annoying. All the rest is very good, thought breakfast is slightly overpriced with its $25 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ejm26
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms. Great view. Huge bed! - very comfy! Wifi. Fitness suite. Looks the same as on website. Helpful staff. Perfect location. Previously stayed I'n hotel Pennsylvania with school which was awful. Went here with boyfriend for valentines 2011. Would definitely recommend and will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “AN ABSOLUTE TREASURE”
Reviews.Author: Gareth-Tina
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Novotel. What a great experience. Fantastic location, the best views of Times Square, clean, spacious and THE biggest most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The hotel is brilliantly located for absolutely everything. Times Square is literally a 2 minute walk from the front door. Theatres, restaurants and bars likewise. The only downside was no tea/coffee making facilities but hey there was a McDonalds 1 minute round the corner that did great coffee and the hotel have no objection to you taking food/drink to your room. In fact they even provide an ice machine on every floor to chill your JD. One tip - Don't buy a drink at the bar, 1 beer and 1 coffee $17. We used the Grayline bus tours 72 hour all loops. Fantastic value. Book before you go and save money. Also theatre tickets - cheap tickets are available daily at TKTS at Times Square. Don't use that office, go to the South Ferry Seaport on the downtown loop and use the TKTS office there. Much quieter and easier. We got great seats at Jersey Boys at a $0% discount. Places to eat - Ellens Starburst Diner and Emett O Lunneys on Times Square and THE best deli on the planet Carve on the corner of 8th Ave and 48th or 49th Street (can't remember which one). All in all a fabulous trip with wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfs56
Reviews.Content: Have just spent four days at Novotel Times Square with my 12 year old daughter. The location is fantastic right on the edge of Times Square and within walking distance of Broadway Shows, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, Empire State Building. Hotel is reasonably priced for New York, the rooms are spacious and clean with nice functional bathrooms. We had a great view over Times Square. John the Concierge is very helpful and with his directions we were able to find our way around the city. We had breakfast in the hotel but the only reason we did so is because with an adult kids eat free otherwise it would work out very expensive at $23 per adult. So for me I felt I got value paying that for me and my daughter. Lots of diners nearby much cheaper. All in all I would recommend the Novotel and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel was a major part of a great New York trip”
Reviews.Author: ADH2011
Reviews.Content: We'd been here over two years ago in November 2008 so we knew it had a fantastic location and offered good value for money. This time, with our two daughters, we booked in for five nights with confidence based on our previous experience. Novotel didn't let us down. Right from the start, with a warm welcome at the front desk in reception from Ian who gave us some great tips for our stay, we felt relaxed, secure and assured. All the staff offered the same level of courtesy with humour and patience. Even when we wrongy reported the hairdryer as not working! Room service was quick and friendly and the bar staff were also helpful. The hotel has a stylish interior that belies its modest exterior appearance. The bar area is very comfortable and has is great for people watching as it is adjacent to the reception area. The room we had was comfortable, with all the fixtures yoo'd expect. We did pay extra to get a Boradway/Times Square view but this is worth it as it is spectatcular, especially from the 29th floor where we were. On our last day we left luggage with the hotel staff on the ground floor for a very reasoable $1 a bag and then they arranged a car to take us to the airport when we had to leave.
