If we return to New York then we shall book in at te Novotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: susansings
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Novotel Times Square and found it a very good choice for our family. It's clearly popular with an international cliente and although it seemed like a very busy place our needs were always taken care of. It's very convenient to theaters, museums and restaurants. Even though it overlooks the hustle and bustle of Times Square the hotel rooms were extremely quiet. Normally very sensitve to noise, I had no problem here. We had a king room with a sleep sofa. The room was stylish, a decent size and the beds were comfortable. WiFi was available for $9.95 per day. We drove to New York and were able to park at a garage across the street for $30/day - reasonable by New York standards. We didn't eat at the restaurant, Cafe Nicole, but had a lovely cheese platter and drinks at the attractive bar area in the lobby. The 24 hour fitness center is very well equipped with weight machines, treadmills that allow you to connect your iPod, Wii fit, etc. It would be nice if the rooms had coffeemakers, but other than that our room had everything we needed. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “New York 2011 Trip”
Reviews.Author: shoegirlmilwaukee Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We go to NYC once a year for 4-5 days. This was the second time we stayed at the Novotel and I would definately stay there again. Very good value. Even though the rooms could use updating, they are nice size and hotel location is excellent. Also, very nice bar/lounge area, but closes a little early. A couple of nights we got back at 11:00pm and bar was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: AEG130189
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an amazing location and great value for money. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are very basic and quite small but with so much to see and do in New York you don't spend much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bee2011
Reviews.Content: I have been to New york Twice and on both occasions, I have stayed at the Novotel Times Square. to be honest, I really dont want to stay anywhere else. The hotel is great! The best thing about the hotel is its location. Right in the heart of Times Square, within walking distance to central park, Brooklyn bridge, Battery Park and so many other awesome NYC attractions. The walks are not always quick, but there is so much to see along the way so we didnt mind. From the breakfast room there was a stunnning veiw of times square. There are also countless broadway musical shows litereally on the doorstep of this hotel. Also within a 2 minute walk was the Subway, so you couls get anywhere in NYC with ease! You simply cannot go wrong with this location! The hotel itself is average. The rooms were were not that big. But it was comfortable enough for us, and it was always 100% clean which is the most important thing. It is a typical 3* Hotel, so dont expect anything too fancy. I found that it was however great value for the price we paid, taking into account how expensive the hotels in Times Square are. Staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge was particularly helpful. PS*** You have to try the chicken wings at the bar - WOW! :-) For an affordable place to stay, that is clean and comfortable, in the heart of times square, this one gets the thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would definitely go back there”
Reviews.Author: SueRCheshire
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - the room was the biggest we've had in New York, very clean and modern. The bed was really comfortable, plenty of lovely soft pillows, very clean. Great view of the city - we could just see Times Square. Loved the bathroom, so clean, and lovely white fluffy towels changed everyday. Nice complimentary toiletries. Just so much space, and liked that it had a sitting area too (sofa and coffee table). The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We didn't eat there, but I believe the breakfasts are good. Did have a drink one night in the bar, which was a pleasant place to sit. Couldn't fault it - well done Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Lindtbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 9 yr old daughter feb' 11 on our 1st visit to NYC. Excellent location for everything we wanted to see. No noise from street on 17th floor and if u squashed your face on the window we had a view of Times square!! Staff weren't over friendly but the room was spacious and clean. Will definitely return:-)

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel - Novotel timesquare”
Reviews.Author: jesstaylor1987
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Novotel Timesquare for 4 nights in January 2011. The location is just pefect overlooking Timesquare and the rooms were fantastic, cleaned daily to a high standard, everything you need for a city break. The hotels bar and restaurant are lovely and both look over timesquare with great views. The hotel also has a good fitness centre. The Staff were really friendly and always extremely helpful to accomodate any requests, Would highly reccomend this hotel and will most definately stay at this hotel again when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location - cant complain”
Reviews.Author: LoveHolidaysuk1
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was brilliant, the staff were really kind and friendly and when i had an issue with my transfer going home, a member of staff rang them for me for free and sorted everything. We checked in really quickly and were given our room which was amazing, It was a great size and really modern and clean. There was a mini bar (this isn't free) and the bed was really comfortable and huge!! The bathroom was also really nice and you get given free amenities. There is also a safe, ironing board, LCD tv and hair dryer. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is only a minute (if that) from the centre of times square and in walking distance from 5th avenue, central park, the rockerfella center and the empire state. Its close to all the action such as theaters, restaurants and subways and because of this i don't think i would stay anywhere else if i visited new york again. The hotel is in a very safe area (especially as its on times square) so walking around at night time is fine and as NY never sleeps there is loads to do night and day! Overall i honestly cant fault the Novotel i was completely happy with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: So close to Times Square, Broadway Show, Subway Stn, prity much everything. Loved staying here, will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you needed in a hotel with Ideal Location- Our room overlooked a snow covered Times Sqaure'”
Reviews.Author: Finners1986
Reviews.Content: Great location Great service- on my Mums 50th room service provided drinks and chocolate truffles to our room. Cleaned daily with fresh towels, toiletries, Bed's made etc Fantastic Gym- being a fitness enthusiast I used the gym every morning prior to breakfast and great facilities and equipment available- fresh fruit and water provided too! Overall I would give it 9/10- great 5 days spent there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “need to learn to take care of customers”
Reviews.Author: kidNeutrino Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: BOO! These guys have a racket on the internet access. When I pointed out that their posting on Hotels.com was incorrect (misleading at best), the posting listed internet access available in every room in the bullets points. You have to go to a separate tab to get the information about it being a paid service. They refused to comp me the service. I am here for professional conference and I need access for my work. They need to learn that their brand is effected anytime your name is involved. The room is clean, the housekeeping staff is really sweet. Management you should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel New York”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally located close to all facilities (shops like Macy's) at Times Square. Staff wonderful and happy to oblige any requests.e.g request for a hot cup of water late at night to make a cup of tea. Spotless and luxurious rooms. Would stay at the Novotel again anytime. Really enjoyed our stay and thus enjoyed New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this Hotel.For any purpose...you can go walking to the theatre district, Fifith avenue,many places...and also almost in front of the Hotel has a Dollar to rent a car with Parking...so the best way for everything. The Atmosphere of this Hotel is very good.I really recomend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: S0Loud
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect. It's close to the 'Hell's Kitchen' area which had fantastic food and is about a 5 minute walk from 5th Avenue. The room was certainly very clean and comfortable, it felt a bit drab compared to similarly priced rooms but all can be forgiven when they're shooting an episode of 30 Rock right outside your window!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Big apple”
Reviews.Author: MsG85
Reviews.Content: 2 nd stay at the novotel. Flew into newark with continental got a taxi $80 including tolls and tip, can get cheaper transfer such as a bus. Arrived hotel allowed to check in 3 hours early without charge due to our flight time. Droppped our bags stayed in room on 17th floor, view of hudson river. Room basic but great and clean king size bed, couch and a TV. Bathroom - hairdryer rubbish take your own. Over all clean. Beware of visiting Hard rock cafe we got ripped off completely especially drinks with no prices!!! Highly recommend Bubba Shrimp near times square. Did the grayline bus trip which was fab and lots of shopping:-) Great holiday, hotel and the centre of everything it was perfect. Drinks in hotel bar a bit pricey, cheaper to eat out for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: bizzyinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11nights. This was our 2nd visit to the Novotel and our 3rd visit to New York as we love the place. Once again we were not disappointed our room was perfect we did not experience any problems. We had a room on the 28th floor as we were only sleeping in the room we weren't bothered about the view. The staff were extremely helpful especially Arelle. We would highly recommend this hotel. If you want a good cheap meal I would recommend Mama Sbarro on the corner of 49th St opposite side to Hersheys and only 3 blocks from the hotel on the left hand side. You can get a lovely meal for 2 with drinks for around 25 dollars even less if you have pizza.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. The hotel is quite nice and in a great location. This time the service was poor. TV stopped working in the hotel for nearly 24 hours and there was very little feedback as to what was happening. The bar area is clean and nice to have a drink in but the staff seem more interested in recommending restaurants to eat in and chatting at the bar. Overall service in the bar area is slack and pretty poor, you can wait 30 minutes for a drink. The hallways outside the rooms are pretty tired and are in need of an update. I do have to say as a regular to Novotel the rooms are what you'd expect but this Novotel is probably the worst i've stayed at for overall value and service. If your over 5 foot tall the shower is mounted and fixed so can be a pain when trying to get a good wash.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. Good Service. Not great downstairs with the doorman but past the first lift is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: Jackie10101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for one night only. Times Square really is right outside, which was great. But other than that I was greatly disappointed. The carpet in my room had some what seemed to me like bleach stains. The bathroom was very poorly made and equipped, I took a shower and after 5 minutes the water suddenly turned cold. On the other hand the faucet at the sink only had hot water. You could see that all the tiles were very irregular as if the person who attached them to the wall didn't use a ruler or anything. I opened the minibar to see what they offer and found a half empty coke bottle and an opened pack of cream cheese, basically from the person who stayed in this room before me, how disgusting. All the furniture in the room look very old and used with scratches and stains. In the morning I tried their breakfast buffet ($25 incl tax). The restaurant was the only pretty part of the hotel and had a nice view of the Times Square, but again, that was the only good thing about it. The buffet was very basic (aka small) with pancakes, sausages, bacon, potatoes, scrambled egg, some cold cheese and sausage, some fruit, orange juice (not fresh!), yoghurt and some pastries. No omelettes, no french toast. I liked the mozarella cheese which tasted very fresh, but they had no olive oil or balsamic vinegar for it that usually comes with mozarella. So overall I was happy to see Times Square for the first time in my life but I wouldn't choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good value but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: got a room with time square view times square is very far and my room wasnt exactly in the corner of the hotel so my view was there but very unimpressive ,doesnt worth the extra money lobby in upper floor ,small rooms with low ceiling very nice terrace for drinks only stay here if its your less expensive option

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Blackskull
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in jan 2011for my 50 th birthday,hotel was great,staff very friendly,concierge very knowledgeable.Bertrand the bartender was friendly and pleasant.would only like to say a coffee maker in the room would be good other than that hotel first class.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: l0uiset
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the best place, just up from times square and near to loads of beautiful restaurants. We didn't eat a meal at the hotel but the snacks were delicious and the prices similar to others in new york. The rooms were large by new york standards and had a beautiful view of the Hudson. Sofa, TV and massive bed in room. The bathroom could maybe do with updating but clean and had a great power shower. Would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ArnH8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this Hotel and I can say that I found it very pleasant. After doing a lot of research beforehand we found that it offered great value considering it's practically on Times Square. The rooms are nicely proportioned with just about everything you need, although the bathrooms could do with a bit of an upgrade. The service was good and the staff friendly and helpful. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: foxyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas. First visit to New York and this was the perfect location central to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway etc etc. All good walking distances. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. The staff were most helpful especially at this very busy time. The breakfast buffet choice was very good; room service menu reasonable and the public areas had fantastic views. Awesome watching the snow blizzard outside from the restaurant. I only have one fault with the hotel which is a minor one, and that is to have tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. We've travelled extensively and this is the first time we've come across this. However, a 24hr McDonalds in just around the corner! Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and had a very pleasant and comfortable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - With view of Times Square NYE ball drop”
Reviews.Author: mhowell999
Reviews.Content: The hotel bedrooms are standard business type - nothing special but no problems either. The location is great for all the Mid town attractions as it is on the corner of Broadway and you can easily walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockerfeller Centre, MOMA, etc. The subway is just around the corner to go downtown. Our rooms view was West and not of Times Square (to the South) but as we were on a cheap package deal I had not expected otherwise. We stayed here over new year and attended the New Year's Eve Gala Dinner/Dance in the hotel restaurant. Whereas the crowds below had to stand for hours in the cold to get a place in Times Square we enjoyed a great meal and live band and just popped out onto the balcony shortly before midnight to see the ball drop but, as you might expect, it was not cheap. As a cheaper option, if you were booked into the hotel you could eat elsewhere and then come back for a drink in the hotel bar and still then access a small part of the balcony set further back but still with a view of the ball drop at midnight (although there is no guaranteeing you will be able to do this in future years). Hotel residents needed a wristband to access the hotel on New Years Eve as the police have everywhere cordoned off for crowd control. As Brits we are used to tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms which this hotel does not have. However they do mix a good Cosmopolitan in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in NY”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkfan20
Reviews.Content: The staff at Novotel were great. We arrived in New York City in a blizzard,so some people were not able to catch flights or trains out of New York ..so many guests had to remain at the hotel. The staff were doing what ever they could to help them. All were very patient. All very cheerful. it was a great experience Great views also

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Times Sq Dec 2010”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and extremely helpful and friendly staff. Very good restaurant and bar. Rooms clean and tidy, although ours was a little small and due for a re-fit. Over all very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopelessholsbooker
Reviews.Content: My reviews is going to be pros and cons but don't be put off by the cons - it's easier to pick than to complement and I would stay here again. Part paid for holdiay with airmiles so don't really know about value for money. Pros. Rooms big enough for 2 adults and 2 teens (2 double beds) good bathrooms hairdryer that you don't have to keep your thumb on! shower gel, shampoo etc Great location 2 subways nearby easy to walk to almost anywhere internet free in reception Cons: Beds were small - when there are 2 beds in a room not enough space for clothes for 4 people - wardrobe pathetic - can't even close the sliding door air conditioning/heating noisey lighting - dim no tea/coffee making facilities arrived from london with friends who needed 2 rooms side by side - 1 was ready - 1 wasn't. Friend really not happy but people had paid for late checkout - not a good excuse - they should have been told that this wasn't possible - manager Steve, came out, calmed my friend down - he didn't get the room any earlier but his manner was very good. As I said - be aware but don't let this put you off - I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: Sue_2010186338
Reviews.Content: I took my grandaughter to New York for her 21st Birthday gift. We had a exelent stay. The Novatel has a great location within walking distance to all of the sights. Our room 2011 has a super view over Time's Square, was very clean, with comfortable beds. The staff in the reception area were all very helpful. The consiarge gave a 110% in helpfulness. Although we did not eat in the hotel - other guest that we spoke to highly recomended the food. We would definatly stay at the Novatel on a next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! The room is very nice and clean. The bed is comfortable. You have to take one of the two elevators from the street to the lobby on the 7th floor, which could be crowded at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable staff”
Reviews.Author: niltonag
Reviews.Content: I have been to Novotel in November/2010. At the check in they requested a credit card as a guarantee. I gave them my AMEX. On that occasion I told the employee I intended to pay with my VTM(Visa Travel Money) and she said that was ok. Nevertheless, they charged me on my AMEX without my permission. Don't trust them. They don't have a serious staff at the front desk. NILTON GUIMARAES

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at this hotel. we have always enjoyed the hotel and service, and highly recommend staying there to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel as a whole is nice. We only had a bit of problem to get in when we arrived because we did not know the hotel. The rotating door made us a bit confuse since we had four bags. The quality in general is nice, confortable. As we are Brazilians we like to have fruits in the breakfast time. The available fruits were all right, but watermellon was not so sweet as we are used here in Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for NYC”
Reviews.Author: stuosman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel TS in september. This is a fantastic 'mid range' hotel for touring the city. It is located right in the middle of town, a couple of blocks from Times Square. If you are looking for a high class hotel then this is not for you but this is by no means a down market establishment either. I would compare it to the standard of most city centre Holiday Inns and some of the reviews on here I feel have had bad luck with their stay rather than the hotel being generally poor. There is a fantastic bar (with a brilliant view) and a restuarant in the hotel if you want. They have a good breakfast buffet also but if you don't like it then you won't struggle to find somewhere else outside of the hotel! Loads of flight crews use this hotel for stopovers and so that will give you an indication that it is not bad as airlines are very good at picking hotels for their staff. If you are touring the city and are looking for somewhere nice to stay then this is an excellent choice. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but some Staff Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: holiday_queenWexford
Reviews.Content: My siblings and I took our mother to New York for her 60th Birthday and 1st trip to the states!The hotel looked great online and had great reviews and the price was good also so we booked it happily. Im glad to say that the hotel was what we had expected. The room,although a little small for 4 sharing,was spotless and very comfortable.We also had a view of Times Sq which was great to wake up to and see at night!We didnt actually use the bar and we ate all our meals out of the hotel. The only problem i had with the hotel was that the front desk staff were not friendly from check in to check out!Barely a greeting or a "how was your stay" which is not really a big job to ask and makes all the difference!The luggage guys in the lobby however were very good and looked after us well! The hotel served its purpose as a great base for sightseeing and shopping and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Room 2004- great view”
Reviews.Author: danskora
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 2004 between 19/11 and 23/11. FANTASTIC view of times square! Priceless! Bar was way way over priced. Twice the price of the nearby celtic bar. Great central hotel. Mcdonalds just downstairs don't pay for the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Weber_Andrade
Reviews.Content: It was our - me and my wife - first time in NY. We couldnÂ´t find a better place. Near to everything and very confortable. At the ckeck out, we almost forgot a luggage, but the attentious hotel staff took care of it. So lovely. I truly recomend the hotel! Excellent place. Unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed for exploring all areas of New York, the service was excellent from all members of staff we encountered and the rooms were more spacious then we were expecting for central New York.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: vanessa160
Reviews.Content: This was our very first trip to New York and we were worried that we had chosen a very basic hotel. When we arrived we were very happy the Novotel was the same standard as any Hilton or Shereton hotel for the fraction of the price. We were taken to our room which was a good size for a couple. The views from the room of time square was great. In the evening we facied a drink at the outdoor bar of the hotel which was light up well and had a great atmosphere and also had a great view of Time Square. In the morning we headed for the subway which was minutes away. There is also a macdonalds near by. The subway was a cheap and convinent way to see all the main tourist sites and avoid the traffic. We think if you would like to stay in the heart of New York, Time Square is the best place to stay. If there is a down side to the hotel it is that they need a swimming pool for the summer months as it can get very hot. Our time at Novotel was excellent. I would definately recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “very average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gggForce
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights mid-week in this hotel. Very good location just a block or so north of Times Square, which I could see if I leaned over and pressed my face to the window. The check-in process was efficient, although they assigned me to a double bed room which smelled like smoke. I went back to the desk and was quickly given a non-smoking King as requested in my reservation. The hotel was clean, a bit tired, though. The bed had a nice cover that was soft and thick, but the mattress was the opposite - unyielding in its firmness. The size of the room was fantastic, very spacious. I agree with other travelers in that $9.95 a day for the internet in 2010 is getting a little ridiculous. Just include it in the price. I had breakfast in the room, it was a good, hearty American breakfast, although the eggs were a little overdone. Overall, definitely not a romantic hotel or room, but a fairly priced room for business travel at about $319 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: hyperweavert
Reviews.Content: Novotel's location can't be beat, it is near enough to Times Square without being too central. The hotel itself is well appointed but in a bare minimum. They say Wi-Fi is included but that is not the case, in fact you need to pay for Wi-Fi for EVERY DEVICE you use and this isn't explained beforehand. Service in Cafe Nicole is near non-existent, the servers aren't attentive and seem to be unable to handle large crowds...as a result, some tables will be neglected. We booked through Orbitz thinking breakfast was included but once there we were told that it wasn't, we spent hours on the phone trying to resolve this to no avail. Someone, Novotel or Orbitz, is misleading customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view good location”
Reviews.Author: queenc268
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel strange entrance but the staff were all very helpful & nice, the room was a good size with a nice shower, the pillows on the bed weren't good and the duvet was a little thin personally. Good location just a few blocks from hells kitchen lots of restaurants..and the C/E metro. Don't pay the extra for the times square view as the restaurant has a better one. The internet is a bit useless in reception but if you like pubs there is one on 46th and 8th called the pour-house that has free wifi and $4 draft bud.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with spectacular views of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Adjmeister
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee stayed here for 5 nights in September. We got a taxi direct from JFK which took about 45 mins and the hotel is located at the top of times square. It takes roughly 5 mins to walk into the heart of Times Square. There is a Subway station across the road. There are a lot of restaurants and theaters around the area which is good for choice in the evening. The room we had was a skyscraper view room and was worth the extra money. the bathroom was what you would expect and the bed was huge! We never ate at the hotel, it looked expensive and there is so much choice on your doorstep anyway. I would reccomend this hotel for its location in New York

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location & value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here before taking a cruise. We loved our room with it's great view of Broadway! Nice and clean; very spacious. Also nice and quiet. Spacious bathroom. Really comfortable bed! Nice lobby. The concierge was friendly and really helpful. The bell staff were especially fun guys! Great location in the theater district, just a hop, skip and jump to Times Square. Lots of shops and eateries nearby. Take your pick of cuisine. Wonderful brunch buffet in the restaurant. My sister and I loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best location.”
Reviews.Author: xls1x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in oct and had no real problems. Rooms were of a good size with a good view over broadway and were clean, good bathroom. Staff were helpful and nothing was a problem. Nothing here was a real standout except the location. Was all round pretty good. It can't be beat for location with fantastic views from their terrace and short distance to most places. All up good, clean hotel. 7.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Would not now stay anywhere else in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DWNG15
Reviews.Content: As previous reports the location is just about perfect. On check-in the member of staff even gave us tips on what to do to avoid being overcharged for drinks, phone calls etc! Any questions or requests for help and advice were dealt with promptly and courteously at all times. Our room was on the 33rd floor and had great city views (although not on the right side of the building for Times Square!), the room was very clean and fresh and we were amazed at the size considering this was New York City after all. All in all a fantastic experience. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels in large cities around the world and not been as pleased with the overall experience as was the case at the Novotel Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Night time construction near hotel - jack hammers. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Babette086
Reviews.Content: Location, quality of room, food, service was excellent until we needed assistance moving so we could sleep. There were two different sets of jack hammers working all night some of the time we were there. Various hotel staff members denied it was happening, and insisted the hotel was not under construction. True, the hotel itself is not under construction. Something very near the hotel is under night time construction. This hotel is frequently cited as noisy. The big city sounds would have been acceptable, but not the construction noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “The location was terrific.”
Reviews.Author: tharts
Reviews.Content: The hotel (Novotel Times Sq) was well located in heart of Times Square. Indeed some rooms have a view right down Broadway Avenue. All around the hotel are the main theatres and shows. The hotel itself is comfortable - rooms are okay size, good gym, okay bar and restaurant etc. Next door to the hotel is a legenday steak house - Galaghers (upper priced) and within walking distance some terrific options such as Churrascaria (w49th and 8-9th). We had a party of 6 adults and everyone rated it favourably. Not sure if this would have been the case with kids as there were limited apparent entertainment options for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bensgirlSydney
Reviews.Content: After a late start checking in (not impressed that our room was not ready post check in time after flying for 20 hours from Australia and already being 3.30pm to be told to wait in the bar area when all I wanted to do was dump my bags and have a shower. The staff did not seem to concerned that this annoyed us - but this was the only issue we had) we were given our key to the 17th floor. We had a small view of Times Square which I did not expect as we got a great deal for the hotel. The location here is fantastic. It is close to everything and has a fantastic breakfast that is good value for money. The staff (other than the person who checked us in) were helpful and attentive, but it is a large place with lots of traffic and you will be treated well, but it will be more transactional than you may get in a more boutique hotel and it will be the location that will have people come back, not the service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be close to the action”
Reviews.Author: hastingsranger
Reviews.Content: Just up the road from Times square, we stayed there twice, before and after a cruise, a modern hotel, good sized rooms. $10 taxi trip to port including tip. The room before the cruise was at the back,overlooking the Jersey boys and Wicked theatres, it was ok but no view, after we had a good view of all the neon, but it was a little noisy, being next to the lift. Overall a good choice with Macys, 5th ave, Central park, Rockerfella centre etc easily walkable

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with friendly staff, hotel clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: chrisnlindanemily
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel as it was very close to most of the attractions eg Times Square, Central Park, Top of the Rock etc. Close to the hop on hop off bus tour stop. Staff friendly and helpful. On a night the view on the balcony overlooking Times Square is fabulous. We had a room overlooking Times Square and it was great looking out over Times Square, well worth that little extra. The rooms were cleaned every day and a new variety of toiletries included every day. When we left the porter hailed a taxi for us to get back to the airport so you didn't have to pre arrange the taxi. The hotel was excellent although the only downside is we thought the breakfast a little on the expensive side compared to local cafe's so we only had breakfast in the hotel on the first morning. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: vroom100
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is well located on West 52nd street and is a step away from the many broadway shows and the delights of Times Square; 'Jersey Boys' is currently across the road from the hotel entrance! The rooms are well insulated and the windows keep out the outside noise pretty well (apart from the inevitable sirens). The room was a good size, much more spacious than expected, with two double beds and pretty good storage. The room had an excellent hairdryer and iron and ironing board and a good tv. The air conditioning worked very well. Although a large hotel, the four lifts/elevators were extremely prompt and there was very little waiting time. The check-in and check-out was hassle free. Do try the restaurant at the Novotel, it has superb views down to Times Square, as well as a lovely terrace outside which is a wonderful sun trap. The hotel has a small shop for gifts, confectionery, cigarrettes and stamps. The staff were attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “tiny old bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: cathybrisbane
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in great location however after walking through the impressive lobby and fantastic terrace bar things go down hill! the elevator is old - the corridor to our room was very old fashioned and with tired decor! the room is small - which is what we expected for the $ paid- but good grief - the bathroom has to be one of the pokiest, ugliest, oldest decorated i have ever seen! very 1970's...plastic sheet over bathtub..no room at all!! the only compensation is that it was very clean and room service did a good job!! the bed was very, very comfortable however -awoken late at night and early in the morning with bed bouncing by the vibration of doors slamming up and down corridor..the doors are on swing-slam close device...soooooooooo loud- between that and what sounded like an army of french children screaming up and down outside..felt like jumping out the window from lack of sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, the best view!!”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaLimoura
Reviews.Content: We had a room up to the 30th floor with amazing view of the Times Square!! Excellent breakfast as well at the really great restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: kevinAVFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 2009 2nd time to NYC best Hotel yet am going back in 2011 and will stay in this hotel again Fab location staff vey helpfull and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SGerrard
Reviews.Content: 4th trip to NY and have found our hotel to return to at last!!! Very close to Times Square but didn't hear any noise - you can see the hotel sign from Times Square so you know you're heading the right way!! Close to Central Park the other way too! Have a drink on the balcony looking down to Times Square. Rooms very clean and very good size. Good air con. Good shower. Basic trivia for the girls: 6 hangers so take extra if you need. Iron and ironing board. No kettle in room (that's a very British comment though and not a criticism!!!) Basic wall mounted hairdryer in bathroom. Wardrobe has full length mirrored doors. Dressing table/desk in front of large window so no mirror there. Large window has double blind. Modern bar downstairs. If you want to see Wicked, it's less than 1 minute's walk on 51st street!!! We managed to get tickets for the next day. David Letterman also 30 seconds away just the other side. Free pc and printer use in lobby if you need to pre-book return flight seats. Can't fault hotel, and will def be our hotel of choice next time, Love love love New York!!!!!!!!!!! AT the end of the day, all you need is a bed for the night in NY, but even if you needed more, this is a great hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: bizzyinn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year having stayed at the Millenium un Plaza previously. Both hotels are very good but the Novotel has the best location. I had e-mailed a few times direct to the hotel asking about various things and they were very accommodating. I had asked for a room away from the lifts and a high floor both requests were fulfilled. We found the beds the most comfiest ever I wished I could have taken mine home. We liked it so much we have rebooked for next year. The hotel is near a lot of the attractions. Also I would advise anyone who is going for more than a week to get the New York pass with the 3 day bus pass. We saved loads of money and did loads of attractions. Also we ate in a lot of the diners that the locals ate in as places like TG Fridays are expensive. If you want your family to see you in New York if they have a computer go on Google Earth and tap in New York theres a camera in Times Square near TG Fridays. We have done this both times so all our family could see us. I hope some of this info is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: doomster73
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, right in Times Square so it's handy for everything. The best part though was the outside sky bar where you can sit on comfy sofas and watch the buzz of Times Square whilst having a night cap or even go and have a morning coffee. Our room didn't face Times Square but the view was still good but if you get the chance, ask for a Times Square facing room. We did not have the breakfast as it was only a buffet style and to be honest, there are plenty of diners right around the corner to get the all-american breakfast. We did eat dinner one night in the restaurant and it was very good, however, there is much more variety and choice outside due to the excellent location. The rooms were very comfortable and cleaned every day and all have air-con which is definately a bonus. We had booked to see Wicked (the musical) and was very happy when we found the theatre was actually on the next block along from the hotel. Although the hotel doesn't have free wifi, you can get it for only Â£6 per 24 hours which isn't too bad. Truly an excellent hotel for a New York tourist stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fellas_ncfc
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel. Good location near plenty of subways and with views of times square. The room we stayed in was a good size, cleaned every day. The staff were really friendly. Overall, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: auldreekie87
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everthing you need for a trip to New York. The location is great, as it's fairly central for uptown and downtown, and the view of Times Square from the window is a bonus. Our room was on the 30th floor, super king size bed, and an ice machine in the hallway to fill your ice bucket. The lobby is a bit impersonal, and the area for free internet use is a little cramped with no seats, but that's probably intentional to discourage guests from monopolising a machine for lengthy periods of time. We didn't use the hotel restaurant, there are plenty of places to have breakfast around - don't even think about McDonalds for goodness sake, you can get that in UK. We particularly enjoyed the Food Emporium (take a left out of the hotel to the end of the street, take a left and keep walking, and Food Emporium is on your left a couple of blocks down .... so much to choose from in the store and then you can eat it in the seating area). There's also a good bagel store if you take a left out of the hotel to the end of the street and then turn right. We stayed 5 nights, and thoroughly recommend the 48 hour 'all loop' Gray Line bus tour if it's your first trip ..... you can see so much in the first 2 days and then plan your remaining days around what you see. We had a total of 5 different guides, two of which were outstanding, the others pretty average. If you think yours isn't too good, just get off and get on the next bus! The concierge in the hotel is also pretty useful for help and suggestions. Having stayed in New York before, the Novotel is definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: CPJ31
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable hotel only 5 minutes away from Times Square. We ate breakfast in the hotel every day - 23$ for the buffet for me and both children (13 and 16) ate free which I thought was good value. The room was spacious with a view over the river and the sofa bed was comfortable for either child. Staff were very helpful and we appreciated the fact that they would look after the luggage for $1 per bag once we had checked out as we had an evening flight. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl in the city”
Reviews.Author: citygirl13Calgary
Reviews.Content: This was my eighth visit to NYC and I have stayed in a number of hotels and hostels this place is great! We had stayed in a hostel for 4 nights and then 3 at the Novotel.There was a special promo at the time so check that out.Anyway Once we came up the small elevator the doors opened into a huge lobby,restaurant with balcony with a great view.The staff was eager to help with any questions.Our room was spacious and clean.We were right around most theaters,times Square was a few blocks away,deli's are all around everywhere plus nice restaurants.Walking is part of the city and it is worth getting the bus tour to take you to Brooklyn etc.I would stay without a doubt at this hotel again but with any place check for the deals.

Reviews.Title: “tv and furniture needs upgrading.Room standard not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: sh0bna
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in ny.Hotel balcony overlooking time square was nice.Never got opportunity to use internet as always people waiting. Breakfast too expensive.mcdonald only round the corner. Reception area nice but rooms need to be upgraded.staff very pleasant but reception always too busy.We booked city view room but never got it.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Times Square stay”
Reviews.Author: sucker4luxury
Reviews.Content: I booked the Times Square view room and it was the best thing about this place. This is a huge hotel so be prepared to wait for check-in. Not a high-end hotel, but is very good to sleep in even if you are a sucker for luxury rooms. The only thing we didn't like were the guys handling the luggage, they are bunch of lazy idiots who do not help and you have to carry your own luggage to the reception which is on another floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: av101
Reviews.Content: Visiting from DC and could not have found a better hotel ( got the info from trip advisor ) one block from the heart of times square and a great view, got a good deal with our 13 and 14 yr old sons staying free, rooms a bit small but thereagain we only slept their. 9.5 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Location Great But ??”
Reviews.Author: Rog&Bez
Reviews.Content: Great location , but our room on the 33rd floor was in need of a refurb the decor and furniture are showing signs of wear and tear also the bathroom. The cleanliness of the room was always well done daily by the staff. The staff are very proffessional except for one man on the concierge desk who seemed to be continually on the phone and during a conversation with ourselves couldn`t be bothered to remove it from his ear( very rude and arrogant!!) and we thought the customer was king in NY!!! No facilities for tea making etc. in the room which is a pity ! The weather was very hot and humid and the aircon in the room was only adequate. Having said the above this is still a good hotel with a super location. Best place to eat for any meals open 24/7 is the Renaissance corner of 52nd st and 9th ave very reasonable prices for NY and a lot less frantic than Times Sq if that`s what you want. All in all a great stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: zwmommy
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to NYC her 16th birthday..a first trip there for both of us. I chose the Novotel after a lot of research and my final decision was made by many of the nice reviews I read on Trip Advisor. Arielle, an executive director at the hotel, was very helpful in arranging to have a birthday cake delivered to our room through numerous e-mails in advance of our arrival. The hotel is very nice and well located. The room was was basic, but clean and all we needed for our 4 night stay. I upgraded to a Times Square view for a nominal fee and I would highly recommend it. My daughter was beside herself when she opened the curtains of our room!! It was a wonderful stay that we will always remember, due in large part to the Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and some rooms have excellent views”
Reviews.Author: SandraWalesUK
Reviews.Content: Via our agent we booked two king size Times Square View rooms. When the confirmation came from hotel it stated one double and one single. Some reviews say there is no price difference between the Times Sq view and standard rooms but the hotel says there are. The trip was to celebrate our daughters 18th birthday so it was really nice of the hotel to give her a free upgrade and a fantastic view. The staff were very helpfull with advice on travelling on subway etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Care04
Reviews.Content: This hotel's ideal location, in Times Square, is only the beginning. The room far exceeded our expectations. It was a good size and modern-looking. The rooms were very clean - a must for me and my family. The lobby is inviting and the views of Times Square are priceless. We walked all over Manhattan and it was so easy to find our way back to the hotel since we just had to return to Times Square. This hotel is a gem in a city that is electric!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrace bar is a real gem, quality of rooms varies, don't use concierge to book anything!”
Reviews.Author: AyrLedgies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first part of a family trip that included New York, Nashville and Las Vegas. This hotel is in a great location, very close to Times Square, but not subject to noise levels associated with similarly located hotels. Overall the hotel is of a good quality - a very quick check in, nice bar and fantastic terrace for drinks and cocktails! Prices are typical New York but the view is worth it. I was with my wife and two kids (6 &9) in one room, which although clean and well presented had not been refurbished as parents rooms had been - they having only one doubled bed in theirs. They were very impressed. Normal fee for shuttle to Newark for our party is $115 - when I tried to get the concierge to arrange this he was quoting $150!

Reviews.Title: “Would come back here any day!”
Reviews.Author: carlyhenzell
Reviews.Content: I booked for 5 nights from June 21-26 and what a fab Hotel. We stayed in room 920 on the 9th Floor and got a good view of Times Square even though we were not in a room classed as a Times Square view room. I was actually expecting it to be a little noisy due to the fact we were only on the 9th Floor but the traffic and the hustle and bustle was barely notable. The room temperature during our very hot stay was ideal, the room was cleaned daily and, there was a fully stocked mini bar/Fridge the amenities were modern and were to a higher standard than I was expecting. Along with the Fridge there was a Ironing Board & Iron TV Wardrobe big enough for 2 girls to hang up lots of summer dresses and store luggage Ice Machine located in the Hall near the lift and an ice bucket in the bathroom to store the ice. Hair Dryer 4 Lifts so no waiting for ages to get in or out of the hotel Fantastic Balcony for Cocktails or to just take in the city The Beds were fantastic also, I wish I could have packed mine up ha ha I had a really pleasant stay. I will defiantly be back to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Allosst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Time square for 5 nights. The rooms were very elegant and functional and a beautiful view on Time Square and above all we highly appreciated the terrace with relaxing chairs and also an outside bar, this gives you a feeling to be outside of all and Time Square at yor feet. This one of the best hotels in New York and best for value

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuLoVGA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a room with a view to Times Square. Awsome!. The room has a good size with LCD TV and a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom is also new and comfortable. The Internet is not free, but you pay USD 20 for a week and the speed is good. The loby is beautiful and the restaurant have also a nice view. We found out the breakfast a little expensive, but we could find a lot of delis, starbucks or McCafÃ© on the block. The location is fantastic. You are pratcly inside Times Square. We haven't had any kind of annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic new york base”
Reviews.Author: allisonpreston
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 7 nights in mid june...superb location...beds super comfy and house keeping kept room spotless...a kettle in the room would have been great but made you get up and out of a morning. buffet breakfast glroious if on the expensive side but some mornings lovely to sit in the sun light venue and munch away. internet services limited and slow for a major hotel chain. key to this place is the location...its a major chain hotel so lacks the personal touch but when you walk out the door and there is times square broadway and laods of places to eat and drink what more can you ask for

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: rosspenman
Reviews.Content: THE BEST LOCATION BY FAR, out of all the hotels I was offered by my travel agent I am so happy we picked this one. once we where there and seeing where the other hotels where this is the best loacotion, 2 minutes from times square and rockafella centre 5 minutes from 5th ave and most of the shows are around the corner. rooms are good, ask to be as high up as possible as there will be less noise from the street the steak restaurant just out side the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Trueandfair
Reviews.Content: Fabulously located Hotel on 52nd street and Broadway, we had a lovely view of Times Square and near plenty of great places to eat. We didn't feel the service was particularly fantastic, they didn't know our names, didn't ofefer to take lugagge upto our room, and no tea and coffee facilties in the room. Good sized room with two doubles, blackout blind and sun-shading blinds as we right on Broadway this was very handy. Cleaned daily, decent sized bathroom, own iron and ironing board, mini bar in room, plasma screen TV. We booked room only, there was a range of places to eat nearby. Delicatessens, restaurants, cafes and fast food places. Location was fab, walking distance to 34th Street (macy's and other shops, 5th Avenue, Broadway and Times Square, subway stations nearby - 49th, 50th and 42nd Loved the location, size of rooms and view. Service wasn't brilliant - when booking transport to airport we were quoted two different prices by concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: smithvl
Reviews.Content: Great experience 1st time in New york City. Shopped around on the internet and found this motel. I am so glad I did. Perfect location. Friendly staff. Comfy beds. When I get back to NYC this is the motel I will stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: tennboy1981
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to new york to see the broadway show Mamma Mia. We did a name your own price on priceline and it picked this hotel. What a perfect location, we were literally right across the street from the winter garden theatre where our show was at. The guest service staff was nice, the room was also very nice. My only complaints is there is no complimentary breakfast or coffee in your room. You can have breakfast in their restaurant, but get ready to pay because its pretty pricey. They have a mini bar in the room which is also pretty pricey. There is no room in the fridge for any of your own personal beverages. There is a bar that serves coffee at 4 bucks a cup. Also, make sure you dont leave anything in your room. I left a pair of jeans in my room. I tried to call the hotel, transferred to house keeping, was told to hold and hung up on. I call back ,and then got the voicemail. I just gave up on it. So if you leave anythig in the room, good luck getting a hold of anyone to help you over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky2405
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 4pm having taken a cab from JFK airport (we wanted to be on holiday asap! $51 + tip). The hotel entrance at street level is pretty basic but staffed throughout the day and night by the portering staff. Lifts take you directly to the lobby/reception area where we were promptly checked in by the reception staff. Our room was on the 21st floor and was very nice - very clean, large bed, hairdryer, iron, TV, electronic safe and if you pressed your left cheek against the window a view of Times Square. The bedroom was quiet with very little noise from the street below. The only downside to the room was the amount of storage space, there was only one small wardrobe and no shelves or drawers which meant some of our clothing never actually left the suitcases unless we were wearing it. On the same floor as reception is the bar area where the outside seating gives excellent views down to Times Square. We were only about 5 minutes walk to the centre of Times Square and we also easily walked to Grand Central Terminal, Bryant Park, 5th Avenue shops and the Rockefeller Centre. Subway stations were also easy to reach on foot from the hotel. This hotel is probably about as central as you can get in terms of being in the heart of the tourist district of Manhattan. The staff were very helpful, polite and always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Small and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: alex0kdt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 days in February, 10. Lobby and corridors are nice, but room itself is really small. Also the lift are directly behind the room wall - so during the night the noice of lift is guaranteed. Also quality of the cleaning is not the best. However the position of the hotel is great - just a 5 minutes walk form a Time square. Check-in/ check out procedures are fast and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable first visit to NEW YORK!”
Reviews.Author: ankle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here with our son,all agreed the Novotel is in the ideal location. Our room on the 31st floor was bright,comfortable and spacious enough for 3 adults. The view from our window was spectacular-day and night. From check-in to check-out,we were met by courteous,pleasant and cheerful staff. Oh, and the terrace bar is a great place for a beer or cocktail and 'city watching'! The Partridge Family,Glasgow.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to experience New York for the first time!”
Reviews.Author: LGM87
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Novotel Broadway for 5 nights. The hotel's location is nothing short of perfection for a first-time traveller to the city. One of its perks was after a long day of sightseeing, we would get a taxi back to Times Square and spend an hour soaking up the electric atmosphere before going back to the hotel. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. We stayed in a twin room which looked like it had been decorated in the 90s. As expected, food and drink was very expensive in the hotel so we never ate there. The majority of the staff members we spoke to seemed very apathetic and basically looked like they didn't want to be there. We did speak to a lady who worked at the bar, and also a member of the desk staff who were both very helpful in giving us advice with where to eat and how to commute. One of my favourite things about this hotel was the balcony overlooking Times Square. I will be going back to NYC later this year, but unfortunately the Novotel Broadway was over my budget so had to look elsewhere in Midtown to get a good deal. I definitely have plans to come back to the Novotel, and I highly recommend it to all my friends who go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: Lewis710
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights. Fantastic location, ideal to explore. Nice, modern, spacious room. Didn't eat there so can't comment on the food, too many other places to eat nearby. There was an excellent gym there but with all the walking we did we didn't get round to using it. Couldn't fault it, fantastic holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for seeing NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sueshaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated - close to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. It is also a short distance from several Metro stations. The hotel is modern with a bar and restaurant area in the lobby. We didn't eat in the hotel but did stop into the bar for a welcome post sightseeing tipple. The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated. Close to the hotel is the Cosmic Diner, a great spot for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Times Square a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseK2
Reviews.Content: Central to everything New York has to offer. Hotel accommodation was great, we had great view of Times Square. Hotel staff very welcoming and helpful with any queries we had. Jose - one of their front office managers gave great assistance in forwarding medication we'd left at hotel to us in DC. Loved our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, Nice terrasse, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: marc911fr
Reviews.Content: Close to Time square you CAN view from thÃ© nice terrasse. Have your breakfast with a magnificent view. Rooms are ok, though not really up to date.

Reviews.Title: “easy choice for next time”
Reviews.Author: kirbytravel
Reviews.Content: A perfect combination of location, service and value. If Times Square and theatres are what you want choose the Novotel Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: clipclops
Reviews.Content: We asked for a high floor and were not disappointed. We had amazing views of the city. Close to lots of locations, we loved Central Park, enjoyed a glass of wine or two at the Boat house beautiful location. My favourite was Grand Central, everything i imagined it to be, the hustle and bustle, we loved Michael Jordans bar, wish we had eaten there instead of Gallaghers steak house which is literally next to hotel. Food was mediocre, wine expensive and they ask you for a tip!!!! Doesnt matter how much you think they deserve they wiil return to your table and ask for it, putting you on the spot. Not our idea of good service, we werent new to New York as my husband hd been on previous occassions so we were aware of the tiping. avoid it like the plague! We enjoyed the Irish bars such as Patrick Conways nr Grand Central great food and service, also loved The Perfect Pint. Hotel was great loved the sky deck especially, the weather certainly helped! cant wait to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “You couldnt wish for a better placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goonerette
Reviews.Content: We didnâ€™t spend much time in the hotel, but when we were there it was fantastic. Pleasantly surprised by the room size as had heard hotel rooms in NYC were tiny, we had a deluxe suite and it was a great size. I think the best thing about this hotel has to be the location. Be prepared to walk lots to see this wonderful city - well worth the shoe leather!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good,clean affordable and right in the middle of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: HabariYako
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April for 4 nights, having booked and paid for in the UK . An inexpensive, ten minute cab ride from Madison Square Garden which is the best station toget off if you have flown in to Newark. Check in easy, staff very friendly, ambience French chic.Rooms clean and spacious for New York. Soundproofed, although the lower down you will still hear some road noise. On the whole,very good.( You only have time for a bath/shower, then change of gear and out again.) Nice roof terrace,well stocked bar and good food in a reasonably priced restaurant overlooking Times Square. All the big attractions like Empire State, Rockerfeller,Chrysler, Flat Iron, Grand Central all within walking distance. Very helpful Concierge. Check out was easy, and suitcsaes can be looked after if you have a later flight in the day. We would reccomend the Novotel. It has everything for a short stay and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Love2Go_10
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is located in a great location for walking access to Broadway theaters and Times Square. The room was neat and clean, however the commode ran (water running/draining sound) through the entire stay (2 days); the Bathroom was very clean otherwise. (We notified the front desk, it was responded to only with a kind "sorry to hear that".) We were on a "non-smoking" floor and there was NO odor of cigarette smoke in hallway or rooms (always a concern even when noted as "non-smoking"). One of the elevators to the room floors went out for a few hours during our stay, but we were kindly met at the elevator by the manager and concierge and offered use of the service elevator in the interim of it being repaired. We opted out and decided to spend the time at the lobby bar for an evening cocktail. The lobby atmosphere is very nice along with the terrace overlooking Broadway and Times Square, which resulted in a very pleasant evening despite the inconvenience of the elevator issue at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: NorthBayBabs
Reviews.Content: Four "over 60" women LOVED this hotel. We felt safe, spoiled, awed by the views of Times Square and delighted not to have to walk too far to the theater in our fancy shoes! The Bell staff were courteous and helpful from taking care of our suitcases when we checked in early to ordering us a van/cab when we were leaving for the airport. We will never forget the Gin and tonics with appetizers we had on the roof garden overlooking Times Square. We are planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “would go back to the novotel in the morning!!”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirl27
Reviews.Content: the staff were so helpful and accommodating, from the reception staff to the men at the door. the hotel is in an amazing location and we could not fault any part of our stay. it was most enjoyable and fun.our room was amazing and we had a fantastic view. warm and homely too.we would go back there tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for an american traveler! Staff needs learn american hospitality not french hospitality”
Reviews.Author: crknipe
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to this hotel at the end of April 2010. When we arrived I was excited because we were put up on the 33 floor. When we walked into the room, the first thing I noticed was how hot the room was. I called down to the front desk and the gave me some story about how the building was on central heat and air and basically what you see is what you get. What made me mad is that when I complained about the temp being too hot, no one even came up to the room to check the tempature. Its kind of like they know that have a crappy hvac system and they get those calls all the time. I was told I could open the window to cool the unit down. Now for $350+/night, I dont feel like I should be put out with hearing the car horns in time square just so I can get some good sleep. One other annoying thing about the temp situation is that while it is hot as hell in the room, the only bed linens we have to cover up with is a down comforter? Did the manager of hospitality get his degree online or something here? What kind of mickey mouse racket are you running here? I called again after 2 hours and no change in the temp and complained further and they brought me up a bed sheet to cover up with instead. I unfolded the bed sheet and threw it across my girlfriend and I, then when I looked at the sheet closer, it literally looked like someone had wiped thier butt with the sheet. Yes 2 brown stains right in the middle about the size of a football. I complained again this morning but as another post said, the staff is very reluctant to help it seems like. I informed them this morning that the hallway (which has its own non central hvac unit) is actually cooler than our room. I told them I was going to end up having to sleep in the hallway if they could not do anything about the temp. So to sum it all up, if you are traveling on business and sleep matters to you, this place is not for you. I think this is a better place for Europeans because they are used to being in non-airconditioned living environments more than americans are. With the type of system they have here, they might as well not have one at all. I feel like this hotel is one of the worst values for the moeny I have ever spent. All in all this place is a 30 story motel6 with lipstick in the middle of times square. If your going to spend $350+ per night I would definately shop around. based off my experience, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!”
Reviews.Author: Duchas
Reviews.Content: Great location in NYC! If you need to be near Time Square this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “You can not be closer”
Reviews.Author: TomasLonga
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing stay.. Stayed there for 8 nights without any even smallest problem or comment. Hotel is situated just on 52nd and Broadway, so you can hardly find better location with breathtaking view from the rooms and restaurant with terrace over The Times Square. Well run and managed hotel with extremely friendly and professional staff. Thumbs Up!!! Thanks to all of you for a great time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Daisymaybe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 6 night stay at the Novotel over Easter. Best features are its location, large rooms by NYC standards, great views (we were on the 23rd floor with a river view - impressive both by day and night), cleanliness and good bathroom, including both a bathtub and decent shower. Unlike other reviewers, we found the rooms very quiet, and the lifts very efficient (we never had to wait more than a minute). The cleaning staff were a delight - always smiling and jolly. The fitness room was fantastic, full of the latest equipment and open 24 hours a day, plenty of towels and free fruit. Seemed a bit odd that there was never a member of staff there - this didn't bother us, but perhaps for health and safety there should have been? Minor negative points: we arrived well after check-in time at 3pm and the reception staff assumed we'd be happy with a twin-bedded room, which we weren't - we'd to wait till 3.40 for the king-sized we'd booked, and we weren't the only ones waiting. A free drink would have been in order, really, but wasn't offered, nor was the hint of an apology (the Novotel is after all very French!).. And the lack of any instructions at all in the room was irritating - ie, no TV guide, anything on how to adjust the heating/air con, details re hotel facilities (the hotel guide section on the TV is not set up either), so you have to ring Reception to find out where the fitness room is (on the mezzanine floor), what time check-out is (a generous 12 noon), etc. And in particular, no tariff for the movies or 'phone - caveat emptor here, it cost us 58 dollars for two urgent calls to the UK totalling less than 6 minutes. We knew it would be pricey, but ouch! Buy an international 'phone card if you need to ring home (we were surprised to find that neither of our rather elderly mobiles worked in New York, as we had no problem in China or Sri Lanka - one is on the O2 network, one on Virgin). The location can't be bettered. Walking distance to so many theatres, restaurants, Central Park and Museum Mile, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Carnegie Hall, etc. We didn't try the pricey hotel food as there are loads of restaurants and vendors everywhere. We advise the 30 minute walk over to Ess-a-Bagel on 3rd Avenue and 51st Street for the best bagels in town, served with an authentic NY sneer! The Carnegie Deli on 7th and 55th near the hotel serves a very good breakfast too, and don't discount Starbucks or McDonalds just round every corner for cheap and cheerful (I don't know how many calories there are in those McD Cinnamon Melts, but they're worth it). Rosie O'Grady's bar prices are exorbitant - the Benash bar just up the road (7th Ave and 55th) do very generous apple and watermelon martinis and Manhattans for 6 dollars (didn't try the food). The best pizza we had was at Patzeria's on 46th St between 7th and 8th Ave - full of locals, which gave us the hint. Don't do what we do and order a whole pizza - they're massive. A slice each will probably do. Katz's Deli was great for brunch - subway downtown to Delancey, and it's at 205 E Houston Street just up the road from there. Quite an experience! We also loved the Oyster Bar and Zocalos Mexican at Grand Central Station, the Italian on Broadway just round the corner from the hotel, opposite where they film the Letterman Show - looks scruffy but the food's great. But wherever you go you'll be spoilt for choice. If you want to sit in on the Letterman Show, just call at the theatre box office at 10 am - they give away free tickets for the same evening (but only Monday to Thursday). Have a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “favourite place to stay while in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AlbertusMarinus
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to NYC this is the hotel I'll stay in. I have a lot of relatives in the area, so I go there often. in my opinion unbeatable price/quality in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good price for a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: JB072
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first four nights of our four week trip to the USA. We booked through the Novotel website which gave a us a better deal than any of the last minute.com type sites. The hotel is clean and in a great location - especially for first time visitors. We were only a few blocks away for the hop on-hop off bus and we bought a four day ticket which served us well for our stay. The room was a good size - not the tiny one I'd expected from other reviewers and we had a view right out over Times Square. We did book a King room and only ended up having a double bed - but we walked so much and spent so little time inthe room, it was of no real concern to us. The rest of the room we had was what we had booked. The room itself was clean and housekeeping did a good job each day. Linen and towels were changed daily whether we needed them new or not. A room safe that was lap top size was very handy. Only downsides were the usual USA thing about the fridge being sensored - (that is take a Coke out of the fridge and it goes straight onto your bill) - so there was nowhere to store your own drinks (ice and buckets were available); there was no guest laundry - had to use a laundromat several streets away (often a problem on a long holiday!) and the internet was not free - which shold really be a "gimme" for hotels of Novotels standing by now. I think we ended up paying $20 for a weeks access though - which was not too bad. We ate breakfast at the hotel once, which was a little disappointing - not much choice for the price, but the food was good. For all other meals, there were simply too many other options right outside the door and Times Square has everything you could want or need at any time of the day or night! There were plenty of homeless people - and this remained a constant throughout or trip - but we were never bothered, in fact we rate NY as one of the safest places we've visited. We found it a bit dearer to eat and shop here than other areas of the US (such as Washington DC, LA, San Fran etc) but expected and budgeted for this.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special!”
Reviews.Author: Meeniemoomoo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went for 5 nights. I booked a room with a view of Broadway which was great but the room wasn't anything special. When we got in there the wardrobe had a massive crack in the glass which I couldn't look at so got that fixed asap. Good location but the hotel is nothing special. Reception staff seemed not bothered either! Very dissapointing

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: brandel50
Reviews.Content: Location is great; short walk to 2 subway lines; easy stroll down Broadway to the heart of Times Square, and to other attractions such as Rockefeller Center. Many theaters nearby. Hotel lobby was classy and staff friendly. Room was clean and modern. We had one with "skyscraper views" on 31st floor and it had a great view looking west to Hudson River. Room size was not huge but was perfectly adequate. It seems many rooms in NYC come with 1 King bed, as did ours. Ask for a room with a sofa bed (no extra charge) if you have a child. Our 7-year old liked sleeping on that; not sure how well it would work with more than one kid; may depend on how old they are. They advertise that they are kid friendly and seemed to be. Many Europeans were there when we were. Overall, a very positive experience and an ideal base for our sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kev22o8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Novotel New York 2nd April 2010. Excellent location . Great views of New York. Excellent service will return to this hotel when next in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, in a great location, ideal for first time NY visitors”
Reviews.Author: MrsW
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2010. The age range was 3-73. Two couples, grandmother/granddaughter. We had pre-booked 2 rooms, a double and a family room, expecting that the family room would have a double bed and two singles. We also requested adjoining rooms. On check in we learned that all of their bedrooms in the hotel contain two double beds and no adjoining rooms were available. The receptionist tried to be helpful and put us on the same floor (level 9), just a few doors apart. This worked fine for us and grandma/ granddaughter shared a bed. You would need to be on a higher floor than this to get any kind or real "view". I'd heard NY hotel rooms were very small but of course Americans are used to acres of space, by comparison to the UK, I thought the room size was good, very acceptable for 2 people a little more cosy for 4 people. The rooms were clean, tidy, modern with large flat screen tvs and games consoles, stocked minibar, and a safe I think there was also an iron/ironing board. The beds were clean and had duvets. There was no coffee/tea making equipment, but you could get ice from a machine in the hall (they provided glasses and an ice bucket in the rooms) and we put our water bottles or milk carton (for the 3 year old) in the ice bucket to keep cool. Bathroom was clean and well lit with large mirrors, a good shower, plenty of hot water, soap, shower gel, shampoo and hairdryer. The cleaning staff were Eastern European and very friendly. Reception staff and doormen were very dfficient. We liked the location very much and felt very secure in the hotel. We didn't dine in the restaurant as it seemed quite pricey and we could eat in a diner a few yards away for a fraction of the price. My sister and brother in law had a small beer and glass of wine in the hotel bar for $22.00 by comparison we shared a nice bottle of wine in a local restaurant for $17.00. The location in the city was great - walking distance to Central Park, Rockerfeller Center, Times Square, Bloomingdales, Dylans Candy Bar and numerous diners, delis, restaurants, theaters, supermarket and subway. All in all a good experience for our first trip to New York - would certainly recommend the hotel for location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Compared to others, this place is a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Mike_The_Rookie
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not too concerned with choice of hotels--I've stayed in good ones and bad ones and, as long as I can sleep without being disturbed or grossed out (by the accommodations), I just really don't care much about hotels. Nevertheless, I was really nervous about booking a Manhattan hotel, mainly due to reading horror stories on here and because they are so expensive.
