I can deal with cheap hotels when they are actually cheap. I reserved via expedia and paid $150/night--which was a mistake on my part because it was actually offered at $115/night prior to booking, but I wasn't yet convinced, so I kept looking. Anyway, we arrived a few hours early, but they had rm. 2006 ready. King bedroom with windows (that open slightly inwards) overlooking Broadway and 52nd. The lobby and bar area of the hotel is very nice, but the hallways on the 20th floor could definitely use fresh paint and new carpet, although it wasn't too bad. The room itself, however, was very nice!! Very clean and new. The bathroom was quite small, but was very clean and had a nice wood floor. The bed itself was very comfortable and I slept like a rock star! I can understand how street noise could be an issue on lower floors, but with the fan running, we didn't have any issues. We called housekeeping for a few more pillows and they never came (and we fell asleep anyway). The next day we called again and they came....with towels, but they immediately corrected this error. Location is really good if you plan on staying in Manhattan. We used the subway (2 stations within 1 bock) and went all over Manhattan and Brooklyn Many restaurants and theaters nearby. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy0356
Reviews.Content: My 14 yr old daughter and I stayed at the Novotel last week. This was our first visit to New York and we found the location fantastic. We saw Mamma Mia, which was across the road from the hotel. It was walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. Our room over looked Times Square. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting where to eat. We found Angelos a great restaurant. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and also dinner in the evening. The view from the restaurant is magic. I work for Qantas airways in Australia and have stayed at many hotels, so I can say with confidence that the Novotel is a great choice and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Broadway!”
Reviews.Author: WVTravelers6166
Reviews.Content: The Novotel has a wonderful location. We stayed for four nights. We could see Times Square from our 11th floor window. The rooms were clean, but the carpeting could use a little updating. I liked the fact that we were within walking distance of the Winter Garden Theatre and The Ed Sullivan Theatre. Times Square was very close by as well. The hotel staff is very personable and I was very impressed that the people I encountered were multi-lingual. The hotel restaurant has a huge window that looks out into Times Square! The hot breakfast is very good with a variety of choices. By the second morning, the waiter remembered that I like hot tea with lemon with my breakfast and brought it to the table before I had even asked! We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was very tasty as well. The cost of meal was reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to others, especially for those people who want to be in the center of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Internet photos give the wrong impression”
Reviews.Author: Childofthemoon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to take my daughter to New York for her birthday. Internet photos very misleading. Whilst the public rooms are clean, warm, and well decorated, the rooms are shabby and dirty. we complained on the first night only to be told by an arrogant member of the night staff that the room we had was recently refurbished (Which decade I would like to know!!!) and no other rooms were available, but we could ask in the morning if we wanted to. which meant hanging around the lobby waiting for them to decide. the carpet was fithly, damp patches by the door with numerous patches of what resembled spilt bleach stains about the room. We specifically requested a twin room, not only with the travel agent, but also sent an email directly to the hotel, (they said they would do their best-however on checking in, they did not even acknowledge the request ) No attempt by the checking in staff was made to make us aware of any terms & conditions of stay, and the list of do's and don'ts on the back of the hotel room door were so tiny they were difficult to decipher. I have to admit that the door staff and the checking out staff were helpful and polite, but the night staff and checking in staff left a lot to be desired. the room was either too cold or too hot, we had no information on how to control the heating. and just trusted pot luck by fiddling with the useless dials on what we assumed was either the air conditioning or the heating. the bathroom was shabby with what resembled cement stains in the sink, we had to aks for our room to be cleaned and fresh towels on the day after arrival, if you call housekeeping don't expect any politeness, everything seemed too much trouble for them. the only good point about this hotel was the location, it is at the end of W52nd Street and Broadway, within easy reach of Times Square and other attractions. but I would most definitely stay elsewhere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in central new york”
Reviews.Author: AdamHull
Reviews.Content: We just returned after 3 nights in this nice hotel.It was booked through Accor on the net & it cost $660 for 3 nights,including a full breakfast(it normally cost $20 each).The best of this hotel is its central location,if you like walking,you can walk to times square,central park,empire state building & madison square garden etc.We used the underground a bit,day pass $8.25 which is worth it.A single ride is $2.25,regardless of distance!We found the underground lines are confusing,nearly went to wrong direction on a couple of times.Hotel is very clean,decor is nice too.Staff are pretty friendly & helpful.We have no problems with them at all.Restaurant is nice,so is the bar.Food is reasonably priced(remember this is New York).Our room is on 26th floor,looking out onto Broadway,a lot of neon lights,but we could not hear any outside noises at all.Room size is adequate and bed is comfortable,bathroom is clean.Plenty of hot water all the time.We had to pay for our internet connection,it cost $20 for a week.Shops are round the corner,so are many restaurants,with international crusines.With this trip we were unable to find any cause of concern with this hotel.We have to say that you need to experience it for yourselves.Hope you will have a similar opinion about this hotel as us

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Times Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkladyparis
Reviews.Content: The Novotel was a nice hotel. It serves as a rest stop for pilots and flight attendents of a major airline ( I couldn't figure out which one). The location makes it ideal for anyone who wants to be in the middle of all the attractions, especially the Broadway shows. I was with my grandmother and we walked everywhere. We never took a taxi. The lobby is nice and not located on the street level. Some minor issues: the bar closes at midnight, so if you're coming back from a show and want a night cap, you better be quick about it. Some of the bar staff was not very nice. You don't have a thermostat in your room, so you can't really control the temperature. The hotel either turns on the heat or the a/c for the entire hotel. You can control a fan in your room. Our room was HOT! The only way we were able to cool it down was by opening the window. They have a mini-bar, but it automatically charges you when you remove an item. I'm not a fan of these new systems, because I like to buy soda and water on my own and keep them cold. So I had to request a mini fridge for my room for a small fee per day!! They also don't have any "do not distrub" signs to hang on your door, so be prepared for housekeeping to knock at any time during the day. But those are the only minor downsides to the hotel. Oh and you have to pay for wi-fi access.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately go back again to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chakagreenock
Reviews.Content: We arrived and waited for room to be ready, which took til 3pm. The room we had faced times square, 2704, and was nice and clean. The view was spectacular. The breakfast was very good, with bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, french toast with cinnamon, pancakes with maple syrup, grits, potato cubes, there was also fresh fruit / melon or cold salad selection, cereals, or croissants/rolls/bread served with fresh juices and tea or coffee. I am writing this as before i went i had read the reviews and most (not all) were very encouraging, but i just thought its worth mentioning that the cost of the breakfast alone per person was $24, and therefore if you are getting this included its certainly worth it. The front desk staff were great, and helpful, the checkin / checkout staff were pleasant, and the conceirge staff always made you welcome. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat this Hotel for Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: supergaza
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in Feb (When it snowed!). I have been to Manhatten a few times and I was very impressed with the Novotel. We would def stay there when we go back to see the 'one world' tower. Great room, bigger then average for NYC - very modern. Best breakfast in town overlooking times square even better if you get the breakfast in with your room rate. The quality of the food is good. My only critisism would be the bar area - very expensive / poor service (Only ever one member of staff on duty) - the coffee from the bar area was from a machine and very poor quality. But apart from that you cant go wrong. Would thoroughly reccomend as best in class for the price bracket they are in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location , good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassBrazil
Reviews.Content: It was a greatful stay, the hotel is very-well located , with good rooms e offers a lot of services. Although, I think that a hotel in NY wouldnÂ´t charge internet for the customers, , I think it will be included at the stay . Anyway, I recommend this hotel for everybody , unless you need a 5-star hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “NYC is ACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: LWade90
Reviews.Content: My Mun & I went to New York last year (2009) for 4 nights at the end of Nov, beginning of Decemeber, and i loved every minute of it!! We flew American Airlines Heathrow - JFK. Left London around 6pm (UK time) and go to New York late evening. the flight was good, you get decent amount of rooms in the standard seats & we got free refreshments and food the whole flight! (Not something you usually get when youre from the UK!!!!) When we got to JFK and got through all the security and gave them our fingerprints!!! we grabbed a cab to down town Manhattan. $45 standard fee from JFK to Manhattan anytime! Which was pretty good. Taxi dropped us off on Broadway on the corner of 52nd street, the street our hotel was on. We were staying at the Novotel Times Square. The hotel was LOVELY. We checked in, and went up to our room which was on the 32nd floor!!! and it gave us an amazing view of Times Square! i think we landed lucky with this as you got to option for a room on floors above 26 or something when we booked to get this type of view but we didnt take that as it was an additional charge!! The Room was really nice, lovely decorated, MASSIVE bed & Bathroom with a wet floor and the shower kind of just ran on to it! Once we had had a wee look around our room and dropped the bags off that was us... out till 2am NY Time (7am UK) we were just buzzing with the atomsphere that we werent even tired! and the place was still rocking incl the shops at this time of morning!! we did some shopping in American Eagle, Levi's etc etc...! Another lucky thing, we had gone the week of Thanksgiving, it was on the Thursday and we arrived on the Friday so there were all the sales... And i mean SALES!!!! The only bad thing about it was as it was the weekend we were there, all the americans were on holiday too and go away for it!! So all the shops were mobbed 24/7!! We were shopping all day saturday on 5th avenue!! Its just amazing seeing all these shops. from H&M to Henri Bendels and Saks etc... Saturday night we went to see a show. we chose Memphis! it was a good show, would recommend it if youre in to music from the 60's era!! After we went for supper at a steak house on the same street as the hotel! BIG, BIG Mistake!! the cheapest meal you could have was $45!!!!! When eating in New York Stick to chinese resturants or take outs of any sorts!! Definately the nicest & cheapst food option! On the sunday i wanted to go on the Gossip Girl Tour so i booked it before we went and dragged mum along!! If youre a lover of GG its a great tour! You meet outside the palace Hotel and hop on the bus. I enjoyed every minute! you get hop off stops where you get to go in to some of the locations on the programme! So take money with you to buy stuff as you will in Dylans candy store!! :D At the end of the tour you are dropped off MILES away from where you started and you will either need to grab a cab or get the subway back to youre end of town!! No offence to anyone that rides the subway, but i will NOT being doing it again if i go back to NY! it scared the hell out of me!! I suppose its one of those things though, if you do it you get used to it! We had to ask a local which one to get on and just looked out for the sign saying 42nd street and hopped off! ANYWAY !! After that we did some more shopping!!! haha! by the end of sunday the jet lag had well and truely caught up on us, we grabbed a take out from one of the shops around the corner from hotel and went to the room to eat it and we were bedded by 7pm!! The next day was Monday our last day so we went to Macys as you need a whole day in the place or you wont get to see it all!! I liked macys alot and spent a fortune in there but if youre not from US if you go to the visitors desk they give you a card to carry around the shop and you get 10% off every purchase. So take youre passport or some sort of ID that shows you arent from the US!! The 2 ladies in front of us showed thier british bus passes!!!!! hahaha! Monday night, we went to the Empire State building! Be weary of the people that work there! they try to con you out of money!!! we were told when we'd go in that it was foggy and when we got to the top we wouldnt see anything so we should go on this virtual thing..... Guess what? We got to the top and seen EVERYTHING!!! Clear as a picture! If you are going in winter take a jacket scarf gloves & umberella with you as its freezing up there and can rain too obviously!! that night we went to a chinese resturant for some food. we were $40 for all our food and drink for the 2 of us!! dont ask me to tell you what it was called or where it was as it was just up some back street !! Tuesday morning, we had to be at the airport for 7am. so up at 5, downstairs in reception checking out by 6.15 and the guy in the lobby got a taxi for us to take us to airport. Got to Airport, checked in and then dropped our bags off at the bag drops you get. and headed through to departures for some breakfast! Again, a good flight home! only thing our second snack/ meal on the flight was a ham & cheese sandwich...... which was frozen SOLID!!! So overall the whole holiday was great! and if i could i would go back every year at this time of year just for the shopping etc..!!! :D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Time Square Location”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated almost perfectly on the upper stretch of Time Square. Hotel entrance is very small on 52nd St with an elevator to the main lobby and reception on about the 5th floor. This was slight criticism as makes entry and exit slightly long winded having 2 elevator rides to get to rooms with a walk accross the lobby inbetween. Reception was efficiant though far from friendly. Spacious rooms with great views from the upper floors. Saftey deposit box and mini bar though do be careful on the mini bar if you take items out to put your own drinks or food in. You are automatically charged on your bill for the withdrawn item even if you put it back later as is based on sensor. Reception did thake the items of the bill when asked. Area under sofa / sofa bed should be cleaned more often with a selection of small items there from previous persons. There is a small charge for the Hotel to retain bags when you check out for a few hours until you go to airport. I guess this is the equavlent of a tip and is charged when you leave the bags per bag. No coffee making facility in room. Rooms do seem to be sound proofed well as little noise from outside or from other rooms. The major benefit of this hotel would be central location and value. It is very close also (1 block or so) to Subway to JFK airport. Very easy transfer day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: magicfairy444
Reviews.Content: This hotel great clean and spacious it had everything we needed. A small shop inside to buy sweets, papers etc from which was really handy when we didnt want to venture out in to the hustle and bustle. The rooms were cleaned everyday! We met no problems at all. Juat under the hotel is small resturant i carnt rember what it was called but it was good value and great food we had most our meals here. The hotel is so convieniently located for everything and every room i can imagine has a good view. top hotel great location!

Reviews.Title: “Now this is a GOOD hotel!”
Reviews.Author: visitor64
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the good reviews on the site and can only add our congratulations to Novotel for an excellent stay in NY. On arrival we found ourselves at the end of a long queue checking in, but within no time we were taken care of and in our room. Desk staff are efficient and fast. The room which we shared with our two children was spacious and clean - our bags unpacked, there was ample storage out of the way and plenty of space for everyone in the room, although the bathroom was a bit narrow, but nothing more than that. Looking out onto Times Square we were apprehensive about possible noise - but didn't hear a thing! We had drinks in the bar most nights; they are more expensive there than in neighbouring restaurants and bars, but then you do pay for the mesmerising view of Times Square... We ate twice in the restaurant at dinner; the food cannot be faulted - however service is a little slow, so order first and enjoy your pre-dinner drink at the table rather than at the bar. Breakfast was a vast buffet catering for many different nationalities and again faultless. Price-wise, yes it is probably more expensive than going out, but who wants to face the cold NY air in February without something to eat first? We didn't! There is a good shop in the foyer with lots of souvenirs and postcards, as well as food items and medicines. There is also a fitness room and internet room. For the kids, the highlight was the playstation next to the shop where they were not only entertained, but had a chance to make friends with the other children staying at the hotel. There is a large terrace outside which is probably very nice to relax on in summer but was more than a bit chilly in February! Good photo spot though, whatever the weather. As for it's location - it would be difficult to choose better; a stone's throw from the MOMA, a lazy walk to Central Park, Macy's, ESB, Top of the Rock, and bang in the middle of theatre district. All in all, a very nice hotel at a very good price in a location that is very hard to beat. Don't hesitate - go there!

Reviews.Title: “Top location!”
Reviews.Author: silton88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on a top location. Nice view from the restaurant on Time Square. Subway, restaurants and shops are nearby, within walking distance. Friendly staff. We have had a good stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for its Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Buddabelly65
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on tripadviser, i was really concerned about staying at this hotel. I'm pleased to say that it was pointless, staff at checkin were great, friendly and informative. We had a couple of night of being awoken by a rowdy group of teens, hotel were great in there dealing with this matter, we were offered a free breakfast and given and offered a change of room. Room we stayed in was clean and in relatively good condition and was fine for what we needed ant that was somewhere to sleep. We had a problem with the heating called the front desk, a handyman came to the room in minutes and sorted everything out. If your in two minds about staying at this hotel go ahead and book you won't be disappointed and i will definately be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jamiejay03
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family at the Novotel Times Square from 30th January 2010 till the 2nd February 2010. I suprised my mum with the trip to New York for her 50th Birthday. Obviously I wanted her to have a good time and was very anxious about what the Novotel would be like. My fears were laid to rest upon arrival. When we arrived at the hotel we got to reception and begun checking in. I told the gentleman on reception that it was my mothers birthday and I cheekily asked for a good room. The man was very warm and friendly and told me that he would see what he could do. He managed to get us a room looking onto Times Square which was fantastic. He also gave us some really good advice about places to eat, prices of taxi's to various landmarks etc. Already I was well impressed with the level of service from the staff. Having been to many other hotels and destinations it was the best level of customer service I had ever recieved. I thought initially that the good customer service must be a cover for an inadequate room. How wrong I was, the room was clean and modern, well equipped with plenty of toiletries. The television was bigger than what I expected, beds were comfy with nice, clean and fresh smelling bedding on them. Room was well heated with the heating set at just the right temperature. The bathroom was clean and bright and bigger than some of the other hotels I have stayed in. The view from the hotel was truely breathtaking looking down onto Times Square, just opposite the musical mamma mia. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is central to everything, therefore I would recommend it to anyone travelling to New York for the first time. It is literally a 2 minute walk into Times Square. We got the hop on and hop off bus tour around New York for 3 days and this begins in Times Square so the hotel is ideally situated. The hotel is near all of the broadway musicals and near plenty of shops and lots of excellent resturaunts, it is a 15-20 minute walk to 34th street which is where the empire state building is and Macys department store (the worlds biggest). It is also about a 15 - 20 minute walk to the Rockerfella Centre (home of the famous ice-rink) and Central Park. Overall, the Novotel Times Square is a lovely clean hotel, with friendly staff and is in an ideal location for a weekend of shopping and sightseeing. 4 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: djargonaut
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on the hotel room. The location was excellent and in the heart of the theatre district and walking distance to pretty much anything in Times Square. When you enter the hotel you have to take an elevator to the main floor, which really isn't a big deal. The hotel lobby was nice, they had a bar and restaurant and the hotel had a very modern gym. My only comment is that the actual room was dated, but clean and the internet was a little spotty and you have to pay 8.00 a day for access. If you are looking for a great location and don't mind an older room this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelAussieOyOyOy
Reviews.Content: Novotel NY Times Square is located in the great spot! Walking distance to Time Square, subway and theatres. Staff were friendly and courteous. Recommend to get a room with the view of Time Square. The buffet breakfast is definitely worth it as we were skipping lunch most days. Only minor complain was the room we had was a bit stuffy. We mentioned this to reception and were on it immediately. However maintenance came back to us that the air-conditioning was under repair during our stay. We has to settle by opening our windows. Tip: For food, head out to Hell's Kitchen district and W46 St. Recommend to go to Becco Restaurant. in W46 St. Use the subway to get around NY. We purchase a 7 day pass and it was money well-spent.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Baileybum
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent deal for this hotel with Expedia for $130 AUD a night including breakfast. Check in was efficient and we appear to have been allocated an accessible room which was recently renovated. The location is fine with easy access to subways to explore other parts of the city without difficulty. The room was maintained well each day; breakfast was fine and all staff polite and helpful. Wireless internet cost $20 USD for 7 days use. And the housekeeper wrote a 'thank you' for her tip each day!! Would definitely recommend Novotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Times Square for 2 nights during Valentine's day week-end. I had a perfect stay: Pros: Good central location near Times Square, room with great view of Times Square, good size room well equiped and quiet at night. Cons: none during my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right in Times Square with helpful staff and decent, if somewhat dated, rooms. Overall I'd go back in a heartbeat -- the price is great, the rooms are clean and the location is in the heart of all the action. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “WORTH THE WINTER RATE”
Reviews.Author: GIZZMOCt_Usa
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday noon, the bell man tales your bags and tells you to park your car in a garage down the street. When you return they tell you to proceed up the elevator to check in and your bags will follow shortly. Check in is very quick and friendly. Our room was advertised for Special rate of $209, but after taxes, fees and parking it was more like $289. I waited 1/12 hours for the bags to show after calling down twice.(suggest you take your own bags up the elevator)The room on the 20TH floor was very average (King City View), Good view. THERE WAS NO TOP SHEET ON THE BED. The heater in the room was a little noisy. The hotel has a great lounge and bar but typically NYC expensive, also a restaurant. We tried the ($22.00 ea. )buffet breakfast definitely not worth it . The hotel is centrally located for theater patrons and quiet with decent views all around. If I had paid much more I probably would have been disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in New York several times I would definitely go back to this hotel. The location is perfect, just a block from Times Square and within easy walking distance of Central Park, Fifth Ave, 42nd street etc. My room was spacious, but not as clean as I would have expected, the carpet was badly marked and the bathroom not overclean, but not bad enough to complain about it. I had a view over the Hudson river but do know that there are some good views to be had looking over times square, I did ask for one before arriving but wasn' fortunate enough.. still had a nice view though. The airconditioning system was very good and I didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the corridors, so a nice peaceful sleep. The bar and restaurant looked over time square, I was travelling alone and the staff were very friendly and chatty, never felt lonely. There was also a nice outside terrace, but too cold to enjoy when I was there!! I only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was very good and had a buffet ( hot and cold ) to accomodate all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: JEJT2O1O
Reviews.Content: me and my nan arrived in new york city on the 13th of december 2009, the hotel was lovely we had a good view of times sqaure the room we stayed in was 2116, the staff were very kind and very helpfull the food in the hotel was very nice and the waiter's were nice and polite aswell there was one waiter called adam who was very nice:D the hotel was very clean and modern! the rooms were clean and we had clean towels everyday.. we could not of had a better hotel! we were supposed to go for 7days and come home on the 20th but due to snow we were delayed 3days but thankfully we were able to keep our room:D it was my first time in new york and i loved it i would love to go back one day and i would stay in the novotel!:D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LondonPudner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed in the Novotel for 5 days in September. I had been to New York before but it was my husband's first time so we wanted somewhere central. The hotel was ideal. Right in Times Square and walking distance from all the sights (and the shops!!). We were on the 34th floor and our friends were on 26, and although both rooms were spacious and clean, our friends room was a little more modern in design, so I suspect they are renovating from bottom up. We started most evenings in the hotel bar where the staff were always happy to stop and have a chat. There is also a fab terrace that overlooks Times Square where you can sit and enjoy a drink. We ate out most evenings and by far our favourite was the Michael Jordan steak house in Grand Central Station. A MUST for all visitors to the city. Overall we had a lovely stay in the hotel and I would definitely go back here again if ever in New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCls
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from 9-12 January 2010. Arrival: Arrived at 11am but room was not ready (check-in is 3pm) and so left luggage and started exploring NYC straight away. Returned to hotel around 4pm, and was allocated a King room on the 25th floor with a Times Square view (which was an up-grade as I had booked a standard river view King room). Room: Room was very large and had plenty of space for 3 large suitcases. It was also very clean throughout, something I was wary about from past reviews. The bathroom was compact but served its purpose! When we first arrived in the room it was really hot, but we turned the heat down on the a/c/ unit and the temperature soon levelled out. The hotel was really quiet at night and we didn't hear any noise from neighbours. The bed was really comfy and housekeeping did a good job each day. Location: About 5 minutes from Times Square, and a subway station about 1 minute walk meant for me, this hotel was in a great location. It took about 10 minutes to walk to Central Park, and Fifth Avenue was about a 10 minute walk as well. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate, but there are plenty of deli's and restaurants right by the hotel so this was not a problem at all for us. There was an amazing Cuban restaurant right by the hotel (turn left out of the hotel entrance and it is on your left, about 15 metres away). The food was great (we had a fixed price tasting menu, about $50 each but well worth it), so if you are looking for somewhere close by for dinner, give this place a try. Overall: We paid $150 per night for the Novotel (including taxes) and so for the price this hotel was great. It was in exactly the right location for us, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a great size and had a great view, and as long as I could get a similar price, I would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Great Location! Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Brmattos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel at 10am of Jan 1st. We were told at the front desk that the check in time is only 3pm, but that we could leave our lugagge at the hotel and come back between 12 and 1pm and the room would be ready. Good time to explore the neighborhood. There is a Duane Reade in the corner of the same building and a very nice caffe right across the street (Europa Caffe). Starbucks very near too. This is a great location for those who want to stay at Broadways theater district. At 12:30 we were back, and received an upgraded room (booked city view, stayed at Times Square view). Our room was on the 22nd floor and had a terrific view. Very nice. Rooms have a contemporary decoration of good taste. Neutral colors. There is an Ice Machine in every floor (a bit noisy), but in ours it was far from the room (#2204) and could not be heard. The hotel is very quiet and only ocasionaly we could hear people entering the rooms that were next to ours. Very nice King-sized bed. Very clean room. Loved the wooden floor on bathroom (never cold or hot). There is a small sofa on the room, a small coffe table right in front of it and a combination of office table-TV stand-mini bar in front of the bed. The ceiling is made of sound-absorbing material (maybe the reason why the hotel is so quiet). The room was very spatious and we could open 4 very big suitcases on the floor when packing to check out and there was still lots of space on the floor. There is something that we didnÂ´t like. The hotel does NOT offer complimentary WiFi. It is paid (8 dollars/day) and explored by T Mobile. All other hotels at the same level offer free access to the internet. The staff is very helpfull, from house keeping ladies to front desk personel. Our transportation to the airport was going to pick us up at the hotel only at 3pm, and despite the hotels check out time is 12am, we were promptly allowed a late check out (3pm) when asking at the front desk. We would definitely stay at Novotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with the Winter Sale”
Reviews.Author: scapaflow40
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Novotel at an average rate of about $170 a night based on an Expedia winter sale. Was given a room on the 25th floor (room 2506) with a view of Times Square that was really wonderful. The room was a good size, clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom fine. The TV was flat screen but the remote was a bit wonky which was annoying. The T-mobile wireless barely worked and this is my only complaint. The signal was very weak and really not usable. Internet connectivity is a must these days Novotel! You need to get this sorted. The bar was good as was the breakfast. Other than the internet I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel New York Times Square”
Reviews.Author: GaryW4
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great central location, walking distance to Empire State, Time Square, etc. The Hotel Lobby and Bar are very modern and up to date, the room seemed to be a bit tired and could of done with a bit of decorating and updating but was clean and had everything you need. Wouldn't pay over the odds for this Hotel but would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: gscar35
Reviews.Content: This trip was a quick getaway for my wife and I sans children. We were both born and raised in New York and wanted to go back and be a bit touristy. First thing I will agree with most other reviewers that the location of this hotel is very good. We stayed 4 nights and could walk to just about anything or a short cab ride would suffice. Just a few blocks from Times Square, in the heart of the Theater District and around plenty of good restaurants. However we found the facilities lacking and while the staff were exceptionally polite, they seemed unable to understand and comply with even the simplest request or maintenance issue. When we entered the room we found it to be unbearable hot. The heat was on and the thermostat set to 72 degrees, but I assure you it was much hotter. After a bit we realized that the heater was not cycling off and just ran continuously. The only way to get the heat to stop was to turn the unit off. We reported this to the front desk and were advised that since it was cold outside this is how the heating system worked. This excuse was lame at best. So for the nest 4 nights we had to wake up through out the nights to turn the heat on and off to keep the room comfortable. This alone is enough for me to never return and not recommend this property to any of my friends or family. However in addition to the room temperature we found that the hair dryer only blew cold air. Though reported this went unresolved during our stay. We then noticed the bed was made without a flat sheet. We called housekeeping and requested a flat sheet and they came to the room and brought us 2 blankets. We assured them with the heat issue the last thing we needed were blankets and requested the bed be made up with a flat sheet in addition to the fitted sheet. I was ready to chalk the sheet incident up to a communication failure on my part until the next day. The day after we checked in my wife's sister and her husband arrived and checked in for 1 night. The also found no flat sheet on the bed and requested one be delivered. A few moments later someone from housekeeping arrives with, you guessed it, two blankets! To me this shows a a real lacking in attention to detail, listening and comprehension skills. As for the room itself it was of moderate size though the bathroom was a bit small. There were wall tiles falling off in the bathroom and the fixtures were not caulked to the wall in he shower. The bed was comfortable enough and the room was kept fairly clean. There are far better hotels in the area for the price. For me this Novotel did not so well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurenw90
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome... Located on 52nd on Broadway. You are basically at times square 2 minute walk but can see it from Hotel (We were on 32nd floor) Shops on 5th & Madison is only a 10 minute walk also. If you are familiar with the Subway there is one just around the corner. Rooms were very nice & Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottersBelgium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located with a beautif view on Times Square. The room was very nice and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: TashaNorthants
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, just a few minutes walk from the heart of times square (where New Years celebrations are held). From leaving the hotel you are surrounded by bars, restaurants, and theatres, so there's plenty to do at night without the need of using a taxi. The hotel itself is perfect if you want to be a good location, have a good sized room, and use it to sleep and get ready to go out. It's clean and tidy and does the job! The foyer is very modern and has a lovely balcony where you can enjoy drinks and look down on to the bustling Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel right in the middle of Times Square! Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkglitteryshoes
Reviews.Content: My fiance took me to NYC for a Christmas trip and we stayed at Novotel. My fiance has stayed before on his own, and he raved about it...but then I wondered if it would live up to female comfort standards! It completely exceeded my expectations! Very new and bright and spacious on the inside. The room was a good size for an NYC hotel and very well-equipped, with a huge comfy bed, mini-bar, tv, hair-dryer, bath and shower and all toiletries you need. We had wonderful views over Times Sq on the 35th floor. We didn't eat in the restaurant as there is so much to explore outside of the hotel...but any drinks we had at the modern bar were great. Each day when we arrived back the room was spotless and fresh towels laid out. The staff are so quiet and polite that they are almost invisible...no intrusion whatsoever. We are definitely going back on honeymoon. If you stay in NYC and want comfort and value...stay with Novotel! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good value great views”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl14
Reviews.Content: The rooms on the upper floors have been renovated and the views are incredible. Very clean and comfortable hotel. Accomodating staff. The restaurant with its 9th floor outdoor patio is worth a visit even if you are not staying at the hotel. Go for an early dinner and watch the lights go on in Times Square. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: sewood
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in November & had a fantastic time. The hotel is in a great location for lots of attractions - Times Square, Empire State, Radio City Hall, Central Park etc. The room was spacious - huge bed for myself & my husband and a comfy sofa bed for our son. Great shower/bath too, just what we needed after so much walking! Only downside, as other reviewers have said, is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the city. All in all we had a great time - just needed longer to be able to explore everything!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,excellent staff,superb value,highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller09
Reviews.Content: travelled and stayed over christmas 2009,nice clean modern style hotel with very friendly and helpful staff,rooms are clean,free iron and board provided,free cable tv,free useof a safe in youre room,internet only 7 dollars a day,restaurant has a great view of times square but food is a la carte,very small portions,the beds i found to be very comfortable and a generous double size,facility to store youre cases on youre last day so you can shop and collect them before you head to the airport,it evenhas a free gymnasium and a roomfor youto use a computer and free internet and printer, lots to like about this hotel and little to dislike, i think you will find most of the negative comments on here come from americans who i think expect a bit much for what they pay,it cant be that bad delta airlines send all their cabin crew here,i found it excellent and hope to return again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Times Square, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Akba
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, cheaper upscale hotel for Times Square. The rooms are really nice and have very good sound proofing so you canâ€™t hear the noise from the city below or from your neighbors. The beds are very comfortable and the TV is a large flat screen with a lot of channels. All mass transit is very close and everything else on earth that you would need is right outside of the hotel. All Broadway shows are very close by and there are literally hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel for all types of travelers. Make sure when you book your room you get the Times Square view, it is awesome. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: dgbLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel with my wife at the start of this month.It is a great hotel for a weekend break as it is convenient for everything. We paid extra for a room with a view over Times Square. The best thing about this hotel is its convenience for a tourist as it is close to the tour bus stops. We used City Sights and prepaid for a 48 hour pass which covered everything including a trip to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty with most informative guides. It is also a short walk to the resturants on 44th and 45th streets West which cater for all tastes and prices. We enjoyed John's Pizzeria on 44th and Juniors. Gallaghers Steak House next door to the hotel was excellent although a little pricey however the meat was excellent. The only downside was a problem in getting a taxi back to JFK as we hit the change of shifts for taxi drivers which is between 1530 and 1700 and it took 30 minutes to get a taxi. If you need to get to the airport at this time it would be better to pre book transport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More space than you usually find in New York”
Reviews.Author: indegloria
Reviews.Content: I was in room 1912 and the room was modern, quiet and spacious, I even had a little couch and a business desk. Other than that it's what you can expect from a big hotel chain, except of course the exceptional location which is right in the middle of the theater district. Big disadvantage is that there is no free wireless service. At these hotel prices, this is the least you could expect. Don't know how breakfast is, since I don't much care for 21 USD buffets when you can get delicious bagles with a juice outside for 5 to 10 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice food, but would never go there again.”
Reviews.Author: NeedsAVacationPlease
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I'll start of my saying that I am a teenager who travels often, so I know my fair share of hotels. I went to New York with my mom and great aunt to visit family and see the city. We chose Novotel because of the pictures that were on the website; they're modern, clean, white with a few colours. When we got there, the lobby was very nice, just like the website had shown, white with accent colours and granet counters. The service was good, pretty average. As soon as we got onto our floor (12th), it was a drastic change. The walls were orange with blue accents and were marked all over. When we got to our room, and turned on the light I almost cried. I was expecting a nice white room, but it felt as if we just stepped into a dingy motel in Arizona or Mexico. The drapes and bedspread were the same generic hotel print, the walls were an odd splotchy orange, with green metal windowframes. I almost expected cockroaches and spiders to come out of the walls. To add to this, the bed was uncomfortable and had lipstick smears all over the pillow. By this time I was upset, because it was a special trip for my birthday, and from the beginning it wasn't what I expected. To make things worse, I had to buy wireless internet that didn't work. The bathroom, however was nice. It was the only part of the room that was modern with very nice lighting for makeup, but the shower wasn't very nice. The shower floor was bumpy, and coming away from the floor. The veiw was also nice, but not the best; we overlooked the top of a dirty building, but in a crowded city it wasn't shocking. The food service was very good! It was one of the best in-room meals I've had. I'm not meaning to turn this hotel off for people, it just is not up to my comfort level. Many people say that they came to the city to see the city, and only have the hotel to sleep. But for me the hote is one of the most important things; it's the place I have to feel safe to get a good sleep in after a long day. I did not feel safe in this hotel. We only stayed for 2 nights, and switched hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Some Air Conditioning problems...”
Reviews.Author: MWrobel
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Very close to all Broadway Theaters, Restaurants, Times Square. Try to get higher floors, with Times Square View. One the first day, we had a lot of trouble with the air conditionig system. We changed the room, but the problem was only solved at 23:00 h. The Staff was very gentle. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean base for New York”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days with friends for our 2nd visit to the city. The room had 2 large double beds, safe,flat screen TV, iron/ironing board, hairdryer and plenty of toiletries and fresh clean towels. At the end of the corridor was an ice machine and shoe shining machine. The room was large enough for our needs and the windows were sound proof!! The room faced an office block but we didnt mind. The staff were very nice and helpful, we had a drink on our 1st night in the hotel bar, but very pricy we were just under $40 for 3 vodkas & coke and a lager shandy. We made good use of the beautiful balcony with excellent views of Times Square, (we had brilliant weather!) Good base for Central Park, 5th Ave, Times Square and of course the many theatres. Would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, this is the one to go to when staying in new york!”
Reviews.Author: megan1991_davies
Reviews.Content: Not only is it right on times square the hotel is an amazing price for the location, cleanliness, service, value etc. The rooms are lovely, standard size but all you need for your stay. I think the ultimate thing about the hotel is definatly the location. Able to go anywhere, service are great, they help with finding places, we went all over new york, brooklyn, soho, greenwich village...we even went on the subway! Its an amazing time try and do everything you want there, you will never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: haybelline
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the higher rooms at the Novotel as it was our first time in New York. We were on the 28th Floor of the hotel and it was just lovely! We had a Times Square view and although we were opposite some huge skyscrapers, the room was very light. It was clean and much, much bigger than I expected (as I believe that, as in most cities, hotel rooms in NY are usually very small). We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as there are so many places around that are much cheaper. All in all, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: got-the-pin
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located for Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, Times Square. Subway stop a half block away. My mom and I stayed for 5 nights. Our room had 2 double beds and was a very good value for the money-room was clean and well serviced. We ate dinner once at the Cafe Nicole- average only. Catching a taxi from the front entrance was easy. Do not go to Gallaghers steak house next door- see other reviews about that place. Very European feeling- lots of guests were French, Germans, etc. Has a 'business center' with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!!Beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: KATHY02
Reviews.Content: Novotel have very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is very clean. CafÃ© Nicole restaurant on 7 Th floor have amesing view. We had lot of fun in Novotelâ€™s hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: FrangipaniOffAndros
Reviews.Content: Good value and great location for turkey day in NYC! Clean. Lots of kids in case that matters. Rooms typical. Right in the thick of things. Go see the ballon blow up the night before and make reservations on the patio to see the parade. Bring warmclothes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sd_carlsbad_NM
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in Time Square and Central Park, this is a great location for you. Both are easily within walking distance. The hotel is nicer than the photos suggest but isn't what I would consider a "nice" hotel. It was exactly what we were looking for, a clean hotel with a good location. Our room had a view of time square and it was great. The only time we were in our room was when we were asleep, and it work great for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelpies52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel from 10th to 15th October with my daughter and two friends. Although I have been to NY many times I found this hotel excellent value. Like most big cities and especially NY rooms are small although on this occasion I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. Cannot fault the hotel except that when I asked for the wifi password to use on my iphone I was told it would be $10 per day. Having just returned from Barbados where the password was free although the hotel did have 2 computers that you could use. The location was excellent as was breakfast. Room clean and view from window excellent. I will be back and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sunlover21
Reviews.Content: we have just returned rom a six night stay at this hotel. I would agree with previous reports that the decor is a bit tired but the location made up for it. We were there with our 2 teenage kids and the room was tight but we managed fine- we were out all day in any case. Breakfast is great value if you have kids under 16 cos they don't pay and there is a good selection to choose from. We arrived at noon and were able to go straight to our room. Ian on reception was lovely and gave us some good tips. I would definately stay there again.We would recommend Juniors on 45th between 8th and broadway for a snack and a massive bit of cheesecake(big choice) but go early if you go for lunch cos it is really popular with the locals. We also went to Ellens Diner on Saturday night. The line to get in was huge and although the entertainment was good, the food was terrible and none of us ate our meals. The only saving grace for my son was the milkshakes. If you go, be prepared to throw money regularly through the night into a bucket as well as pay the 18% service charge added to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and comfy perferct for seeing the sights of NY”
Reviews.Author: clareinnis2009
Reviews.Content: We booked the Novotel New York for a trip with my boyfriend for my 30th birthday, I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking and knew that it was central to Times Square. The hotel was exactly that for what we wanted, ie; a clean room and base to see New York, the staff were always helpful pleasant and attentive and the only hold up we ever had was when checking in before a school party of 30 odd kids. A couple of place to mention for eating as I found previous reviews helpful before going; stage delhi for breakfast just 2 blocks up from Novotel, Stardust Diner on Times Square staff there are brilliant and possibly future stars of Broadway, we also went to Rosie O Gradys pub for some lunch whoch was lovely and also Jack Dempseys which is by the Empire State Building. The Novotel is exactly what you need if you are planning to sightsee, we were hardly in our room as there is so much to see but when wer were it had everything we needed inc hairdryer, iron ironing board etc. The only thing I did not like about the hotel is their failure to pass on messages and gifts requested by friends and family whilst we were there which we only found out about when we returned and friends told us how rude the hotel staff had been.

Reviews.Title: “Location said it all”
Reviews.Author: spikeylisa
Reviews.Content: We were here 3rd - 10th October 2009! Check in was nice and smooth! We had a problem with our room straight away my bed wasn't fix properly, the matress and bed base wasn't on the wooden box, so house keeping had to come and fixed it. They spent over 30 mins putting it back together and at 1st didn't feel very safe sleeping on it! But I did!! Room size was ok but if we had 4 people in the room think it would of been pretty crowded plus wouldn't of had enough storage space to put all of our clothes but as it was just the two of us we were ok!! Bath room bit small but clean. Only need it for freshen yourself up so that fine for us!! There a wicked place to eat down the boardway called Ellen Stardust Diner, its all buzzing singers and dancers trying to get onto fame! its cheap. Just get how they have the energy to sing all day and night but I did ask he said our vocal muscles are getting stronger! Another nice place to eat is Olive Gardens which is in Time Square. Rosie O'Grady nice also but get way to much food!! enough for two! Tubes alot of rail works going on at the moment at the weekend! Definitive worth getting a day pass or like us a 7 day pass as its cost $2.25 per trip otherwise! Never did get my head around this network system. If you like your shopping if your international visitor take your passport to Macys and Bloomingdales then you can get 10% plus tax free! Top of the Rock was cool especially as twilight! Empire State you think your in a short line till you go around another corner but worth the wait!! Go to World Trade Center Tribute Tour as this will give you more of an insight regarding 9/11 you will ever know as often its the survivors do the tour!! Will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but, sadly, shabbiest Novotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: abnicho
Reviews.Content: Location is great. We arrived at 930am expecting to just drop our bags, but were immediately given our room. After 15hr flight, very much appreciated! Requested and got Times Sq view, wow! Staff good, nice bar, useful free internet access Usual retractable clothes line over bath=good. Anchor point installed upside down so line dropped out when laden=not good. No tea/coffee making facilities in room disappointing as other Novetel do. Rooms and corridors are tired, almost shabby. Overdue for refurbishment and not same standard as great lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location for first time NYC visitors”
Reviews.Author: Mizzjupiter
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11 nights at the Novotel Times Square New York City, our room was on the 30th floor with a view toward Times Square. The room was clean and spacious, Cafe Nicole was a great place to start the day with breakfast, although there are tons of alternative choices of local delis within minutes from the hotel itself. The hotels outdoor terrace was a real plus to have a drink or just sit and take in the view. Only criticism would be that the staff on the reception desk could be a little more helpful, and how about free wifi, overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - perfect for Times Square experience!”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYC0
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first time to New York we weren't sure of where we should stay. This ended up being the perfect location to enjoy all that Times Square has to offer. Our room was not fancy but it was clean. The lobby was very nice with a restaurant and bar which we didn't have the chance to try since we were trying to go and see as much of New York as possible. It always seemed busy so we thought that was a good sign. We would definitely stay here again when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: newtraveller77
Reviews.Content: knew from trip advisor and maps that this hotel was close to times square but didnt realise just how close, view from room and hotel balcony was amazing especially at night! room was spacious and cleaned daily. no problems whatsoever with lifts or rude staff. ate at hotel on last evening, truthfully was unimpressed and overpriced but apart from that would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: captmomSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Traveled to DC and NYC with my teenage son. The Novotel Hotel was centrally located in the heart of Times Square. We wasted no time getting to our destinations. The theater, restaurants, shopping and tour bus stop was within seconds of the front door. The room was attractive, clean and had a great view. Would recommend this to any traveler. Teenager loved the revolving front doo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dutchnenglish
Reviews.Content: we went in July 2009. They were all really friendly at this hotel helped us get back to the airport and helped us with our stay and knowledge of NYC. We got more than we had expected. The location was brilliant and you had a lovely view of times square off the balcony. We were really happy with our stay and would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy rooms and excellent bar staff”
Reviews.Author: CeCLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Novotel with my partner and friends. It was my partners first trip to the Big Apple and I had warned him that the rooms are normally quite compact. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We were given a special access room which had recently been updated which had an amazing wet room and a really comfy bed. If you creaked your neck out the window, you could even see Times Square. The hotel bar was quite expensive but it had great staff (thanks to Gerard and Heather). The terrace overlooked Times Square which was an amazing setting (am biased as my partner proposed to me), although it was a bit windy to sit outside when we were there!!! The check in was brief but curtious. The concierge was very helpful although they don't tell you thats its $1 to leave your bags with the bellman if you are waiing round for a flight! If you want a cheap brekkie then turn left when you come out of the hotel and head to the Cosmic Diner. However, if you fancy splashing out then I'd thoroughly recommend the Brooklyn Diner (there are 2, 1 off Times Square and one near Central Park). This diner was recommeded to us by a New Yorker and it didn't disappoint. The most perfect poached eggs. Cannot comment on the food in the hotel as I didn't try it. If you want a treat, go to the Michael Jordans Steakhouse in Grand Central station. The best steak ever and the most amazing location..... Be warned it is expensive! Overall, a great trip yet again in New York. Oh to live there :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Shabby Hote.”
Reviews.Author: EireA
Reviews.Content: The lobby is the best part of this hotel. The rooms are really shabby and nothing works. No hot water during the day and the staff are not at all friendly. They were too busy talking to each other than help guest. The location of this hotel is great but that the only good thing I can say about it. Have stayed in better hotels in New York and won't be going back here again. The room even smelt of must. The prices at the bar are very expensive even dearer than on Time Square and forget the lifts they are never working.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: eeliechick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Novotel & found this hotel to be in a great location for the price! I dont really have anything negative to say apart from room service dishes sitting outside another rooms door all day that was a little poor however it didnt directly affect us. The bed was comfortable, we had a massive window overlooking Times Square and the room & bathroom were very spacious! I will definetely be staying here next time I visit New York - you cant beat it for cleanliness & price!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: flapkid72
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel,no problems,no waiting for lifts,great views from 29th floor over to jersey,friendly staff.i will stay here again when i return to new york

Reviews.Title: “We made an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: CravensShropshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights and cannot believe that we were in the same hotel as writers of last 2 reviews. All the staff were helpful. The room was excellent - plenty of space for the amount of luggage most people have for a stay in New York. The bed was comfy and the room kept clean and tidy. Plenty of hot water. Amazing view down Broadway to Times Square. Reception area partly redocorated during evening and on going programme of updating seems to be in action as with any large hotel. Came back one night to find only one lift working but were taken up to our rooms (28th floor) with a member of staff in service elevator. Facilities to make coffee in room would be good and we didn't use restaurant so cannot comment. We did think that charging to leave luggage with porter was a bit of a cheek. If you intend to use hop on hop off buses would recomment City Sights NY (Blue buses not red ones) Same prices, same routes but less crowded - especially in the afternoon. Excellent French Restaurant, booked at info. centre on Broadway which gave us a 10%discount as well. Agree Cosmic diner and Starlight restaurant both excellent for any meal of the day, but so much choice needed to stay longer. The Church on Times Square (in same building as hotel) is truly amazing so if you are there on a Sunday try it.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: WellGirl
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should be advertised as a 2* hotel not 4*. The Rooms and corridors are filthy and in need of renovation. The staff are rude and when asked a question they all just shug shoulders. There was no hot water during the day time. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. I have stayed in better 2* hotels. The lifts were slow to say the least, in the evening there was a 40 minute wait for a lift up to the rooms, there were 4 lifts and only 1 worked. The price of drink in the bar is outrageous. To leave your luggage with the porter costs $5, this was the first time I was ever changed for this service. I wouldn't recommend this Hotel, last time in NY we stayed in the Hemsley and this was a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take too many clothes”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebarkid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights early September before sailing back to UK so had 2 fairly full cases.Wardrobe/hanging space was almost non existent,we had a super room on floor 29, loads of space to move around in,great views of Times Square,lovely hot showers,couldn't fault at all except for having to leave most of our clothes in their cases.Such a shame,loads of empty wall space could easily be converted to wardrobe and drawer space.Would still go back,just tavel lighter!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: angelaprice0311
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, clean, spacious, perfect location, wonderful staff, yummy breakfast, excellent value for money. only downside, in 2008 there were only 2 computers available to guests and I had to check in the airport online. A group of teenagers were using both computers for a long time which meant I had to wait until they'd finished which took up about half an hour of my afternoon when I could have been shopping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazin!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steph013
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AMAZIN!! Location is fantastic, right in the heart of Times Square!!! The hotel was bright and spacious, and the reception and bar area were lovely. Sitting in the restaurant or sky bar gave fab views of Times Square. The staff were so friendly and very helpful. We were given a room on the 32nd floor, the view was fantastic, and the room was so spacious, even with a sofa and coffee table. The decor was lovely, very modern!! Bathroom was very nice as well. We had fantastic stay in New York for my 30th Birthday!! And did all the tourist things!! Rockafella Top Of The Rock was superb!!! And the Red Sightseeing Buses are really great value and you find out so much info on them, the guides are great. Another highlight for me was seeing the Naked Cowboy in Times Square!! Would love to go back!! Fantastic Hotel xx

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: MickySouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel at the end of August for 7 nights. Location of the hotel was perfect for us - Empire State, Central Park, Rockefellar Centre, subway all within easy walking distance. Our room was located on the 10th floor and overlooked Times Square which we were really happy with. Room itself was really quiet - couldn't hear any traffic. The only real noise I would mention was the pipes during the night! Didn't eat in the hotel as we always ate out but we had a couple of drinks on the rooftop bar which I would recommend - great view of Times Square. Also nice to relax on the loungers for an hour or so after a long days sightseeing. Although the room had no tea/coffee facilities I used to pop to the Cosmic Diner which was just across the street (corner of 52nd and 9th) where a tea and coffee cost $3 which was a great way to start the day. I'd recommend the Circle Line bus tours. For $54 we got a 48 hour pass which included downtown tour, uptown tour, Brooklyn tour, night tour, boat tour, $10 off a meal at Planet Hollywood and a free pass to the Museum of American History - the downtown tour was our first real view of Manhatten and it was nice to see the sights and learn a bit of the history off the tour guide. We did both the Empire State and Rockefellar although we preferred the Rockefellar as the views are better - but you can't go to New York and not go up the Empire State Buiding! All in all a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Margo2711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily bookable on line, prepayable. We stayed here a couple of years ago & decided to go back as the hotel is well located & rooms were larger than a lot of other hotels in NYC. Hotel is very well placed on the corner of West 52nd/Broadway so ideally located for Broadway, Times Sq, 5th Ave shops, Central Park & all the main musuems around this area. Hotel room was very clean, spacious & functional, but in my opinion now looked very tired in terms of decor (didn't remember this last time we stayed so maybe we had a better room 2 yrs ago). However it is still a good base & was very clean. There are no in room tea/coffee making facilities which was disappointing. No need to book breakfast in the hotel as this is expensive. Would highly recommend Ellens Starlight Diner which is just one block away. A 50s style diner with singing waiters/waitresses who are all budding broadway stars so have good voices. Food is good & broad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location with Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: RachTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 Nights at the end of August, What can I say a fantasic view of Times Square and the Hudson River. We stayed in room 3105 and it was a big, clean room with a comfy sized bed and plasma TV and a good sized bathroom. Cleaned everyday to a good standard. The location made the hotel worth it in itself with the Empire State Building, Macys, Central Park and The Rockafella centre all with in easy walking distance.The bar within the hotel has a great outside view of Times Square. Would recommend staying at this hotel again. The staff on a whole were very professional and friendly.We had a couple of problems with the safe in the room but the problems were solved quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bornbeautiful
Reviews.Content: When you travel to New York in summer like we did, then you certainly don't want to spend too much time in your hotel room. For our first trip to the Big Apple the Novotel Times Square was the perfect hotel. The location was brilliant and from our room we were able to see Times Square and the Buzz on Broadway. The room was clean, the staff at the hotel very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the Skydeck as well as the view from there was great. In the evenings we dined in Hells Kitchen (close to the hotel on 9th Avenue) and lots of Attractions were within walking distance (Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, etc.). We can definitely recommend this hotel and would return there on our next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Times Square for 4 nights at the end of Aug, our party consisted of myself my good lady and 2 teenagers. The hotel was ideally located for 2 subways on different lines, which was a great help as we seemed to spend a lot of time going up and down manhatta. The layout of the hotel is a tad odd the entrance only contains two lifts which you use to get to the lobby you then have to walk across the lobby to get you another set of lifts to get to your room. The room was'nt huge, but having 2 doubles in the room probably didnt help. but is was clean and adequate. The bathroom was sizeable and clean, the only grumble here, and it seems to be a very american thing, is there was no heated mirror in the bathroom and the fan didnt seem to work therefore if you had a shower and wanted to do you hair you had to do it in the room as opposed to the bathroom. Room had a lcd tv, which was almost impossible to use as channel selection was sooooo slow. There was a fridge in the room, however, this had been filled up with the hotels drinks and candy therefore there was no room for our goodies. All in a good hotel in a great location for a reasonable price, we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, on times square. Loads of shows to pick from”
Reviews.Author: bigbadjohn_9
Reviews.Content: Went to NY for my 40th,Was upgraded to a room on the 33rd floor over looking times square it was amazing!! Novotel is a great base with a few theatres very close by.I went to mama-mia, it was brill!! We never ate in the hotel as there are plenty good eating places close-by. My only gripe about the room was there are no tea/coffee maiking facilities in the rooms however they serve coffee in the loby free of charge until 8am(thats ok if your up early). There's a macdonalds just round the corner for a coffee to go!! We used the blue sightseeing bus the first few days which was a fab way of finding out where everything was. Liberty island is a must-its amazing! The rockafellar centre has better views than the empire but they were both good. A few good eating places include Dermott O'leary's which is just across the road, planet hollywood, dave & busters(about a 10min walk). There are lots of pizza/pasta places which are cheap. We would def stay at the novotel again.(hopefully next year)

Reviews.Title: “Great view on Time Square”
Reviews.Author: JnTB2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel for 5 days: at 300m from time square (52street, Broadway) , excellent view from our bedroom, and from the big breakfast room. Inside the hotel, everything is clean and not oldish, in the opposite of many other hotels in this city. You can't hear the noise from street (because this is not time square yet) , but our room wasn't quiet because you can hear your neighbours. Anyway, the bed was really comfortable, the room was big, well furnished, the staff was very quick to repair our AC, the reception desk was billingual (French and English)... so you are sure to relax at this hotel. Be careful, everything is really nice there but your credit card may suffer a bit !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CL11815
Reviews.Content: Novotel is conveniently located. Walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Broadway Theatres, and not too far from Central Park. Subway is a 10 minute walk away. The Sky Bar is probably the nicest feature of the hotel. We enjoyed drinks one evening while overlooking the lights and activity of Times Square. Our room was on the 20th floor (2006) and we had an excellent view of Times Square. The room was quiet, bed was comfortable but the room could use some updating. Needs some paint but was clean and sufficient for a long weekend trip. Checkin staff and bell staff were very helpful. Overall, the hotel was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel/amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: monk02
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the novotel in february for 5 nights with my partner and 5 other family members,this was a dream holiday for me as ive always wanted to go to new york and it was better than i ever imagined. we got the subway to the hotel from the airport, luckily my brother who lives over there met us so knew what stop to get off etc , HOTEL- when i arrived we were greeted by friendly staff, willing to help in any way.(although there was one incident that happened which was tiny and they gave us a room upgrade with a beautiful view and free breakfast in the morning, our rooms where extremely spacious(from what i hear new york hotel rooms can be like a shoe box)so we had more than enough room for all our suitcases and clothes, the bathroom was very clean and the view we had over time square was out of this world, LOCATION- the location is fantasitc, empire state is only a few blocks away(10 min walk if that)5th ave,central park, all the broadway shows at your doorstep and for the blokes hooters is only about 2 blocks away!!! FOOD- we had breakfast every morning in the hotel which was very tasty, eggs/bacon/sausages/bagels/pancakes/fruit/cereal and mush much more, we found that if we had alot for breakfast it would fill us till the evening even though we were walking all day for hours at a time. we ate out at hard rock one evening which was lovely and even though its busy we didnt have to wait for our food, OVERALL- i would reccommend this hotel to anyone, im planning on going back in feb 2010 and will definatley be staying in this hotel again without a doubt, although we where hardly ever in the room the views we had are such a reflection on what we see in books about new york will stay in my memory for forever

Reviews.Title: “Love love loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ireland1312
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my very first trip to New York and having been back 4 times since and trying different hotels around Times Square each time none have lived up to my experience in the Novotel. The location was excellent, bar welcoming and the staff super. Got great value also booking through Ebookers. i've recommended it to friends many times and all have enjoyed the experience as much as me. Can't wait to go back to both New York and Novotel

Reviews.Title: “Fab Time”
Reviews.Author: bethebth
Reviews.Content: I took my hubby for his 40th birthday, we didn't plan on staying in much so this hotel was perfect. Fab location, right in the middle of Times Square, we could walk to most attractions, Empire State, Rockafella Centre, Central Park, Bloomingdales,Maceys and loads more. We bought tickets for the Greyline buses and they were great, tour guide on every bus giving you info on the districts you are in. Loads of nice places to eat (Cosmic Diner round the corner was really good and value for money). Hotel a bit pricey for food but you don't need to eat in, too much choice on Times Square. Bartender, Bertrand is a mad Man Utd fan and loves english footie, will talk about it all day. All the hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. We would deffinatly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK ---- for NYC”
Reviews.Author: dbatts
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the Novotel NYC to be ok for a budget traveler. Before traveling I was alarmed by the reviews from other American travelers staying at this hotel, they seem to be rather harsh where as Europeans seemed to rate their accomodations substantially higher. It is best if you book your rooms directly with the hotel, if you go through a travel site you might ened up getting shafted on your room location. My room had a perfect view of times square, I did book directly with the hotel and I did ask for a room with a good view. The room was a little dusty but it was ok for the price and location. This hotel is very close to two 24 hour drug stores (Duane Reed) and you can purchase small snack items so go ahead and opt for the in room fridge for sodas and things you need to keep cold. There were also several cool diners and delis in the area, the (cosmic diner "Great Pancakes", there is a really pizza spot about a block away, mc donalds and the stardust diner, the stardust had a 50's theme and they provide live entertainment from breakfast thru late evening dinner. There are several theaters near by (as of 7/2009 shows such as Billy Elliot, Mama Mia, Wicked and Lion King were all in close proximity to the hotel, I was able to take a short hike to an off off broadway show and it wasnt too bad of a walk. Several banks near by Chase and B of A to name a few).
