We had breakfast at the hotel on the first day as we had been given complimentary vouchers but I would agree with other reviewers that it was a bit pricey if you're not looking for a big feast at breakfast time. We used the hotel bar a few times & the service was great. I would happily recommend the hotel if you are looking for somewhere in a great location & at a reasonable price for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location next to Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: hurleygirl024
Reviews.Content: Upon driving into NYC for the first time I must say I was rather nervous. This hotel was so easy to find and once I dumped my car in a parking garage I could relax. The front desk attendant was very friendly and helpful, the atmosphere in the hotel was very comfortable and upscale. They even allow pets! The hotel was located right by Times Square so we could walk to everything easily! I will definitly return to the Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler1515
Reviews.Content: Novotel is your basic "Holiday Inn" type room, just owned by Accor (European Co.). The rooms are dated and the furnishings and carpet worn and stained - a basic accommodation with the standard mattresses and colorful matching bed covers. My room was on the Broadway side, so it made for a noisy stay. I used the Fitness Center, which is adequate with a treadmill, elliptical and bike, as well as minimum weight equipment. I had requested a king room, but when I arrived (at 5pm in the afternoon) they could not grant the request. I didn't find the staff particularly helpful, and there was not a lot of security for a hotel in this location. You take an elevator from the street level to the lobby (7th floor), then have to hop on another set of elevators to get to your room. In all of this moving around, there was no check that you were a guest. On a positive note, there is a Duane Reade drugstore one block away for the necessary water, snacks, etc.. The hotel seems very energy/environment conscious, which means everything is on a sensor. When you leave your room, the heat cuts off, so I was cold during my stay. If you're looking for a budget room and more interested in pounding the pavement, this would be the place for you. If you're looking for an upgraded hotel (good mattress, robe, "clean" feel), I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Christy33
Reviews.Content: We booked the Novotel with Expedia and paid just under Â£1000 for 7 nights including direct flights LHR-JFK with Virgin. Seeing as the basic room rate at this hotel is $299 per night, it's a great bargain if you can book far enough in advance. The best thing about the Novotel is its location which couldn't really be better, just a few blocks up from Times Square. It's not just the proximity to Times Square though, this location means you can pretty much get to anywhere in Midtown Manhattan within 20 mins walk. Rooms are big for NYC and clean, but a little cold and the bedding is not great. No tea and coffee making facilities which is a bit of a shame when you've been out all day sight seeing. Other than that though, the place is great, friendly staff, good concierge, good check-in/check-out. Bar is nice and the only time they struggled was with the massive crowd in the lobby on New Year's Eve. Having said that, when you consider there were over 1 million people literally right outside on Broadway - getting drinks was going to be tough anywhere that night. Didn't eat at the restaurant other than the night we arrived (food fine, service a bit slack when Maitre D not there) because there is so much more on offer just on the doorstep. This is especially the case for breakfast - think you can get much much more at all the diners and you avoid the queues for brekky too. Whilst you're there you must go and see a show. The standard on Broadway is leagues above West End - we saw Chorus Line - probably the best show we've ever seen for quality. Other highlights we'd recommend would be Little Italy - pretty much all on Mulberry Street near Chinatown - great restaurants and bars. And, instead of spending a whole morning queuing for the Empire State Building, why not try the Top of the Rock observatory at the Rockerfeller Centre - hardly any queue at all, amazing views only 16 floors lower than the deck at the ESB, better views of uptown and downtown, a great view of the ESB itself, and you're in the open air - not squinting through little portholes. Costs about $17 (ESB $18) but just as breathtaking if not better. Helicopter trips are good fun but lots of hassle waiting in the heliport, we waited over an hour to get our 15 min flight. Really good experience though. Best experience: dinner at The View restaurant - this is a revolving restaurant on top of the Marriott Marquise (48th floor), just off Times Square. BOOK IN ADVANCE to get a table - can do it on line from the UK. Quite an expensive meal but so worth it to get all those views, great service, fantastic food. If you go to NYC at New Year, then it's probably best to avoid Times Square - it was absolutlely manic - that's why the Novotel was good because you have a view from their 7th floor terrace of Broadway down to Times Square, and a view of the million + people on Broadway. All in all - a great place, fantastic city, great time of year to go there, and a smart hotel in the best spot. Brilliant holiday.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip”
Reviews.Author: taovandel
Reviews.Content: Had another great trip and stayed at the Novotel. Had a clean and large room and everything we needed was within walking distance. Highly recommend seeing Wicked and Hairspray both within a one minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CKJJ
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for us we had a bit of a poor start to the holiday with our connecting flight being cancelled we arrived late to our hotel at 1am. Our travel agent had phoned ahead to say we were still coming but on arrival we were told that they had overbooked and there was no room for us, so they sent us in a cab to another hotel a couple of blocks away. We were not amused. We came back to the hotel the following morning, our travel company complained that they had given our room to someone else and denied knowledge of the phone call. They upgraded our room to give us a brilliant view of Times square and were given free breakfast for the duration of the rest of our 4 night stay which was very nice. We also had no luggage on arrival as this was lost and were provided with much needed toothbrushes and toothpaste etc. We were also given a complimentary fruit bowl, biscuits and mineral water in our room which was a nice touch so after a poor start, they redeemed themselves. The room was quite spacious, the bed very comfortable and it was all very clean. A great central location and all the staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We would definitely recommend it, the only thing I would say is go for longer, we definitely didin't have enough time there, NY is fantastic and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrmatthews
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights in late november mainly for sightseeing and shopping. got a super shuttle from jfk (dont bother get a taxi) not much difference in the price, and you dont have to stop at everyone elses hotels first. we got a taxi back to the airport. read previous reviews about hotel entrance and lift, we had no problems and waited a max of 30 seconds for a lift to the lobby. hold on i have changed my mind, there was a morning the lifts were broken and we had to use stairs to go down 7 floors and the staff elevator to go up. was fixed by the time we came back in the evening, so not a problem really. location of the hotel is excellent, near to rockafeller centre, time square, shows. rooms were a lot bigger than i had expected and far more room that was needed since we only really used it at night. far too much to do in the short time we were there. already planning our next trip. We are going to stay stay a bit more upmarket newxt time in the hilton time square. We phoned up the week before our trip to confirm a time square view on a high floor, but were told that this could not be gauranteed and if we did get a view it would cost and extra $20 a night. when got there we had the most amazing view of time square on the 24th floor. So on check out we expected to pay the extra but we were not charged! Also on check in many people were being told there rooms were not ready but we just checked in and were able to head straight to our room. 20 mins later we were out exploring New York. didnt use the bar or restaurant so cant comment on that as there are far too many place to eat than in a hotel in new york. had breakfast in the dinner underneath the hotel everymoring as it was convienient. New York. we walked most places but the subway took a while to get used to but worked out ok for longer journeys. highly recommend - top of the rock, only people up there were us - staton island ferry (free, good shots of liberty - night bus tour - empire state buliding - ground zero - very sad place to visit just brought back all those terrible memories. - the american museum of natural history - central park (have a horse drawn ride) shopping - maceys (massive, took 4 visits to see it all) - non new york state residents get a discount in maceys go to the information centre in maceys to get a discount card. - century 21 (next to ground zero) - soho (more expensive shops) shops are everywhere and for every taste and price range. shows - we saw chicago, excellent block up from the hotel. - also went to see a taping of the late show with dave letterman which has been a dream of mine for ages. this made my trip! (just next tot he hotel in the ed sullivan theatre) highly recommend this hotel and may well use agaon

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of Broadway”
Reviews.Author: chall32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December. We were delighted to be given a room on the 32nd floor which looked onto Broadway/Time Square. Fantastic! The room was good value for NYC considering its location just off Broadway and about 5 mins walk to Time Square. We had breakfast at the Art Cafe on the corner about 30 seconds from the hotel. This was good value with efficient service (cheaper than the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Location is RIGHT ON!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeathJS21
Reviews.Content: I ranked this hotel above average because of the location, the quality of the room, the price we got from Priceline and the hotel lobby services. I would rank their hotel desk staff at below TERRIBLE because of the below issues. This is taken from my Trip Report on the NYC forums: Lets just say we got first got a bad taste in our mouth from the hotel. We tried to MOVE the dates when we were having SO much trouble getting there from Atlanta (weather and mechanical problems)...not a refund, but just for them to MOVE to the week of Christmas. They told us since we had booked through Priceline, that Priceline had to give them the ok. So, we call Priceline (and that was hard since most of it is automated and after trying 3 numbers) and they say that itâ€™s at the hotels discretion after reading their policy to us. So, we call the hotel, the hotel says Priceline HAS to call them. We call Priceline againâ€¦they say they canâ€™t call the hotel, the hotel should call them (and again itâ€™s the hotels discretion)â€¦call the hotelâ€¦well youâ€™re getting the picture. The hotel was NOT willing to work with us, and I found them quite hard to deal with. So Iâ€™ll have to give Customer Service a negative 5 on a scale of 0-5. But, once we arrived, check-in was a breeze and our room was REALLY nice. The room was better than expected and beyond expectations based on some of the sizes and reviews of these other hotels. Our room wasnâ€™t that small and was very adequate for a place to sleep. It was clean and confortable, had a safe, plenty of drawer space, lighting, windows, closet space. The bathroom was as good of a size as anywhere we've ever stayed, Hilton, Hampton Inn, Marriot.... We ordered room service one nightâ€¦very pricy, but good. Their menu for room service is their menu for that cafÃ© they have downstairs. To get to the lobby (and this may be how all of the hotels are in NY), but you must enter through revolving doors and take an elevator up 7 floorsâ€¦get off in the lobby then proceed to another block of rooms that I think went up into the 30â€™s. The only minor issue was the heatingâ€¦like almost non-existent. The outside temps werenâ€™t that bad last week, so that helped, but donâ€™t even bother with the thermostat!! We had it turned up on like 84, next time I look at itâ€¦it turned itself down to 80 with an inside temp of 72â€¦then I bump it back up to 84, then look at it again and itâ€™s 74. The room temp never heated to above 70â€¦unless we took a HOT shower. Sometimes weâ€™d just run the water and steam up the place to warm it up some. It may have just been our room, but take a sweatshirt and sweatpants just in case. IT couldn't hurt, but we were comfortable and it really was no different that visiting my parents who keep theirs on 68 or 69 all year. The location was excellent. Times Square was just a block or twoâ€¦.our theatre was just up the streetâ€¦all the food on 9th avenue was just a couple streets over. NICE NICE NICE!!! A really short walk to everything to do and see in Midtown Manhatten. There was a subway to hit the 1 line a VERY short walk from the hotel. The Art Cafe was right beside our hotel, and there are a lot of bagel and muffin cafe's to dart in and out of nearby. There is also a McDonald's on the same block as our hotel, but it doesn't open until 10:00...so don't expect breakfast or coffee there. Overall I couldn't have been happier with our hotel. I am a very picky person and was THRILLED at the location, the quality of the rooms and the services...though I couldn't complain enough about their staff and how uninviting and unhelpful they were. You could tell they didn't care if we were there or not. I will have pictures of our trip up on our website: www.heatherandshannon.com later this week.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: ziggy56
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for everything, friendly staff and nice clean rooms,, first time in New York, canÂ´t wait to go back, would have no hesitation in staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights at the beginning of December and was our first time in New York. We chose the Novotel primarily because of its location which could not be faulted. We had a room on the 32nd floor which overlooked Broadway and if you looked to the side you could see Times Square. The restaurant was expensive so we ate elsewhere. Previous posts mention the diner on the corner which served great food at reasonable prices. You may have to get there early for breakfast as it was always busy at this time. Unusual in that the reception is on the 7th floor and the small entrance area at street level was sometimes busy with people coming and going, especially if they had suitcases. All in all we had a fantastic time in New York and the Novotel provided all that we wanted. Would probably stay there agan but would check alternatives in the same location to check prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, camera stolen from room...”
Reviews.Author: kate_wiggy
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here due to overbooking at our original choice of hotel. Average hotel, clean, great location. Our booking could not be found so were upgraded eventually to a room with a view of Broadway/Times Square. Had it not been for the view the hotel would have been a disappointment. We locked all valuables in the case each day, however accidently left the camera in our room to go to breakfast and it was stolen. Hugely disappointing effort from the manager, switched hotels as felt unsafe in a room which obviously was not secure, and stayed at the Hilton Times Square - far better choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vhuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Novotel for 4 nights near the end of November. We had been reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and were a little worried about the handful of negative ones on here; but as it turned out, the hotel was excellent and we couldn't really find fault with anything. Stayed in a king size room which had minibar, desk, wireless internet access (we didn't try this), radio alarm, telephone, satellite TV, electronic safe, hairdryer, iron and ironing board - pretty much everything you needed for a comfortable stay. As with all hotels, the minibar was very expensive so stay away from it if you can - there are plenty of places within walking distance of the hotel if you need refreshments. The minibar is one of those new ones that senses when items are removed, so even if you take something out and don't use it, you'll still be billed!!! Room was a very good size and much bigger than anything we've stayed in in the U.K. Very clean, and we had daily housekeeping - clean towels, bathroom, beds made, etc every day. We ate one night in the Cafe Nicole in the hotel (on the same floor as the lobby), the food was lovely although the drinks were on the expensive side (40 dollars or about 23 quid(!!) for a bottle of a Chilean Merlot) - check before you order as the menus only list wine prices by the glass! Service in the restaurant was really good and when we asked the waiter if he knew any other good places to eat (girlfriend is vegetarian), he gave us the names of a couple of great restaurants and even printed out directions for us! The hotel is in a perfect location, it's situated right on Broadway, the entrance is just off the main street (on 52nd). Perfectly suited for seeing all the main attractions - Times Square was 5 minutes walk, Central Park was around 10-15 minutes walk, Empire State / Macy's etc, around 20 minutes walk away. Nearest subway station is 2 minutes walk away so also ideal if you want to travel this way. Our room price didn't include breakfast, we were tempted by the room service breakfast (around 35 dollars with taxes), but there is a lovely little place right under the hotel called Art Cafe - this does great breakfasts and is a very friendly little place; give it a try and save a few quid at the same time. Overall - really had a great time and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but who trains the staff? Basil Fawlty?”
Reviews.Author: Land_and_See
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel in mid-November, and the location and price of the hotel (for Times Square/Manhattan) can't be beat, HOWEVER, who trains the staff at this hotel?? Even ordinary requests like additional towels (since the room was NOT visited by housekeeping during the day) were botched. Anything slightly out of the ordinary was met with shoulder shrugs and blank stares. If we had been treated like they cared about our experience at their hotel, this review would be quite different. We met one understanding late-night maintenance person (who delivered clean towels to the room). Other than that, the attitude of the staff is universally poor, so it has to be a 'management' thing and not particular individuals. New Yorkers in general are very friendly and helpful, therefore, the management of this hotel must go out of their way to re-educate the staff that they hire to be dismissive of customer's requests. If you simply check-in, get the room that you want, and get to check-out without having to deal with the front desk, this is a great place to stay, however, heaven help you if you need any assistance from the staff. If I had it to do over again I would pay the extra $30-$40/night for a different experience. We read the reviews on this site and decided to take a calculated gamble as there were some negative reviews due to staff and attitude....well.......we got burned and it did put a damper on an otherwise great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: KCOULL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the PERFECT location for the price. The front desk people leave a lot to be desired.... they are COLD and need a few lessons in customer service. After reading the reviews, it seems to be hit or miss with the help at this hotel. I never had a bellman help me and my daughter with anything, and the other employees never looked us in the eye- a telling trait.... it may be because we're not 5 foot 7 blonde and skinny.... But, who cares? You're in NEW YORK CITY. Enjoy "Hairspray" right next door, or take a short taxi ride, or long walk to any other play you will ever want to see. I highly reccommend WICKED. Take a walk a few blocks away and you can experience the street side stores, a grocery, and the atmosphere of real New York City. My husband paid 29.00 extra for the Times Square View, and it was awesome. We had no heating/cooling problems, no noise problems, the room was big, clean, and comfortable. Stay here if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, room cost and facilities - loved it”
Reviews.Author: KiwiAussie
Reviews.Content: Location, room cost and facilities at the Novotel were superb! As first timers to NYC, my husband and I were extremely impressed by the hotel's convenient location to so many major highlights, including Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue and Central Park. The room size was great and there was ample space for me to keep the shopping bags and still breathe! The staff members were very accommodating with a late check out. Whilst there was no fridge in the room, there are some great delis just outside the hotel - particularly convenient for breakfast. I got the hotel through Priceline and was very pleased with the cost. Not sure how much the room would be otherwise. I would definitely return to this hotel and highly recommend that you consider staying here for an excellent NYC experience. From Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bubel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day holiday to New York. The Novotel had overbooked themselves and we could not check in upon arrival (tired after a long journey)...despite having booked (& paid!) many months before. However, the staff was great...they gave us 10 USD for a cab and transferred us to a similar-standard hotel 2 blocks away for the first night (we kept the tenner and walked). They made up for this, by giving us the best room ever the next day: 32nd floor with full view of Times Sq. This had to be the best view in NYC...They also gave us one night's refund and a free breakfast, which was good and plentiful. The location is second to none, with Times Sq, Empire State, Rockefeller centre,Central park and major shows all in walking distance. Also, departure point for Gray's hop-on/hop-off sightseeing tours is very close, so you will be sure to get the best seat on the bus! Waiting times at reception were a bit long, but most staff were very nice and helpful. Room was comfy and clean, with big TV and good bathoom. We would definitely recommend staying at the Novotel! Try to get a room no. ending in 03 or 04 on a high floor to get the amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: johniec
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated on Times Square with some great night views from the lobby ,restaurant and bar which start on the 7th floor.Rooms are large with good facilities but be sure to ask for a view over the square. Air con is off in October whiich was irritating as it was quite warm during our visit. With the windows open at night it was noisy but atmospheric with the sounds of New York 22 floors below. The restaurant was interesting with moderately priced food(for a hotel) but very expensive drinks. Service varied from good to poor.A reduced tip to reflect this was met with abuse.Stand your ground! On the ground floor outside the hotel an excellent small cafe offered breakfasts at half the price.Also there are only two lifts to the lobby on 7th floor which often lead to long queues as one was always out of order. Air France staff also seemed to get priority! This Spoiled what could have been a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuziR
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 4 nights with my mum and sister. We booked on the basis of the reviews here and weren't disappointed. I have been to NYC twice before and this was easily the best hotel I'd stayed in. The location is everything. Its so easy to access most places in midtown on foot from the hotel and the subway line for Southferry (Statue of Liberty) is 2 blocks away at 50th St. Our room (922) was in need of a bit of sprucing up but it was very clean and that is the main thing. The bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. Our bedroom had 2 double beds and there was ample space for all our luggage and additional purchases. Having an in room safe was an added bonus. No tea and coffee making facilities though. One night we ate in Cafe Nicole and were very pleasantly surprised. The portions were huge and the food was fresh, well cooked and good value for money. It was great to eat our meal with such a fantastic view over Times Square. Beware that prices for a bottle of wine are not advertised and when we got our bill found out that a bottle of the house red was $35. We did have a glass of wine in the bar the following night and it was a large glass for $8, much better value for money. Recommendations for a good place for breakfast in Manhattan is the Tick Tock diner, located at the New Yorker hotel on 8th Ave and W34th. I have eaten breakfast there on all my visits to NY and would keep going back. Excellent pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: SB&BB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in New York and stayed in the Novatel, Times Square. Highly recommend this hotel due to its excellent location, value for money and quality rooms. The hotel is walking distance to Rockerfeller Centre, 5th Avenue, St Patricks Cathedral, Central Park, bus stop for the open top bus tours, Saks and theatre district. When you arrive do not be put off by the entrance off the main street. There is a lift to the lobby on the first floor which is beautiful. Although I recommend not drinking or eating in the hotel as we found it to be exceptionally expensive. The rooms were relatively spacious, we had four to a room (two double beds) and it was manageable. Highly recommend for value for money

Reviews.Title: “Wow, but WHOOPS!”
Reviews.Author: AbileneTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Texas and we stayed here Oct 18-23, 2006 as I celebrated my 55th birthday. The first room we checked into was clean and tidy but reaked of cigarette smoke. This was not the fault of the hotel because there are many European people who stay here and have no regard for smoking in a non-smoking room. We called guest services and were immediatley given a new room (#2914). As you are dropped off at the hotel, you'll enter on 52nd street and greeted by bellmen. In order to get to the lobby, you first take an elevator to the 7th floor. Sometimes this can be congested but it wasn't too bad. The main elevators in the lobby going all the way up to our room on the 29th floor ran fast and frequent. I was impressed. Forget about the wonderful views you see posted on websites about looking down Broadway onto Times Square. Probably 75% of the rooms in the Novotel DON'T have great views of Times Squares. My room overlooked the ugly Sheraton Hotel across the street, but that wasn't a bog deal for us. We spent most of our time OUTSIDE the hotel ENJOYING Times Square. But please be advised, if you are going there to hang out in your room to stare out the window at Times Square, ASK IN ADVANCE for a A ROOM WITH A VIEW. I was able to open our window and with some contortion, look out of it and snap a picture with my camera of Times Square, but forget about simply staring out the window onto Times Square for hours at a time. If the Novotel had Bay Windows on the rooms facing Broadway, this Hotel would beat all other New York hotels for the view looking onto Time Square. The location is one of the best for Broadway plays. We saw Phantom of The Opera (my second time) and it was grand. Just a few blocks from the Novotel. Hey, if you are looking for a good laugh, the play "Tina & Toni's Wedding) a few blocks away was an absolute HOOT! This was one of my best adventures in New York! Go see it and have a grand time and a meal too boot. (I danced with the bride ***and I don't like to dance*** and I also danced with two brides maids. Geeze this was a blast. Our room was very clean and tidy and I was very impressed with the maid service. I tipped here $10 and left gifts of unused subway cards and other things for the maid. Each morning our room was cleaned early and if we returned by lunch, we had a nice clean room. Hey, how about that hot water? You can't believe how fast you get hot water at the sink and shower! No waiting for 5 minutes for a hot shower. They must have a tankless system that heats the water in the room. We both were very happy about this feature. Plenty of hot water and great water pressure. The staff was very helpful and friendly and our check in and check out process was smooth and easy. We NEVER ate at the restuarant in the hotel because there are too many facsinating places in and around the hotel to eat. Our favorite place was the small cafe directly under the hotel at the corner of 52nd and Broadway. The food was very good, the service was grand and the prices were about 70% less than eating at the Novotel. The low point (and I mean REALLY LOW) in staying at the Novotel is the heating and cooling system. We had to call the maintenance staff 3 times because we were BURNING UP in our room. The whole time we were in the room, it was around 78 degrees. We tried to sleep with the windows open, but there is so much noise from the street (even up to the 29th floor) that it was impossible to sleep with an open window. The A/C system at the hotel runs on boilers and chillers (as I suspect many of the hotels are) and it doesn't allow an individual occupant to cool his/her room and the next door neighbor to heat his/her room. Had it not been for this one issue, I would have rated this hotel as OUTSTANDING, but instead, I slept in bed with the sheets off and woke up frequently because I was so hot IN OCTOBER! Lastly, the room was incredibly quiet. The windows are double glazed and when they are shut, you have no idea of the noise outside. Our bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “not so clean!”
Reviews.Author: laperla
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrrival at the Novotel, we (a group of 13) had discovered our early check in rooms were not available until 2:00pm. Okay fine. We had 23 pieces of luggage and the bellman was not pleased. He was rude at moments. Actually telling us where we actually thought we were going to put our luggage!! Implying that he wasn't going to help us! We felt very uncomfortable. The bellman finally told us he would bring the luggage to another part of the hotel and store it there. Okay fine. We went shopping. Came back to the hotel and discovered that the rooms (which we requested be next to each other) were on different floors. Not close to one another at all. Two of the three rooms were clean. Our room, the third room, was so gross. There were stains on the blankets. There were stains on the comforters. There were stains on the exposed mattress. The headboard had a gross substance, as well. We called the front desk numerous times to get moved immediately. Finally, the manager came up and moved us. Our next room on the 12th floor was clean. The location of this hotel could not be beat. The parking garage is so easy to get to. I don't think I would stay here again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and Large Rooms(for NYC)”
Reviews.Author: islandmap
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge finding a two night stay in NYC for under $500. The Novotel was a bargain for $369 each night. It is, by far, the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in NYC. The rooms are simple, very clean with a great view of Times Square. You could not ask for a better location if you are new to the City. The beds are new and very firm, which is what I like. The bathrooms are clean and spacious. There is a small refreshment center, but no inroom coffee station. Wireless internet is available, but only if you become a TMobile customer. The nice thing is you can then bring your laptop to breakfast and surf the web or email. The service has been great so far. On my arrival, I smelled smoke in a nonsmoking room. After calling the front desk, within minutes someone came up with an ionizing machine and deodorizor. The room was fresher than ever. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lynnandsteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week at the end of September. Was given a room on 31st floor with fabulous views of Times Square right round to the USS Intrepid and the river. Couldn't fault anything about this hotel. Clean rooms, helpful staff, good facilities. We didn't eat at the hotel, but why would you with the range of restaurants on offer just outside the door. We ate breakfast at Applejacks Diner just further up by the David Letterman theatre, fabulous and great value. Try Grand Central Station for the best seafood you will ever taste. Also for a great smoothie, we loved Jamba Juice. We felt really safe in this hotel - the security guards on duty in the evenings were charming but firm in their requests to see your room keys before allowing you entry into the lifts. All together we would have absolutely no hesitation in booking this hotel again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: 1DAVE
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the location of the hotel. Walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, pretty much everywhere. Got a deluxe kingsize room with city view. View from the hotel was exactly as shown on the photos on this site. Staff were friendly. Lastminute.com messed up the booking (gave us a smoking room in error) but the staff at the Novotel immediately rectified the error on check-in at no charge. The large number of Air France staff seemingly getting preferential treatment did bug me initially, but got over it pretty quickly. Housekeeping staff were helpful (when the toliet overflown, someone was up to fix it and clean up the bathroom within minutes), and the bellhops were the nicest, most helpful guys you could meet. If you're going to NYC as a tourist you could do much worse that this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LC&GC
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 5 night stay in this hotel for my 30th birthday. It was our first time in New York and the hotel was in an excellent location - everything was within walking distance. We stayed on the 30th floor and the views over Times Square were amazing. Have a drink on the terrace bar and take in the views from the hotel. Rooms were clean althougth bathrooms could have done with renovation. Staff were friendly. There is so much going on all the time in New York - we saw the new Will Smith movie being filmed. Grayline 48 hour hop on & off bus tour is a must to make sure you see all the sights. Visited Rockafeller Center - the Top of the Rock - during day for breathtaking views of the city & the Empire State Building. Tip - visit Empire State Building (no queues after 7pm) at night to see the views. Tribecca Grill is an excellent restaurant in the Tribeca district (part owned by Robert Di Nero) I would definately return to this hotel if visiting New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: shooshi-lou
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time to NY but my first time to the Novotel. I picked it due to the location, and I certainly wasnt disappointed. The rooms were a good size. All the hotel staff we dealt with were extremely helpful and polite. We grabbed a snack in the restaurant one night, the food was delicious, although a ittle expensive. My gin and tonic was $9. To avoid spending these kind of prices, go to the Art Cafe located downstairs for delicious sit in or take out food. We had breakfast there every morning. Yum! A few minutes walk and you are in the heart of Times Square. There is so much to see and do within walking distance, you can explore Times Suare, Broadway, 5th Avenue. The subway station is also very close on 50th street or at times square station. We used the subway as the most convenient way to access the rest of the island. It is perfect for getting down to areas like Ground Zero (Get off at Chamber Street) and Chinatown/Litte Italy area (Get off at Canal Street). Make sure you take a trip on the Staten Island Ferry. It is free and gives great views of Manhattan Island and the Statue of Liberty. I would highly recommend anyone looking for a clean, well located New York hotel to stay at the Novotel. I would stay there everytime I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for family”
Reviews.Author: Arax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel New York with our two children -toddler and pre-teen. The hotel was very well located, a step away from the Broadway theaters and from metro stations. We stayed three nights and saw all the sights by walking, except one day when we took the metro to catch the ferry going to Staten Island. The room was very clean, modern, and spacious, with nice view over Times Square. The CafÃ© Nicole offered a great breakfast buffet with a wonderful view, plus children ate free - so it was all the more worth it! Room service was also very efficient, with no long waiting for extra towels or amenities. The bellmen were very friendly and helpful, making us feel at home - away from home. The lobby area is beautifully designed, with a French touch! Many European tourists staying at the hotel make for a cosmopolitan feel. Parking at a daily rate (approx. 20$US) is arranged through hotel at an underground parking lot a block away. Would definitely stay at this hotel next time in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: emilyincolumbus
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews here and was not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. I arrived prior to 3pm but left my bags free of charge. The doormen were always pleasant and courteous, and brought my bags quickly when I returned. The woman at the front desk was very pleasant when I checked in and was quick to send someone up when I had trouble with my room key. The room was pretty large (for NYC), spotlessly clean, and had a nice bathroom and amenities. The minibar wouldn't open but that wasn't an issue. The view was not great but was better than others I've experienced in NYC, and even though my room was directly behind the elevators, I didn't hear a peep all night. Checkout was a breeze and I had no problems leaving my bags again after checking out. This time it was $1/bag, but I left them for about 6 hours so it was a good value. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. This is FAR nicer than any of the other 5 places I've stayed while visiting NYC. It's a great location, the restaurant next door is great for breakfast, it was clean, and the staff was friendly. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just enjoyed a fantastic long weekend in New York. There is so much to see and do and the weather was fantastic. The Novotel is fairly predictable in its bedrooms and decor to anyone who has stayed at any of its many European hotels. But what makes it the perfect destination is its fantastic location on W 52nd Street between Broadway and 8th. This is not only great for walking around the theatre, shopping and restaurant district but also being pretty centrally located on Manhatten island you've never got that far to go, either by bus or the easy to use tube, to explore all the fascinating different districts. Also the lobby, bar and restaurant are a cut above the European Novotels. Finally, compared with the other Times Square big name hotels it is reasonably priced. Just a great venue and a really pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't find much fault with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Novotel since 1995. Got a king non-smoking room on the 25th floor with nice views of Manhattan and the river. The room itself was very clean and somewhat larger than other New York hotel rooms. Bed was comfortable though the pillows were small. Room was cleaned each day by 1:00 p.m. Tried room service several times, and while the food was delivered in 20 minutes or less, it was just of average quality. Their restaurant menu is also available for room service, though the menu selections are very limited. Check-in was quick and curteous and the staff generally helpful. Overall, hard to find much to criticize about the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: beachboy381
Reviews.Content: Service: Since we stayed during Labor Day weekend, the hotel was pretty booked. When we checked in at 3:30PM (after waiting in line for 15 minutes), the front desk told us our room wasn't ready and to come back in 30 minutes. 45 minutes later we checked back (after waiting in another line for 20 minutes) and they said the room is still not ready and to come back in another hour. At 5:15PM our a room was finally ready. They put us in a room with 2 doubles (we originally requested a king) because nothing else was available. The next night they switched us to a room with a king bed. Room: Dated and relatively small. The room did have a great view of Times Square. The bathroom was also small. The water pressure was a bit low and there was little counter space. Location: Great location. Located in the theatre district and a couple blocks from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews..!!”
Reviews.Author: Brazil2006
Reviews.Content: After browsing tripadvisor for a proper hotel to stay with my two teenager kids, I chose Novotel. Location was the main concern, because itâ€™s just me (single mum) and the kids and weâ€™ve got to be safe while coming in and out the hotel. Confronting expectations versus reality, Novotel won, according to: 1.Location was really fantastic â€“ it could not be any better; 2.After reading all comments, I decided to have breakfast at the hotel just the first morning, although expecting to pay 20 dollars apiece. Great surprise, the kids being under 16 were not charged and I paid 15 dollars myself ... eat there the whole trip. The kids ate a lot; they must have given them some loss. 3.The room was more than ok.. you people are too fussy..!! 4.I never waited more than a couple of seconds for either lifts/elevators â€“ it was never an issue. 5.Despite asking for it, they didnâ€™t give me a room with a Time Square view.. they guy at the front desk mentioned something about paying an extra 30 dollars for it. We had a great time in NY and Novotel made it smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Woe votel New York”
Reviews.Author: andrew4
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Novotel and I booked it on the basis of the reviews on this site. I am a regular user of this site for booking hotels and this one turned out to be a little off the mark (in my opinion anyway). I have stayed in numerous Novotels in Europe and the rooms are generally clean, reasonably sized and well priced. Boy have they got a lot to learn in Novotel New York about value for money, good service, cleanliness and making you feel welcome. Firstly the positive, the location is excellent, close to all major sites and right in the heart of all the action. When we arrived at 12pm (early) we were told that they could not let us have a room as they were waiting for 'airline staff' as they have priority. Turns out all the Air France crew get in around early lunchtime and they get first priority. Anyway we didn't complain and returned two hours later and were then given a room. The room was on the 14th floor and it was the most dingy , dark, small,smelly room I've ever come across ( on a par with a Â£15 a night blackpool hotel, if you get my drift)The 'double' beds were marginally larger than two singles and it was really uncomfortable if two were sharing the same bed. I travel all over the world with my job so I'm not naive or have unreasonable expectations when it comes to value versus standard of room (particularly in large cities), I immediately asked for a different room and the check in staff weren't that happy with this and told me I would have to wait two hours to change. The second room did have a better view but was still very old worn and smelly (stale urine and dogs). At this point I wanted to change hotels but they'd already got my money ( booked on a no change rate on internet) so was reluctant to throw away this money and the kids were shattered after our long trip so we stuck it out (on the basis that we wouldn't be spending much time in the room anyway). We tried the breakfast one morning and that was a big mistake. It was 10.20 ( breakfast finished at 10.30) and I was unsure if we would be seated. The man in charge of seating said there was no problem and seated us. Anyway when we went to get food some very rude and agressive waiter told us to go away as breakfast was finished. He was literally removing all the food as we were trying to serve ourselves.I had words with him about his attitiude towards my kids and I just got a load of abuse. absolutely ridiculous.......If you do stay make sure you arrive early for breakfast and dont cross the aggresive waiters. The general staff attitude was 'reluctant to serve' and 'service with a grudge' (typical of a french hotel back in the early 90's). They seem to have serious moral issuse and probably need a new manager or refresher course on good hospitality. I used to be a Novotel fan as they offered reasonable rooms and were great for families, guess the Novotel New York has changed all that.......never again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: doyle65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position on 52nd Street. It is easy to navigate around the city from this ideal base. However, if you are looking for a glamorous hotel with plush rooms you should not think about booking this hotel. The rooms are adequate and clean but are in need of some renovation. The air conditioning worked fine if a little noisy. But the reason this hotel is worth the stay is the location. If you are like us you will spend little time in the hotel (just to sleep!!) in which case the room will not matter. However, be careful that if the room is not what you requested be sure to ask to be moved. We were put in a room overlooking the back streets with a double bed and a single bed settee for a family of four (with two teenagers!!) The desk clerk did change the room but was not very happy in doing so. The desk clerks overall were not very welcoming. We had been delayed over 24 hours on arrival and were looking for a welcoming face at the end of our journey. The desk clerk was most unsympathetic to our travelling woes.

Reviews.Title: “What more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: Superb
Reviews.Content: Location brilliant. Terrace at night amazing - everything happening right there in front of you. Staff really friendly - nothing too much trouble. Breakfast good - we didn't eat for the rest of the day. Asked concierge where we could go for a reasonably priced evening meal and he recommended Cafe Mon Cherie on 9th between 50 and 51 Street. Excellent 3 course meal with glass of wine and coffee for $19.99 each. All freshly prepared - really worth a visit. Whole experience tremendous - only downside was the heatwave but... what the heck it's New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: druidscross
Reviews.Content: The Novotel has a very downtown, cosmopolitan atmosphere - partly because the reception area seems to be permanently full of Air France staff in smart uniforms! The reception staff are extremely friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms are well decorated, quite roomy (maybe not to an American- but to a Brit fine - and compared to most Parisienne hotels HUGE!). Our room had a spectacular view towards Times Square. The subway is about 5 minutes walk away and there are lots of small shops and cafes in the area including a 24 hour drugstore. You take a lift from the street to reception and another lift from reception to your room. This is only a problem if your in the queue behind those Air France people who travel in a herd with a lot of luggage! Great value - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively inexpensive and great location!”
Reviews.Author: HokieGal
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC with teenage daughter. The hotel location was excellent. We had no trouble getting the room type we requested. A/C was quiet and comfortable, water temperature and pressure was good in the shower. We thought the room size was fine and were very satisfied with the quality of furnishings. There were several inexpensive cafe restaurants close by. Our favorite was Cosmic Cafe for breakfast and lunch. We enjoyed the double-decker bus tour and would highly recommend the "Behind the Emerald Curtain" tour Saturday morning at the Gershwin Theater. I got a better price on the hotel's web site than when I called the hotel directly. We are recommending the Novotel to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: KKing94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the price. Booked hotel through hotels[--] and was happy to find that we were in the middle of everthing going on in NY. The cafeteria downstairs served great food, the Color purple was playing 100 feet from the hotel and 5th ave was not even a cab fare away. The staff and security was excellent. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Could not believe it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catsmum
Reviews.Content: I could not believe our luck..............when we booked we were told the hotel was on 52nd and 7th, which of course it was .........but another name for 7th is BROADWAY!!! There we were, right in the centre of New York. From the balcony ( that was fab too) we were able to look right down to Times Square and just across the road was Mama Mia. The actual rooms were clean with everything you would need from a city hotel. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on this hotel using priceline. The location was perfect for our purposes (doing touristy things). Practically on Broadway and Times Square, close to Central Park. Room was clean and plenty big enough for the two of us (but not palatial). We had a room at the end of the building and it was a little dark. Front desk staff were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herbsUK
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I stayed in this hotel in May after refusing to stay in the nearby Ediston Towers- see other review - and wished we'd stayed here originally. The hotel is modern and we were overjoyed when, after asking for a room with a view, we were given one overlooking Times Square. The location is great, rooms clean and tidy and the staff are nice. Just one thing, if you go to the bar for a drink like we did and get some nibbles plonked in a bowl in front of you, don't think they're complimentary as we had a couple each and had a silly price added to our bill ! Apart from that we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For this hotel "total" price means something else!?”
Reviews.Author: LoveSol
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the hotelâ€™s website, (I book hotels and flights always on-line so I'm quite used to it) At the end of the booking process, I was given a TOTAL PRICE for the stay and asked if I authorize them to charge my credit card for that amount, to which I selected YES. 3 weeks later I see in my statement a charge from this hotel for 220 USD more than the total amount which I was originally given, when I contacted the hotel, Iâ€™m told that that charge is for taxes. The problem is, there is nowhere in their website or in the confirmation email that I received, telling me that Iâ€™m going to be charged this extra 220 USD, there's a breakdown of the "type" of daily tax but not sign or clarification about the total amount I was due to be charged for (without my consent!) or if the tax are, or are not included in the total price. I felt cheated and I expressed my unhappiness and frustration for the fact that this hotel has charged me this amount without my consent, the only solution they gave me was to cancel the booking and refund me the total amount. After this incident Iâ€™d be more than happy to do so, but unfortunately, itâ€™s now too late to book any other of the hotels we liked, they are fully booked or prices have increased over our budget. Conclusion: if this is happening before arriving...what can we expect once we get there? Well, Iâ€™ll let you know!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leoburk
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel for me and my wife...excellent location, views of broadway, great staff, and the bonus was the lobby and the lounge, with the outdoor 2nd floor patio where we had dessert one night. Very good sized rooms, good a/c, comfortable beds, tv and lighting good, nice bathrooms (hardwood floors? that's a first). I cannot imagine a negative review. Obviously a favorite with the Euro tourists. I would book it again. Never felt as big as it was - which is a postive.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel seems to be getting good reviews from customers outside the US and I now know why. To them it may be good, but my Wife and I stayed there for a weekend to celebrate our first Wedding Anniversary and the room and Bathroom was old and dirty and the AC was not working correctly. The staff was nice but that's about it. I would certainly look for a better Hotel if and when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ny Novotel in June 2006 for our honeymoon on our first visit not only to NY, but to the US. After reading some reviews on this site I mailed ahead and slipped in the fact it was our honeymoon. On check-in we were given a free upgrade to a view on 22nd floor of Times Sq/Broadway and about 20mins after getting to the room, room service brought us a complimentary bottle of champagne and a hand written card congratulating us, which we thought was lovely! The location is great, right on Times Sq and all its tourist attractions, and only a few mins walk to central park or all the broadway theatres, inc the theatre that we had tickets for.. The lift issue was a bit of a pain as already mentioned, we had to wait for the lobby lift several times.. but the lifts from reception to rooms were always quicker... The room was large and the bed was HUGE. The aircon worked great, wasnt that loud to leave on overnight, the elevators although right outside our door didnt bother us as I had read on here. The Bathroom was bright and modern looking. Like others on here we didnt eat at the hotel with so much choice outside, but we did have a drink on our way our one night, $12.50 (plus tip) for 2 small lagers.. We had breakfast at the Art cafe below every day and found the service fine and the food very good. Ellens Stardust diner oppositte the hotel is a good place for food, the waiting staff sing for you constantly and its great fun and not too bad price wise.... We would also recommend the hop on/hop off bus tours.. I would have no problem staying at this hotel again in the future....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel last week, we arrived really late and I had phoned in advance to say it was my husbands birthday, they upgraded us to a room on 25th Floor overlooking Times Square, the view was stunning. We were also given a complimentary drink in the hotel bar which was nice, the room was a good size with a king size bed, clean and comfortable. The decor of the hotel is very modern and the helpfulness of the staff made our stay worthwhile. The food however was pricey so opted to eat outside. The only downside was the business center, which was awful, the initial charge is $7.50 even if you are only on the computer for 2 minutes. Either than that, we had a good time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family of five”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching on the web we decided on this hotel. Since we had two adults and three teens we had to get two rooms. It was perfect because the rooms were adjoining. We had a wonderful view of Times Square and Broadway. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the size was adequate. The staff was always available for anything we needed. We got some good tips on places to eat and how to get the appropriate transportation. The room temperature was adjustable. This was our first family vacation in New York and we were extremely pleased with the hotel and the location was perfect. If you are visiting for the first time take a little time to get familar wth where the subway lines run and then buy a 7-day or 3-day pass. It is safe and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristyWA
Reviews.Content: The Novotel has a great New York City location. I've stayed in other comparable hotels in the city, including The Belvedere, and the Notovel is the place to stay! This is the quietest hotel you could ever want with comfortable beds and easy access to the subway lines. We had a view of Times Square and we were a very short walk to Central Park. The room was clean and comfortable, with a lot of room to walk around. The bathroom had fantastic water pressure and there were no complaints. The elevators were never a problem and we were located on the 31st floor! The room service provided very good food with large portions and it arrived in a timely manner. Our 5 day stay was a pleasure and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL perfect for Long Weekend in NY!”
Reviews.Author: GSRl
Reviews.Content: What an excellent place to stay! Central, quiet, freindly and relaxed! We were there for a long weekend at the beginning of May (encompasing 2 birthdays, 1 significant!) We got to the hotel at 0030 and the staff were very efficient and friendly. There were beautiful fresh flowers in our rooms for our birthdays. Ours was on the 32nd floor and the view, then next day, out over the Hudson was to die for. It was big (huge double bed, and a separte seating area, with a sofa) quiet, clean, the sheets were cool and pressed, and there were plenty of hangers in the cupboard. OK, it was Euro-bland but how much time are you going to spend in the room when NY is outside??? As it was NY we felt we had to have a beer before bed, and although the hotel bar was shut (it was 0130 by this time) the concierge recommened the bar across the street which never seemed to shut, and had great beer and vodka. The hotel is so central, very close to all the midtown sights. We walked almost everywhere. Central Park is 10 minutes, as is 5th Avenue, the Rockerfeller Centre and Times Square. Access to the Subway is easy and there are always cabs outside the hotel. As for the comments made about breakfast - get a life!!! This is NY the best Delis are on your doorstep - why on earth would you eat hotel food when you can have whatever you want just outside. We travelled with Expedia and got a fantastic rate on the hotel. The NOVOTEL NY is perfect for a long weekend - they even put Chocolate Birthday Cakes and cards in our room, from the hotel staff! What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend at the Novotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that I don't understand how this hotel could get a bad review. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and resorts and I have never had as good of service as I did at the Novotel. This hotel is great because it is not overly pretentious and everybody is so nice. Anyone who complained about this hotel must be extremely hard to please and have unrealistic expectations. The rooms are spacious and clean,the staff is very nice and attentive, the food is wonderful, and the location is the best in Midtown. I had an amazing view of Times Square from my room and the terrace at Cafe Nicole also has an amazing view. The hotel is very safe (a lift takes you to the 7th floor lobby and guards are at street level, they are very cautious as to only let guests enter the hotel). We ordered room service for breakfast everyday and they had amazing pastries and coffee. You must try the Trilogy Mousse for dessert at the cafe it is wonderful. I would definitely stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views pity about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled068
Reviews.Content: Have just come back after a fantastic 5 days in New York with two friends. The hotel location is fantastic. Situated withibn walking distance of lots of sights and shops. The room was ok (very dated). It's the first hotel of that standard that there was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room, and we had to stand on a chair to reach the safe. But the main point of my review was the breakfast. Question: How many staff does it take to clear tables and reset them? Answer: None. Every morning we had great fun watching people trying to get breakfast but also trying to get a table to sit at. We watched the restaurant manager wandering around doing nothing, while dishes were piling up. There were more dirty tables than set ones. Not good enough. Will be back to New York but not the Novatel. P.s. the toaster didn't work either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptions!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner went to New York to celebrate my 21st birthday so of course we wanted a nice hotel with great views etc. Never really got a good deal on this hotel but all the fotos in brochures, expedia and this site gave it justice. Apon arriving at the hotel we got put in room 2319 it was a good sized room but when we looked out the window the view was terrible, We looked onto offices that we could not see in their windows but they could see in ours. We were not happy with the room as it was a special occasion and we wanted everthing to be perfect. We went back to reception to ask for another room and they said Yes to get out bags and wait 4 hour until all other rooms were cleaned. We went out and when we arrived back another person told us there was no rooms for us to have with a view of time sq. Still not happy we waited and spoke to someone else and she said if we wanted a room with a view we would have to pay $100. It was a bit much on top of what we had already paid but it was worth it when we got put in a room. Room 1803 had the most amazing views, it made our trip extra special. It was relaxing just to sit at the window and watch the traffic and when the window was closed we could not hear any noise at all. We also ate in the hotel restaurante and that was amazing, service was very good, but very expensive. Being from Scotland my partner wore his Kilt the night we went to the restaurante and they staff and most guests were so rude, they basically laughed in his face. In other reviews i read how they got champagne or cake on special occasions, but my partner emailed the hotel about my birthdday and i never got any of this in either of my rooms when we arrive. After all the carry on with swapping rooms i was not the staffs favourite person so i tought they were very rude. Over all this hotel was in a fab location, 5 mins from Time Square, 10 mins from 5th avenue and Central Park and it only took us 10 mins to get to Macys and the Empire State Building. The best thing about the hotel was the cleaners, they were in everyday with fresh towels and they cleaned the room amazingly. Never even seen them but that done a great job. The staff are rude and are only there to pick up a wage at the end of the month. If it was not for the location and good rooms they hotel would be poor. Also watch out for the mini bar. We thought it was expensive so we baught out own juice and sweets, took the hotels out and out put ours in the fridge til morning. We did not know that it is electronically detected that anything that gets removed from the fridge goes straight to Reception so we were shocked when we got a bill of $245. I have reccomended this hotel to everyone, and as i was not fussed about getting along with the staff in the hotel i will deffo be back here to stay. Will ask for a Time Sq room tho so i dont get stung for $100 again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to NYC and the first to stay at the Novotel, the last time was at the Metro which was awful in comparison. The trip was to celebrate our 10th Wedding anniversary, so I emailed ahead to ask for a good view on a high floor. We received a lovely email back saying that they would of course accommodate our request, and indeed they did! We had room 3205 which is on the 32nd out of 34 floors and looked bang smack out onto Times Square - breathtaking! About 10mins after getting into our room we had the a bottle of champagne delivered and a handwritten card for our anniversary which was such a lovely touch. The room itself was basic, but clean and the beds are so large that you feel like you are sleeping in a different postcode!! We were lucky with our room though. Our other party members were put into a smoking room on the first night (they don't smoke) and told that there were no other rooms available that evening. The following day when they went to change rooms the one they gave them was even worse (22nd floor - not sure which room but looked out onto the Hudson if you craned your neck round the window....). The room smelled really damp and of urine!!! We went back to reception and we saw a different person who was much more attentive than the first person, who changed the room straight away. The room was much better (room 2406 - I think) but the following night they had a blockage in the toilet that made it overflow into the bedroom!!! So overall they didn't have a good experience with rooms! The location is great and the rooms are so quiet - just what you need after a long hard day out in the city! Although not sure how quiet the rooms are on lower floors... We didn't eat in hotel as there is so much more choice in the city. Word of warning though, don't eat at the Art Cafe on the corner of the block - the food is terrible along with the service and not that cheap either! My breakfast looked as though it had been in a fight before it hit the plate! We found a fab little place for breakfast on our last day (isn't that always the case!!) called Fluffys cafe, only a couple of blocks up from the hotel. The food is really fresh (the pancakes are to die for) and the price is not bad either! We paid $103 per night so for this amount we would recommend giving the Novotel a go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 5oclocksomewhere
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Novotel on W 52nd for a three night weekend at Easter. We got an internet rate for $189 night which is great for NY. Quick cab ride ($5) from Penn Station. I don't know why so many reviewers were offended by the lift to the lobby. Staff on first floor was friendly and we never waited more than a minute for the lift. Main lobby on 7th floor is apacious and very pretty. Check-in was a breeze and we had no problem changing rooms for one with a view on the 29th floor. Hotel full of mostly French and German travelers that I could see. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient and it was a very easy stroll to theatres and many other atractions. My only complaint was the room was warm (Stuffy) and a maid informed me the temperatures were fixed until summer when the air conditioning could be used. I walked two blocks to Duane Reade and bought a $10 fan and was happy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wetfarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for a week and all that I can say is that this hotel was excellent in numerous ways. The location was superb, right on Broadway and only a 5 minute walk to the centre of Time Square, 20 mins from Rockafella and about 40 mins from the Empire State Building, 10 mins from Columbus Circle and Central Park, all walking of course. Its close by to some good restaurants and with it being right on Broadway entertainment is virtually on your doorstep. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and i cannot fault them in anyway as I have had unpleasant experiences before with rude and arrogant hotel staff, though not here. The rooms are clean and well serviced everyday, and noise is at a minimum. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay in it again when in New York. If anyone wants more info feel free to email me. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “US Business Travelers>>Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: To U.S. travellers. As you see, most reviewers for this hotel are European. The sense of a quality hotel is very different the a US sensibility, particularly one well travelled. First the good. It is a great location, walking distance to both Times Square (2 blocks) and Central Park (5 blocks). All the theatres are within walking distance as well. If you ask for an room number ending in 05, you get a phenomenal view of Times Square. Now the not so good. If you are on business, stay away. If you are on vacation and can get a rate under $250, this hotel will do just fine. This is basically a Holiday Inn run by the French with the attitude that comes with it. The hotel is in dire need of a renovation. Tired furnishings and decor. The concierge is inept, the lighting in the rooms is horrible with no wattage over 50. The WiFi is erratic. The TV's small. I had mold in my bathroom. Their solution, not clean it, but recaulk it. Hmmm. An interesting solution. The towels are the ABSOLUTE WORST I have ever experienced, period. Ask for extra's upon check-in. And the phone system is out of the 1980's. So, for business travellers or those used to upscale hotels, AVOID IT. For those on a budget, if you get the right rate, it will do fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel with my husband, sister and 8 year old daughter, all four of us were in one room with 2 double beds and we found it plenty big enough, after all you're only there to sleep !! Room was clean and quiet, maid service every day. Never encountered any problems with staff and they were always pleasant. Didn't eat in hotel, as mentioned by others, there are many places to eat and most are reasonably priced. Hotel is in a fantastic position, this was my main reason for picking it as not sure how far an 8 year old would be willing to walk. We were on the 17th floor and had a fantastic view of Times Square,. Times Square is amazing, Toys r Us has a working ferris wheel inside, great for kids young and old. Get to the Empire State Building early and pay the extra to got to the 102 floor (extra $14) it well worth it. We got there about 9.45am any later and we'd have been queuing for ages. If you can take a trip to Serendipity3 (225 E60th Street) they do amazing desserts and foot long hot dogs !! but have been told they can get VERY busy on an evening (we went late afternoon) Used the subway but it was a bit confusing !! Cabs are reasonable less than $20 down to Battery Park and a great way to see the sights. Would definitely stay at the Novotel again and would recommend it to anyone. Already planning my next visit :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Position and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Thermocat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip to New York City (April 2006) and stayed at the Novotel New York. We caught the bus from JFK airport to Port Authority station and saved $40 US dollars in taxi fares. The station was 15-20 minutes walk away from the hotel through the hustle and bustle of all the action in Times Square. The hotel itself was at the top end of Times Square in an excellent position for a short visit to New York. The room was comfortable, with a large bed and adequate bathroom. We had hoped that this room was as per the pictures advertised on Expedia but was a little disappointed that the room was average but clean all the same. We stayed in room 3208 which had a great view of Times Square and the surrounding neighbourhood and high enough to also avoid the general city noise from below. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are plenty of deli's and restaurant nearby with excellent choice of food and great value for money - we didn't think New York was as expensive as we had read from other reviews (and we're not loaded!) The visit to the Empire State building is definately worth it but be prepared for long queues (this also goes for Statue of Liberty) and security checks but once up on the 86th floor the view is breathtaking on a clear day. For those scared of lifts (like me!) you only have to go through a 45second ride from ground to the 86th but I can safely say that my fear of lifts has been conquered as you cannot go anywhere in NYC without getting into a lift!!!!! There is so much to see we couldn't get round everywhere in the time we had. Central Park is lovely and would have liked to have spent more time wandering. A walk over the Brooklyn Bridge for true romance sealed with a kiss from your beloved in the centre of the bridge with the Manhatten skyline behind you is a must ;0) Oh yeah, and keep your eyes peeled for that cheeky Naked Cowboy on Times Square.... say no more!!! Will definitely be back for more - Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alibop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Novotel in April 2006. We thought its was fantastic. The location couldnt be better for all the sites! We had a time square view which was just amazing, didnt matter time of day or night you looked out! (on the 14th floor) The hotel staff were very friendly. It was my friends birthday when we were there and when we got back that day there was a massive piece of cheesecake and a birthday card for her - which I thought was a lovely touch. Our room had 2 double beds in, mini bar, tv etc. The only thing was no coffee/tea but that was very minor. All in all Id have no problem staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of it”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel New York over the easter bank holiday in April 2006 and had a fantastic time. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms were clean and had everything we needed. They weren't luxurious but you get what you pay for. We had no problem with uncomfortable beds or thin walls as i have just read on a previous review, the staff were all very polite and we had a great view of Manhatten from the 21st floor. The maid cleaned and changed our towells everyday and even left my boyf a slice of cake on the last night as i had informed reception that it was a special bday for him. Overall, a fab hotel in a good location. If you want to stay somewhere more plush than i suggest booking an alternative hotel. Do watch out for the price of the room bar though, $5 for a small bottle of water!!!

Reviews.Title: “a dangerous stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is awful. The prices were too high for what you get. he hotel is ugly the staff is unattentive and it is also dangerous to stay there. I saw a homeless person wandering on my floor (the fifth) and I was terrified. Obviously the security staff is not doing their job. When I reported the incident to security and informed them I was scared as I am a woman the director simply stated that he cannot control every aspect of what is happening since much of a hotel is public space. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK after a weeks stay in the Novotel. What can I say? Perfect location, brief walks to both Times Square and Central Park, close enough to Times Sq. for great views, we stayed on the 32nd floor two rooms on either side of the hotel. One room with great views of Times Sq and the other room with great views of the Hudson and the sunsets! Rooms are a nice size the kids had a king size bed and a double sofa bed, facilities good and clean, only problem was, no coffee maker in the room! Still real nice cafe on the corner at the bottom of the hotel, so no great problem. Perfect for the theatres all within easy walking distance, mamma mia, hairspray,wicked, lestat, producers, odd couple, history boys, spamalot,phantom ALL within five minutes walk. Located in the heart of Midtown, Manhattan s theater district on 52nd and Broadway No problem recommending this hotel to anyone, great price great location. if you're going soon, have fun, and know that we are jealous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: shinty0105
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel with my husband and son in the first week of April and found no complaints at all with the Hotel. Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking the Hudson River,great views.We never felt the urge to go and ask for another room as it was spacious,clean,and was adequate for our needs,and after all we were only sleeping in it! Having said that the views from the Restaurant were stunning! On two occasions we ate in the Hotel,once for breakfast which was a typical buffet breakfast and very nice,the other was for dinner one night as it was torrential rain outside and did'nt want to venture out.The menu was fine and the food was excellent,again could not fault it,we also thought it was reasonably priced. The location of the Hotel is fantastic with a five minute walk to the heart of Times Square,ten minutes to Central Park and basically central to everything. The Staff in the Hotel were courteous and very polite, no problems there either. We ate in the Art Cafe down from the Hotel for breakfast the other days and that is very reasonable and good food, my son loved the pancakes! Overall would not hesitate in going back to the Novotel in New york as we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in History - Never, Ever Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: This FRENCH orientated hotel is WELL past itâ€™s used by date. It is well worn, tired and the staff (or should I say the people in uniform) are only there to pick up a pay cheque and tips (no more, no less). This was our third stay in three years and there is no loyalty recognition whatsoever! The staff downstairs (bell staff) will lift there head to see who is walking in and then will return to chatting amongst themselves, without even a smile or a nod to say hello. The reception staff are no better, check you in then hand over a room key.
