The rooms are basic, broken lamps, hideous paintings (see photo), pillows are as thin as an iPod Nano, mattresses have their own insects species living within (which make you itch throughout the night), and you cannot change the room temperature. If possible pack your own bathroom, these are disgusting!! Pubes are a common occurrence from previous guests or the housekeeping! We requested certain items from housekeeping and only ever received half of what we actually asked for. Walls between rooms are paper thin, you can hear conversations, coughing and even itching. The volume on the television is fixed to an un-adjustable low volume. CafÃ© Nicole was good, needs a menu overhaul with more items added to the menu. Staff, once again are there to just pick up a pay cheque. You may well ask why we have continued to stay here, well Position, Position, Position. But never, ever again, you have been warned. If you want an enjoyable holiday, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean - all you need”
Reviews.Author: kiwiinlondon
Reviews.Content: Got this room at a special rate on Travelocity - think the normal room rates are almost triple! Times Square: 10 mins walk Empire State: 15-20 mins walk Downtown Manhatten: recommend cab - 5-10 mins $10 Central Park: 10 mins walk Newark: 60 mins $65 taxi JFK: 25-30 mins $45 taxi Madison Square Garden: 20 mins walk Is also a couple of minutes walk to a main subway stop that is one stop from Times Square. Clean room, good space with a huge bed, shower, bath, couch, with a very handy ice machine outside. Made our stay so enjoyable as it was central and clean. View on the cafe terrace overlooks Times Square. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff, great location, god size rooms, clean rooms everything you need. Has no lesure facilitys except for a tiny workout room near the reception. Didn't eat in the hotel as prices were much higher than outside the hotel. Will stay here again when I am next in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel made my stay quite enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: NahLaterz
Reviews.Content: I spent a great amount of time researching hotels in the Times Square area and after reading the reviews on here I decided go go with the Novotel for a number of reasons. One was the proximity to all areas in Manhattan that we needed to get to by walking. I made the reservation through Expedia and got a very good rate by pre-paying the entire amount 3 weeks before our trip. Anyway, we arrived on Saturday afternoon and were given a room on the 31st floor with a view of the river and a lot of buildings. Now this of course was not what I had envisioned when I made my reservation. I really wanted the Times Square view. It wasn't really for myself because I've been to NYC on many occasions, but it was my girlfriend's birthday and I knew that having that view would be very exciting for her. So after we got to the room, I immediately went back downstairs to the front desk and explained to them my situation. The front desk clerk wasted no time in switching our location from the riverside view on the 31st floor to the Times Square view on the 27th floor. There was no hassle or problems whatsoever and she appeared very happy in being able to accommodate my request. After we got to our room, the view that we had from that location was INCREDIBLE!!!!! I couldn't have asked for better. There was only one thing that was somewhat irritating and that was having to catch an elevator from the street to the lobby and vice versa. But other than that, everything was good. The room was somewhat small, but very cozy and clean. We had a great selection of TV channels as well. We didn't spend a great amount of time in the room however. We were literally steps away from the Broadway Theatre where we saw The Color Purple on Saturday night and 1 block up from Caroline's Comedy Club where we had made reservations for on Sunday evening. All the staff at the hotel were very pleasant from the security guards to the front desk manager. We had a very exciting time and I most definitely would come back and also refer friends and family to the Novotel for future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good VFM (Value for Money)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the initial shock of the street level access/lobby and emerge from the lift (8 floors up?) into the reception lobby, you're in for a pleasant surprise. It's very nice (see pictures on Expedia as it does a much better job of marketing the hotel than its owner (Accor) does!). If you're planning to stay, try to get a room at the front? of the hotel i.e. one with views of Times Square. Great panorama(ish) views of Times Square from the restaurant too. Reception staff OK. Very pleasant, talkative and helpful bar manager!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: dashadam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Novatel for 3 days in March-06. We got a good deal shopping around on the internet and were drawn to the hotel by a good price and a good location. The hotel itself is extremely well located on 52nd street. Times Square, Central Park etc are all very conveniently located and it was great to be so close to all these key areas. Its a major bonus to be this centrally located and really enhanced our stay (on our last stay in NY we had stayed at a hotel near macy's and found the Novatel's proximity to be a real bonus). The hotel is sufficiently far away to avoid some of the noise and lights of time square and we had no troubles sleeping at night. While we were happy with the location, our room itself was probably a little disappointing. The hotel looks like its due for a re-furbishment and while it's not run down, some of the decor and styling is looking a little dated. While everything was clean and tidy, our guess was the hotel was last redecorated in the early 90's. Our room had clearly had a smoker in it recently and smelt heavily of cigarette smoke, and on our second night we had problems with an overflowing sink. While these things weren't great (and not something you would expect from a large chain like the Novatel) the staff handled the situation well and professionally. Apart from the above we didnt have too many occassions to deal with the staff but when we did everyone was ok but not spectacular, and service was basic but courteous. Housekeeping however did a great job of cleaning our room every day. It's worth pointing out that you are required to take 2 lifts to get to your room, one lift to take you from the street to the lobby and another from the lobby to your room. It's not a big deal but the first lift is very slow and after a while this became a little irritating. If you're looking for a great hotel room then the Novatel probably isnt for you, however if you are looking for a good base to stay at while you explore New York then I'd give the Novatel a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner just recently; I found it to be a great hotel - we stayed on the 14th floor and had excellent views of Times Square; location wise it is hard to beat. The staff were friendly and helpful; the rooms a bit dated but very clean. The only drawback was the hotel didnt have any vending machines or tea/coffee making facilities. Also it was hard to control the temperature of the heating - in the winter this might be a problem. We found a fantastic diner on the corner by the hotel which was always busy but did great breakfasts; Overall a fantastic hotel right in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: workingtitle
Reviews.Content: My christmas present from my daughter was a trip to New York her. A great present and a great choice of hotel. The room was absolutely fine and with two double beds there was ample space, bathroom was clean with plenty of towels and accessories. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the service could not be faulted. The position is just perfect, so close to everywhere that we wanted to go. Lots of local deli's nearby for breakfast. I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION :-D”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through this website:-) I got a great deal for this hotel on travelocity at $225 a night...but keep in mind you are paying for location! It is 2 blocks from Times Square and easily walkable to anywhere in Mid town Manhattan! The rooms were basic and very clean. Bathrooms were nice, I requested extra towels and they were brought to the room within 10 minutes!!! Good customer service upon check in and check out. My only two things that weren't a deal breaker at all just a couple of FYI's, 1) The bellman charge $1 per bag to hold your luggage if you are checking in early or late 2) there are NO vending machines in the hotel. Any snacks or drinks must be bought through the expensive gift shop, mini bar or room service. I would suggest just bringing a six pack of your favorite bev to save some bucks:-) All in all, great place!! I have stayed many place in NYC and so far this is my favorite location!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amuir79
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, average staff, great location. When making your reservation, I'd recommend specifying you would like a view of Times Square, otherwise like us you might get stuck on the otherside of the building with city views but ones that don't compare with Times Square. The lifts were annoying. The lobby isn't at street level, and sometimes there were queues to get on the lift to the lobby and vice versa. Overall an ok hotel, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel during our first trip to New York. The location is excellent and the room was great, spacious and clean. We were on the 24th floor and the view was amazing, straight down Broadway onto Times Square! It was a quiet, comfortable and relaxing place to come back to after a very busy day. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, European Hotel with American Creature Features”
Reviews.Author: Fredaboots
Reviews.Content: From the stylish lobby to the elevator lobbies (with shoe shine machines--free of charge!) to the rooms, I really enjoyed my stay here. Quiet (you would have no idea you were just blocks from Times Sq.) and clean rooms appeared recently renovated. Nice bathrooms. Clean and well-lit halls. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in good location”
Reviews.Author: will in sf
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this big modern hotel operated by a French company. It was surprisingly quiet for its location. Good-sized rooms for Manhattan. Not fancy: no chocolates on the pillow. But comfortable, clean, convenient to three subway lines. Everyting I am looking for in a hotel. I was able to book for early March through Tavelocity for $155 per night for two people if I agreed to a no-cancel and no-change booking. Otherwise, the rate was $225 per night. Just in case I had to cancel, I purchased a trip insurance policy which covered the week's hotel stay and stack of opera, symphony and show tickets. The insurance was written to cover a $2500 maximum loss and cost $75. I saved the cost of insurance the fisrt night at the hotel with the cheaper no-cancel rate. I am told that there are more and more no-refund rates showing up. I think that I will look for them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in prime location only 2 minutes walk from Times Square. Recommend the City View rooms as they have views of Times Square with the famous advertising billboards. We had a King city view room which was very clean, spacious, modern & well decorated. Room had plenty of wardrobe space, electronic safe which was free of charge, mini bar with usual 4* expensive drink prices, hair dryer, King bed, small two seater sofa, individual climate control & cable TV. Stayed on 26th floor & could not believe how quiet the room was. Only recommendation if you like a cup of tea/coffee when you wake up in the morning take a travel kettle as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Hotel does have a coffee shop & restaurant on the same floor as the reception area as well. There is a good Cafe as you turn right outside the hotel on the corner (just on Broadway) called Art Cafe which serves a great Breakfast with unlimited coffee cost us $23 total for 2 including tip for a very hearty breakfast that kept us going until Dinner time. Applesbees restaurant just on Broadway nr hotel serves great food, good steaks & typical American food at value for money prices. Make sure you visit Little Italy in the evening the restaurants down there offer authentic Italian food at very reasonable prices, pretty area with great atmosphere at night. Shopping is quite expensive in NYC however Century 21 opposite World Trade Centre site has some great bargains on Designer labels or if you want to get the best bargains visit Woodbury Common which is an outlet village is about 1 hr outside of city. Many bus companies offer day trips to Woodbury Common which is a shoppers paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great value”
Reviews.Author: macfraser54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 4 nights and found it to be clean, spacious (which we've heard is an issue in hotels in NYC) and in a perfect location. Definitely recommend this and would stay here again. It may not be fancy or different but it's a good standard and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: EMMAROONEY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Novotel and I cant praise it enough. This was my fourth visit to New York but my first at this hotel and I regret not staying here before. Check in was swift (Desk located on 7th floor but a lift takes you there so wasnt a problem!) and the staff very welcoming. The room on arrival was a pleasant surprise for me as after reading previous comments I was a little concerned. However I found it to be clean, well equipped with a TV, Safe, and plenty of wardrobe space. It was also incredibly spacious with a little seating area by the window so you can look out over THE most amazing view - Times Square at night! The Bathroom was adequate and the maid came in every day with fresh towels and toiletries etc. Previous reviews I read commented about the noise and I can see their point. The walls are quite thin and I did have a slightly noisy neighbour, hovever I didnt lose sleep over it and I suppose it depends on the room your allocated. The hotel seemed incredibly quiet but I suppose for the time of year this was justified. Another down side was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room - us Brits cant survive without a cuppa in the morning - however a Starbucks situated right across the street put that right. One big piece of advice when staying in this hotel would be to avoid the Bar and Restaurant as the prices are extortionate and there are simply thousands of places to eat and drink, many within walking distance in Manhattan. (Roxys Diner in Times Sq is a must for a piece of New Yorks finest Cheescake). The onsight gift shop also sells the essentials but again its pricey and my advice would be to head for a Duane Reade instead. The hotel itself is ideally situated for all the 'touristy' things you will want to do in New York and is also close to a 'Big Red Sightseeing Bus Stop' which is a 48hr hop on hop off bus that travels up and down manhattan island stopping at all the major stops- I go on it every year and it is an absolute steal compared to the price of New York Cabs. You must also try the Night-time loop, which takes you over the manhattan bridge into brooklyn to view the island by night (wear warm clothes if you go in winter). The Empire State at sunset is also a must do. So in a nutshell, the Novotel Times Square gets my vote and I shall definately consider it on my next trip to NYC. The pros outweigh the cons by far.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel :Excellent Place to celebrate your 40th Birthday!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date: 16th February - 21st February 2006 We have just returned from a five day trip at the Novotel NY. The hotel was excellent and the people was very friendly. The views from the hotel room was magnificent of Times Square. The rooms was very spacious, clean and very comfortable. The restaurant looked lovely but we never ate there because it was quite expensive. There were plenty of places to eat out especially on 8th Avenue. We tried a Mexican and Italian - great prices too. The most enjoyable experience was our special friends joined us a few days later and we all walked miles to see places. Excellent overall and will definately go again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 1mat
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. great location. first rate food. service friendly. much better than i expected in new york!

Reviews.Title: “good location, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Leah26
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a great location, practically on times square and within easy walking distance to the rockefeller centre and shopping areas. I was there on a hen weekend from 15th feb-18th feb. There were four of us in a quad room and it was spacious enough for us to lay out all four suitcases and still walk around. The bathroom was roomy which was good considering four girls were sharing it. The staff were friendly and polite and check in and out were easy with no queing. The reasons I give this only a three is because as the previuos review states the rooms do get very hot if you keep the window closed. I sleep through anything so traffic noise does not bother me but on the first night we closed the window and it was really really hot. My friend had her bag stolen from the hotel bar on our first evening (we were there from 10.30pm-12am)and her cards were used straight away. Fortunately she didn't have her passport in the bag. The security and other staff were very sympathetic and gave us the information about where to report it. Unfortunately it was the only table that did not have cctv on it! Overall it was a good hotel, good value and exellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but way too warm!”
Reviews.Author: liljolly
Reviews.Content: I was here on a work trip for three nights Feb.14-17th 2006. The staff was friendly, and I was lucky that there was no line when I checked in. The room was nice - I really enjoyed the sitting area, and everything was quite comfortable. I was impressed with how little I could hear from the other guests, as I am a light sleeper. But I hardly got any sleep anyway because the room was so hot! No matter what I did to the thermostat, the room stayed 85 degrees. I called the front desk twice and both times they said there was nothing they could do but they would "notify the engineers". I thought maybe I was being overly sensitive...until I spoke with my colleagues staying there who had the same problems. One of them actually woke up and the room was 97 degrees! The no sleep thing made a perfectly good stay completely miserable. They could at least provide fans... Otherwise, the hotel (as others have mentioned) is in a primo location, and the service was good. I enjoyed the continental breakfast from room service (though pricey), and recommend it. It is a bummer that there is no coffeemaker in the room, but it's a good ploy to get you to order the room service breakfast for caffeine addicts like me! The lobby bar is nice as well. Perhaps the heating issue was really a temporary issue and not a permanent thing, but make sure before you go if you like your room cool.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Mahon
Reviews.Content: Have just returned (11-16 feb)with my 16 year old daughter. Cannot fault this hotel. Spotlessly clean room and friendly staff especially the doormen. Had room 1601 with a side view of Times Sq which was low enough to see everything that was going on! Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant far too many others close by. Really enjoyed Ellens Stardust diner opposite the hotel if you like singing waiters/waitresses! Convenient for the bus tours, theatres, central park, Times Sq in fact everything! One tiny piece of advice - take a travel kettle if you like to have coffee/tea in bed as there are no facilites in the room. To make our stay complete we were in the largest snow fall for 300 years! See you next year Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there in May and would stay there again! The lobby is actually about 7 floors up and there is a fantastic terrace that gives you a memorable view of times square - a great place to drink Manhattans at night! Staff were great and very helpful and the rooms comfy and with great views. Everything is on your doorstep; diners, restaurants, top theatres, broadway and times square 2 mins walk. You really feel you are in the heart of the city and can get easy access (subway,red tour buses, taxis etc) from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel!”
Reviews.Author: sprinkles21
Reviews.Content: I loved the Novotel. I had room 2116 which had an amazing view of Times Square. Yes the decor is a little dated, however, New York is a big city and at the end of a day of walking around -who cares??? If you are going to sit around in your hotel all day it would probably matter! The bed was comfortable and the room was always spotlessly clean. The shower's water pressure was good. My only complaint would be that the mini fridge only held minibar goods. It was a five minute walk to the heart of Times Square.The hotel is also surrounded by restaurants. I would recommend Cosmic Diner on 8th and 52nd - clean, cheap and good food. The Novotel is great if you are into the Theatre...Hairspray is virtually next door, Wicked and Spelling Bee on 51st (2 min walk). I would stay at the Novotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “RIght in the Heart of it!”
Reviews.Author: DUKEUK1
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here twice last year. The first time I was allocated a Times Square view room which was stunning. Once I knew I would be there again I requested the same room & the staff were very helpful in sorting this out. The location of the hotel is its biggest attraction. It's just north of times square and in walking distance of The Park & the shops of 5th Avenue. The rooms are nice, clean but perhaps could do with a slight touch up here & there. And they are quite dark, but I think this is unavoidable in New York. I would definately recommend this hotel - particularly to first time visitors to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: caladesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of January. Room was on the 27th floor with a great view of Times Square. Very clean and spacious room. Really helpful check in staff. Can't find the slightest bad point about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hats Off to Novotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Novotel Hotel was a great place to stay. My daughter and I were there on a trip with a dance company and we never experienced any problems with the Hotel at all. The room was clean and quiet. We were on the 12th floor and could see Times Square. It was quite a view. We could stand in the window and look down on all the happenings going on on the streets. It was within walking distance to a lot of attractions. WOW what an experince!! We are from a small town in Texas and this was really great. They even delivered our luggage to our rooms and loaded it for us when we left. Keep up the great work Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “You Don't need a TV”
Reviews.Author: BlackJetta
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed at this Hotel for a Xmas break 27th Dec - 30th Dec 05,and take it from me you would struggle to find a better location than this, and the view we had from our room (1903)well we just left the TV switched off and watched the view of Times square and it's light show "stunning". OK the room itself wasn't the best in NYC, but it was clean. If I did have to have a moan, it would be about the hotel not providing the rooms with tea & coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “No better location!”
Reviews.Author: stevemidsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in the middle of January. Unusually the lobby is on the 7th floor and we stayed on the 21st floor. The room was nice and clean and although not huge was perfectly adequate for our stay. We could clearly see times Square from our bedroom window and were in close walking distance of Central Park. I can't see how we could have been in a much better place. There are three diners within throwing distance of the hotel for breakfast including Ellens Stardust Diner complete with singing waiter and waitresses!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Juicylady
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from our three night stay at this hotel and i can reccommend it thoroughly - everything is just great - we had a view of times square from our 29th floor room and all the staff were so helpful and friendly stay here to be in the heart of it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that could have made a big difference”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: If this was only a review of the actual hotel room, I would give it a perfect score - our room was wonderful. It was clean and comfortable. The beds were also clean and there were plenty of blankets/pillows. There was an in-room safe, hair dryer, soaps, shampoos and lotions all available in the room at no charge. The walls were thick enough that we never heard our neighbors, the windows kept out all the noise of times square. THe bathroom fan kept the steam down after hot showers (and there was plenty of hot water). The area was convenient to all subway lines and it was easy to walk to area attractions. It was very easy to catch cabs. There were a very good choice of bars and restaurants within a shoret walking distance. Why not a perfect score then? Checkout, CHeckin, Elevators & Hotel Entrance, and Luggage Storage! Checkin & CHeckout - a nightmare. They didn't lose our reservation or anything like that - it's literally the process they have that makes it horrible. THey have 4 stations in the lobby but no line to queue in. This means that everyone has to look over each of the 4 stations, pick the line they think is the smallest, or will move the fastest and line up behind each one. It was a fiasco. They should have a line to queue in and call the next person in order. At one point during my stay I came down to the lobby to go out and saw about 7 parties just standing around giving each other dirty looks as if they were all trying to butt in front of each other. Checkout was the same - they got all our information correct but it was a bad way to end a good trip. Elevators & Hotel Entrance: The entrance to this hotel is on 52nd, not Broadway. WHen you walk through the revolving door, the luggage check is in front of you and the elevators up to the actual hotel are to the right. THe problem is that the space is so small that if a couple parties arrive at the same time, you can't get in or out. The whole area fills up with people and luggage. And, there's only two elevators for the entire hotel. The hotel is actually on the upper floors of the building. You can't walk into the hotel from the street level - you are always stuck taking one of these two elevators up to the lobby, where you have to get out and get into some other elevators that then take you up to the floor rooms. This was really inconvenient. THere were no stairs - we asked and were told that all the stairwells were alarmed and that we couldn't use them. One other thing about the elevators - although there were only two to get everyone in and out of the hotel, there were 4 that run from the lobby to the floors where the guest rooms were. They were smart enough to realize that they needed 4 elevators to get people to and from their rooms, but didn't realize that 2 wasn't enough to get these same people out of the hotel. Luggage Storage - the men working did a great job but this little area of the entrace was always crowded and many times there was luggage just sitting around waiting to be taken to the back storage area. It's not that it sat there all day - they just had so many people coming and going and dropping off luggage and picking it up that they couldn't keep up. Overall it was okay, and for the right price, I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: L8H
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from New York where we celebrated the arrival of 2006! We stayed at the Novotel and although this wasnt the best hotel I have stayed at it certainly wasnt the worst. We booked this break quite late (end of Sept) and after getting a great deal on flights was shocked to say the least to find out the kind of prices hotels were charging for this busy time of year for New York. Novotel was recommended due to its location and view of the ball drop in Times Sq. As it happened it was one of the cheapest at $409 per night and after reading some reviews I think I may have had a good deal (next years prices are $699!!! Firstly this hotel is not worth $409 a night. However thats not to say it is a very good hotel with a fantastic location. It is located in Times Square and in the heart of Broadway with all the theatres. 5th Ave, Rockafellar, Radio City are all within easy walking distance too. The street entrance is a little offputting as it is basically a lift lobby. The reception is on the 7th floor and is very welcoming. All staff we came into contact with were friendly and helped us with whatever we needed. If I had to describe service it would be no frills. The check in was quick and we were allocated a room on 33rd floor with Times Sq view. Fixtures and fittings were not new or modern but were well kept. The rooms were a very nice size and were very clean. We didnt use bar, restaurant or concierge so cant comment. We did use the minibar once where a 75ml Evian water was $6, so a little pricey. It really is the location which gets this hotel my 4/5 rating and especially for a New Year holiday where you can experience the Times Sq atmosphere without having to queue for 10 hours. An unrelated point, we went to see Dirty Rotten Scoundrels at the Imperial Theatre with John Lithgow and I must say this was a fantasically funny and enjoyable show and would recommend it. Dont eat at TGI's as is very expensive and food quality poor. Dont expect to get a smile a please or a thank you at any Duane Reade you go to but they are really cheap and handy for everything from confectionary to camera films, cosmetics to tolietries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: wendyjc
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a Christmas and New Year break in USA starting with 4 days in New York. We stayed at the Novotel and found it perfect for our needs. Rooms were clean and spacious and the hotel is in the heart of the theatre district. We could walk to Empire State Building, Central Park, the shops on 5th Ave, the Grand Central Station and the Library. This was good as we were in NY during the public transport strike. The trip to Statue of Liberty proved a little more problematic in the circumstances but we got there in the end. I can recommend pre booking SofL and ESB tickets. The only criticism I have of the hotel is that it has no tea and coffee making facilities but as there is a 24 hour deli over the road it is easy to get a coffee or tea and a snack to bring back to the hotel. The restaurant is expensive but then all NY hotels are but there are places to eat relatively cheaply near by.

Reviews.Title: “For big spenders a choice you won't regret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to stay in this hotel for 2 days (I stayed 5 days in NY, the other days I slept in the Pickwick Arms hotel). Just a block away from Time Square you'll find yourself in a nice lobby after taking the elevator. The rooms are big enough and the shower is great. The view is great (you'll see Broadway if you're lucky). Totally no complaints, except the price. If you're not a paid business trip as I was, you're hurting your wallet (around $400 a night). 4/5

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim79my
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel! Perfect location situated seconds away from times square!! We were lucky enough to be on the 32nd floor (of 33)! The room was large in comparison to the usual notoriously small New York hotel rooms. Room service was quick and efficent, although full breakfast pricey. Opt for the lighter option and you'll receive a basket full of morning cakes for a more affordable price!! The hotel bar has impressive views of the city, although service was a little slow!! Be sure to inform the hotel of any special occasion before hand, I was lucky enough to receive a complimentary bottle of champagne and a birthday card! Will definately be visiting New York again and would definately go back to the Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Novetel:Great location to veiw the Parade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the city to see the parade. We enjoy staying in different hotels every time we visit Manhattan.We selected this hotel because of the location.It was directly on the parade route and right in the theater district.I booked it 1 week before the parade and couldn't believe the had availability. For the price we were pleasantly suprised.We walked 2 blocked and purchased 8 tickets to see Chitty Chitty Bang Bang for 50.00 dollars a ticket and had great seats 2 hours before the play. (WE ARE USED TO PAYING FULL PRICE)Where else but in NYC can you do this.The rooms are average in size and very clean. The observation deck was key for viewing the parade with children. Don't worry about the hotel having 1 restaurant.Have breakfast next to the hotel for half the price and for dinner there are pleanty of restaurants within walking distance.I am planning on staying there again in December when I take my children to see Wicked the hotel is 1 block from the play.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is a solid deal”
Reviews.Author: beerme1
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and had a great time. The Novotel was a terrific deal given it's location. It is a solid three star hotel that borders on four. Some things that detract from it, our heat/ac unit didn't function properly which didn't matter because it was a beautiful 70 degrees everyday but one and we never mentioned this problem to the staff because I wasn't about to give up our room and it's fantastic view! No high speed wireless connection, although I was told they will have it by spring next year. I made due piggybacking on connections that were extremely intermittent from the office tower we were facing :-) It is inconvenient to take the elevator from the ground to the seventh floor for check in. There are only two elevators for this and we were going to stop in at our room at one point and decided against it because there was a bus that was emptying it's passengers for check in and caused a major back up. My last gripe is simply that the rooms are dated and the king size bed was nothing to write home about. The Art Cafe that everyone refers to was not that impressive to me though, but that is not part of the hotel, they served me breakfast on a chipped plate which didn't impress me despite the reasonably priced breakfasts there :-) but this place is not operated by the hotel. All that aside, the good things at this hotel FAR outweigh the negative! The staff was tremendous! The view was magnificent and the desert in Cafe Nicole was superb. Our windows opened which is nice and they are soundproof windows that really work. It truly is amazing to see so much action going on down on the street and not hear it when you close your windows. Cafe Nicole, the bar and lobby area are generally calm and not all that busy, but the night we left there was a mob scene on the seventh floor in the lobby, the bar and Cafe Nicole due to the influx of people for the marathon. Really was a crazy sight when we left. We took our limo service away to the airport and left it all in the rearview mirror. Very cool, very New York. Location, location, location is ideal. We checked in at 2:30 and asked for a room high up overlooking Times Square. We were given a room on the 15th floor that had an awesome view of Times Square. The price is more than reasonable given it's location. Letterman is just up the street and we were lucky enough to see them outside of Ruperts Hello Deli filming some taxi, smashing stuff on the road which was very cool. This surprised me because Letterman was not taping that week. Overall this hotel is very pleasing to come back to after your long days of sightseeing. Here's a chaep and terrific dinner tip, I think the name was Chez Rendezvous. It was on 8th somewhere around 48th I will try to find the receipt to make sure the name and address are correct. I figured we should try to do dinner cheap at least one night of our stay and decided on pizza. This place was fantastic!!!! Here we received our cheapest drinks of the trip, and as my girlfriend mentioned also the largest serving of wine anywhere during this visit. The pizza was fantastic, the server was good. We had a small pizza that was perfect for two people, two tall drafts and a glass of wine. This was the deal of the year for me, $30 included a $5 plus tip!! Hell, I would have a hard time getting that price for that quality at home. This was such a find!! This is after being robbed at the chains near Times Square that were charging $13 for a tall draft. My brother lives in NY and told me to stay away from the Fridays and such around Times Square and look around restaurant row and on 8th and we would find some good food where the locals go. He took us to Joe Allens which had excellent food and a terrific ambience and was also reasonable. (Sorry locals, I probably wasn't supposed to give up this local hangout!) Anyway the Novotel was not my first choice, nor will it be next time, but it does make a perfect Plan B if my others are booked. I would highly recommend the Novotel NY. I need to make this clear, I would have no problem staying here again and this might just become plan A given it's price and location and staff. I have tried to include 10 great photos but the size is too big. If someone can tell me how to change them I will try to post them again.

Reviews.Title: “C' est terrfica.”
Reviews.Author: corvinus
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel with a great location. Rooms are quiet with stunning views of the city. I walked to Lincoln Center, Bloomingdales, UN, Grand Central, Met. Museum. and Natural History Museum during my stay. The subway is close to hand for longer trips. I looked down on Times Square,Broadway, and the theater district from my room. My room-safe went wrong( might have been my fault) but the management compensated me with a good breakfast in the very pleasant breakfast-room. I didn't eat-in generally though and I took my meals in the Art Cafe which is right next door. Here service is quick, quality quite good, portions enormous, and prices about half those in the hotel.No frills in the Novotel and I wouldn't describe it as over-friendly but it has everything you need for your stay in the 'Big Apple' French owned-that's the reason for the terrible title.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION IS EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel in Aug. 05. The location was GREAT!! Hotel was nice and clean. Above average size for the room. Staff was very nice and helpful. Super views of Broadway and Times Square. This hotel has a open balcony outside the restaurant, which you need to visit. The night lights are beautiful. The restaurant in the hotel is overpriced. There are plenty of deli's close by. I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: RubyCurry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel New York from 22nd-27th October with my husband and two boys aged 7 and 9. The location of the Novotel is superb, in the middle of theatreland with a view of Times Square. I saw Spamalot and the Shubert Theatre was a 10 minute walk from the Novotel. We were on the 14th floor and had a fantastic view from our window. We had no trouble with noise at all and the room was spacious and clean. Could do with a lick of paint but cleanliness was fine. The staff were very helpful and we enjoyed two very nice lunches in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant was well priced for a quiet lunch away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but still with a great view. The children ate free when we we ordered which made it great value. For breakfast we used the Art Cafe which is right next door, excellent value and used by locals. Tip! Cabs were cheaper than we expected and easy to find wherever you are, we didn't bother with the subway once as the cabs were such good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Jools99
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the the Novotel for a week from the 24th October. We found the location fantastic, right in the centre of all the attractions. Our room was on the 22nd floor and a good size for a family of four, with fantastic views of Time Square. There where no problems with noise at all. We found the hotel Clean and the staff helpful at all times. We would go back to the Novotel on any return visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gumby75
Reviews.Content: I had a fine experience at this hotel. The location is excellent. Within walking distance to most everything in Times Sq. The hotel itself was clean and had all the basic amenities. The rooms were quiet with minimal noise from outside. No coffee maker in the room. Bit expensive for a basic hotel, but that's NYC for you. I would stay here again without issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pilx
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel with my son . Great room , clean , good size. excellent location, friendly staff.No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a first class location especially for events in Lincoln Centre for the Performing Arts-only five to ten minutes on foot. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and restaurant is very good for after theatre bar snack. Views of Times Square are breathtaking especially at night. Room was good in every respect and bathroom always clean.Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel, Broadway a winner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Novotel on Broadway. Prime location for easy access to just about anywhere! Our room was extremely clean and comfortable. Lovely spotless bathroom. We were also surprised at how quiet it was at night. We overlooked Times Square but were not disturbed by the noise at all....and it is noisy and busy and wonderful!! We would return to this hotel with no hesitation. We had a fabulous holiday.

Reviews.Title: “good value , great location !”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Juli
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Novotel. The hotel was good value with the rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is excellent as its central for access to all parts of Manhattan. I would recommend it if you want good accomodation , in a great location and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “FANTATSTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetsjas
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our first trip to NYC. It is in a great location and was central to most of the things I had planned......ie Helicopter ride, Dinner at 'The View', Phantom of the Opera....etc. The hotel is on W52nd St. and with Hertz car hire on W55th Street the drive out to Woodbury Common was very straight forward. Service was excellent and staff were extremely helpful. View from the 33rd floor was amazing and looked directly into Times Square.....it's closer than you think! Surprisingly there was no noise at all, despite being right in the heart of NYC. I have no doubt that I will find myself in this hotel again, in the not too distant future......I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to tour NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a week in NYC and had a great location to see many of the tourist sites in NYC. The Novatel is two blocks from the CBS studio where the Letterman Late Show is taped. Hello Deli is just around the corner and Rupert was a blast. Two block walk in the other direction is the famous Stage Deli, where you can get the largest deli sandwich you have ever seen, and see photos of many celebrities that have been there. Times square is in walking distance, as well as all the Broadway theatres. We even ventured out on the subway and took in a game at Yankee stadium. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly and attentive. You can be in the hustle bustle of the NYC crowded streets and in a moments time, go through the revolving door into the nice quiet surroundings of the Novatel. There is a quiet lounge in the lobby to relax. I recommend the Novatel to any tourist going to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very poorly cleaned. There were many black marks all over the walls and drawers as well as black stains on the pillows and sheets. Also, the showerhead and faucet head are caked with rust. However the location was great, right in the middle of Manhattan (within walking distance to Times Square). The rooms were small, the bathtub/shower a bit outdated, and the furnishings of the room were old and battered. It was more like a motel or inn than a three-star hotel. I would definitely not stay here again. A better hotel choice would be the SHeraton which is less than a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: johnsayers
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for New York, where even some of the Chain Hotels are horrible. We needed to get my parents, theyre almost 80 a change of rooms, the staff were fine, no hassle and actually relocated them in the room next to us without being asked. We were on the 32nd Floor overlooking Broadway & Times Sq. As you come out of the Hotel you turn right for Broadway & Time Sq, try turning left for stores & restraunts that are not touristy and dont have horrible tourist menus, the Pigalle restraunt does lovley breakfasts and is very good value, the Azucar Cuban restraunt is great, it looks a bit exotic from outside but pluck up the courage and go in, the staff are very friendly New Yorkers and the food and salsa music teriffic, were fairly reserved Brits and it was great. both are on the next street along W 52nd, I think its 7th Ave turn left for Pigalle about three blocks, right for Azucar about three blocks both on the Avenue, checkout the 24 hour supermarket nevr seen such choice, lots of cop cars parked up the Midtown Precinct & Courthouse is here so felt very safe but then never felt threatened anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: DolphinEssex
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the USA after a special couple of weeks (probably the last family holiday with the kids), we had always wanted to go via New York, we managed to get a good deal staying at the Novotel, Times Square for 5 days before flying down to Orlando. I must say after reading a few reviews when we booked last October I felt we had to keep an open mind, but we were pleasantly surprised, the concierge were really helpful, we took the elevator up to the reception area, who again were welcoming and helpful, we had paid the extra for 2 rooms with a Times Square view, WOW!! it was certainly worth it, it was FANTASTIC, the rooms were clean, tidy and we felt quite spacious, the bathrooms a little tired but everything there you needed. We didn't eat at the hotel, there was a nice little diner called Applejacks just up the road which was excellent for breakfast. The hotel menu looked quite good although not cheap. There are alot of French speaking pilots and cabin crew that stay there on their way through, but we have had many a great holiday in France when the kids were younger and it was great to hear. We would love to go back to New York and I wouldn't hesitate in booking Novotel again. Thanks for a Great Time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used Tripadvisor to chose this hotel and it turned out to be an excellent choice. On booking we asked for a quiet room on a high floor with a Times Square view. We arrived at the Novotel around 12.30pm and we were given room 1604. The room was nice and big (Travel Inn style) and the view was fantastic - Times Square was right in front of us! We walked everywhere from the hotel, it was so centrally located. We stayed in New York for 6 nights and this hotel really made our stay so much better. We couldn't have asked for a better location or a better room. We would definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to leave --”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The stay was unbearable because groups of teenagers were consistently checking in. Hotel must have really good deals for tour groups. As a result, we couldn't sleep because of the constant noise from the room overhead and from outside. Hotel staff in the reception area and the bellmen were very nice, but could not do anything about the situation. Service at the restaurant was extremely slow. Good location but having a good night sleep is more important.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 women seeing NYC and we stayed at the Novotel. Perfect place to stay because it's so close to the Theatre District (across the street from some), Broadway, Time Square and Central Park. On same block as David Letterman show too. We ate several meals at a corner restr. called Art's Rest. ... great price and good food. AVOID Roxy's....$25.00 sandwich and not good! Hotel starts on the 7th floor.... never heard others in the other rooms. Rooms were okay size for NYC and the price wasn't bad. I would stay there again b/c of the location... location... location! By the way friendly staff..... at times I felt like we were the only ones in NYC that spoke English though. A lot of people from other countries.

Reviews.Title: “Only drawback is no high-speed internet access”
Reviews.Author: HiddenHelper
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel from June 24th to the 28th. I was in NYC on business and the company I was working for booked the hotel. The first room I had was very nice. It had a king bed, a loveseat that converted to a bed, a nice TV, sitting area, etc., and the bathroom was plenty spacious and had hardwood floors, which was a nice touch. My room was very clean. Drawbacks: no high-speed internet access. The travel agent my company used had checked and the hotel records indicated they had it in some rooms (and presumably in the "business center") but when I asked the front desk, they don't have it anymore, which meant I had to carry my laptop back and forth from Starbucks, but that wasn't the end of the world, just a minor inconvenience. Also, I didn't see anywhere you could get a bottle or can of soda (except the high-priced minibar in your room), so soda machines would have been nice. The restaurant prices were also quite high, so I only ate there one night for dinner, which was good but not great. The location is great and it's easy to walk to just about anywhere you need to go. Try Stage Deli or Ruby Foos for some good meals, and there's an inexpensive diner around the corner from the hotel. I think it was the Art Cafe Diner. This would have been a great hotel if I was on vacation, but the lack of hi speed internet access would prevent me from staying there again if on business. I had to extend my stay by a day and switch rooms and my 2nd room was a bit smaller and the bathtub had some mildew in the caulking, as someone else had mentioned in a previous review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on the corner of 52nd Street West and Broadway. When booking you should be given the option to pay slightly more for a view of Times Square. This is worth while. We were on the 14th floor and the view was amazing! We stayed for 3 nights at the end of a 2 week holiday in the USA and what a great way to finish it. We walked everywhere, you are 5 minutes from Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue and 10 minutes from the Empire State Building. We stayed here with our 2 year old a cot was provided with bedding and there is a small childrens play area (lego and TV etc). Children can also eat free in the Restaurant with any 2 paying adults. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was big enough but not huge. Clean and modern (Travel Inn standards). They do have a mini bar and TV etc. Would recomend for Families, Couples and Groups

Reviews.Title: “typical 3-star”
Reviews.Author: imd8465
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) stayed at Novotel for one night in May and overall it was a good stay. Hotel meets its 3-star classification however it is very far from being a 4-star property. We previously stayed in Novotel Warsaw and were very impressed, not so with Novotel NY. Overall hotel gives you that "tired" feeling mainly coming from rooms and staff. Rooms require renovation and staff lacks enthusiasm. Some tips/facts: - Of course, location is the best. - It takes two elevator rides to get to the room. One to the lobby level, then to the rooms. - Main entrance is on 52nd St close to Broadway however 52nd Street is one way so youâ€™ll be arriving at Novotel (if arriving by car) coming from west (nearest intersection is 52nd and 8th Ave). - Checkout is at noon and you can leave bags for $1 per bag. - Lobby has small kids play room, a nice touch. - Restaurant is expensive but offers excellent views. - Many floors are smoking limiting selection for non-smokers and it appears rooms are assigned dynamically so I expect issues with late check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean efficient hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: badgercat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Novotel in New York. We had a great time the hotel was brill, we had a room on the 33rd (Top) floor with amazing views. The Superior King room was clean and the bed huge and comfortable, there was always plenty of hot water, even the hairdryer worked well!!! We didn't use the mini bar as I new it would be expensive. The reception staff were efficient and the staff on the information desk were helpful all of them seemed quite friendly. We ate breakfast in the diner at the corner of 52nd and broadway the food was good loads of it and quite cheap, the pancakes are huge!!! We did use the bar in the hotel a few times after exhausting days sightseeing it was too tempting, the drinks were expensive, we also ate in the restaurant one night as I wanted to look at the view of Time square, ( it has huge glass windows) anyhow that seemed overpriced, but the view is good. I would have given the hotel excellent rating had it not been for these prices, and the fact there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. However you don't have to eat and drink at the hotel as it is surrounded by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolBGlasgow_UK
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel because of it's central location and then read some of the reviews on this website and got scared!! But I needn't have been, this is a great place to stay. We had a excellent King City View Room - which gave a marvelous view of the Hudson River and the lovely sunsets. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. There was a small couch for relaxing after a hard day's sightseeing and a lovely big, comfortable bed. This is probably the nicest place I've stayed in NY. The location of this hotel is excellent as well - it is close to Times Square, Central Park, all the Broadway theaters, restaurants, the subway, etc. I cannot find any fault with this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tedkop
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, safe hotel with rooms overlooking Broadway and Times Square and in the Theather District. Just a few blocks south to Times Square and a few north to Central Park. Their restauraut is presently offering a great 3 course dinner special for under $20. For Breakfast use the resturant at the corner for quick good food at half the price. Plenty of resturrants in the area The deli sandwiches and cheescake at the Roxy and Stage Deli where fantastic. If you need high speed internet request the 9th or 10th floor. The lobby is on the 7th floor so the elevators two to the street and four to the rooms can become conjested. There was virtually no street noise on the 30th floor as long as the windows where closed. The staff is courteous and helpful. We will definatly stay there on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Novotel in mid-April 2005; after this, I wouldn't even think about staying anywhere else in New York. Excellent overall value, very nice rooms, friendly service, perfect location . . . the ideal place for a New York vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Went in cautiously optimistic.............came away thrilled!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As I was preparing for our first NYC trip, I researched lots of hotels to find the best we could, in the price range we could afford. After reading the many, many reviews on many, many hotels, I was more confused than ever, but ultimately, the Novotel seemed to be the best of the lot for the money. My daughter and I couldn't have been more thrilled with the entire experience! Our room was very nice and clean, bathroom spacious & clean, by what I gather to be NYC standards, and you couldn't beat the view of Times Square and the central location. Only downside, as others have mentioned, is the lack of coffeemaker in the room. That was very minor, though. When I requested extra bath towels, they were there for us the entire time. Based on the reviews I'd read, I was prepared for snooty & rude concierge and desk clerks............wrong again! They were all very helpful and very nice. I actually loved the fact that at times I felt like I was the one in a foreign country, with the number of french people in the lobby most of the time. It was actually a wonderful experience, and I for one, wouldn't even bother looking for another hotel when I return to NYC.......I'll go straight for the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel - great location for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (three adults and four children) just returned from a three night stay at the Novotel New York City hotel. The location was excellent - several blocks north of Times Square and several blocks south of Central Park. Subway stops nearby, many good restaurants within a block or two - this location in NYC can't be beat. Our rooms were clean and well maintained. Novotel was able to block out two adjacent rooms for us and the Novotel employees were very accommodating, friendly, and efficient. We will definitely come back to the Novototel New York for our next visit to NYC. Good price, great location, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice + clean w/ great view of Times Sq”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Marl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 33rd (top) floor overlooking Times Square. Great location and the restaurant on the street level under the building was GREAT. It was worth the 10 minute wait for the breakfast. The staff at the hotel was friendly and courteous and let us check out late (1:00 vs. noon) without problem. Room was clean and very nice bathroom. Rate was $145 for 1 night- bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Can't knock the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: nickwhite26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what the doctor ordered. It is situated overlooking Time Square. This doesn't mean it is going to be noisey, it just means you are perfectly situated for all your excursions. The rooms are clean and the staff are helpful. It has many deli bars close by for breakfast and its close to a subway station. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in NY city, then look no more! You've found your place. THE PICTURES: The first is a picture from my room. And the second is showing where the Novotel is situated in relation to Time Square (you can see the light brown building in the background sticking out)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrific Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Hotel was an excellent choice for our trip to New York City on March 28th thru the 31st. The location is outstanding and the view of Time Square from our room was outstanding. The room was adequate in size for a family of four and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The hotel is located in the middle of the Broadway Theatre District....quite convenient. We had tickets to The Letterman Show and that was literally a half a block from the hotel. We will definitely return to The Novotel on our next trip to New York City. Great hotel and great price!

Reviews.Title: “Easter 2005”
Reviews.Author: Lesley999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with daughter 13, son 10 and hubbie. Very comfortable room, excellent location- walkable to many places, near subway, Times Square and theatres and restaurants. Wonderful views from room and restaurant. We did eat breakfast here as the kids ate for free, we ate plenty and then didnt need to eat again till evening. This worked out well for us, but if we had to pay for the kids then we too would have eaten elsewhere. Found all hotel staff helpful and friendly. Only minor thing that we would change was lack of tea/coffee making facilities in room- however the hotel was surrounded by delis, starbucks etc. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect Midtown Location”
Reviews.Author: jlee69
Reviews.Content: My previous experience of other New York Hotels suggests you should not expect too much, especially if youâ€™re not prepared to pay big money. The Novotel NYC went against this trend. I felt that at around Â£80/90 per night (prices vary) this hotel provided great value (for New York). The Staff were actually very helpful and pleasant, the rooms were clean and larger than expected (though remember this isnâ€™t Florida) and the view of Broadway / Times Square is priceless! I enjoyed the bar at the end of the evening and there is a great little deli across the road if you fancy lunch on the go. This hotel (if your interested in this kind of thing) is practically next door to the Ed Sullivan Theatre which is the home of â€œThe Late Show with David Lettermanâ€� and of course you are right in the middle of the theatre district and walking distance from times square, central park, Saks, Bloomies etc etc. There is a subway nearby and you can get cabs at the door. For the money, I think itâ€™s great, I will stay here againâ€¦. In fact I am doingâ€¦ in about 2 weeks. Canâ€™t wait. Iâ€™ll let you know if itâ€™s changed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel!”
Reviews.Author: scgirl3172
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel last year. The location was fantastic. We had an incredible view of Times Square, but without all of the noise. Our room was quiet, clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable. Nothing terribly fancy, but that didn't matter as I didn't go to New York to hang out in my hotel room. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, based on New York standards. The exception - the concierge! He clearly was not interested in his job. The bellmen are far more helpful and can line up any transportation that you need. You can leave your bags with them after you have checked out. I've read a few complaints about it costing $1 a bag, but to me that was minor to not have to worry about my luggage until I headed to the airport that evening. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its location, and it couldn't be in a better place to see New York! Close to Central Park, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping...what more does anyone want! Stayed on the 28th Floor where views were amazing. Room was lovely, room service was fast & food very nice. Some of the staff were a bit unhelpful, but this did not impact our holiday in the slightest! Had a fab time, and when I go back to New York, I'll definitely be staying at the Novotel again. For the price (Â£87 a night between 2) its a complete bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: yizaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there for our 4th anniv. We loved it! Across the board, I find NY service to not be what I would expect further south, so I was not shocked by it (which I would grade as a B minus). Great location, good service, great room (clean, not many amenities-but good). We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kateharcus
Reviews.Content: i stayed here on 23rd oct for 5 nights in 2003. 4 sharing a room and the rooms where very spacious. Staff where brilliant, especially heather behind the bar who gave us loads of advise on where to go and when to go there. Rooms where very clean as where the bathrooms. The cafe area on the reception floor led out to a balcony area which overlooked times square...got some excellent photographs from this spot. All in all i would recommend this hotel to anyone from families to couples to singles, for great location 4 star property at a price that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Broadway with views of Times Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2/2/05 - 7/2/05. This was a nice clean hotel with helpful friendly staff. We had a view over Broadway and the hotel is a very short walk to Times Square, Central Park (go there on a Sunday- its a must) and the Hard Rock Cafe. Hotel is situated right in the Theatre district so catching a show is a must. Didn't eat in the Hotel for breakfast as just next door was a cafe serving breakfast's at a quarter of the price. This is a great hotel. I would recommend it anytime. They have a separate help desk to organise your trips, maps, subway use and to organise your return trip to the Airport. This is an ideally situated budget hotel for you to see all of Manhattan and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amazing location right on Broadway and a few minutes walk from Times Square - which we could see from our window. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially the doorman who helped us with our luggage. The room was basic but clean and tidy. We would compare it with a travelodge. However for what we paid, it was great value. Would recommend going out and exploring the local diners for food as the hotel food seemed rather over priced in comparison. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A double booking hotel - truly dreadful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a 24 hour journey for our first time in New York - 13:30 in the morning to witness an arguement between lobby staff and a group of American tourists who were told at 3pm their rooms weren't yet ready but when they returned after an evening out were told they had been double booked. The same happened to us - we had to wander to the Flathotel to in -13c temperatures where they had booked us in for the night to find they had room for 4 although our party was 5. Some of us then had to wander back to ask them to fund another room as Novotel did not answer their phone. We spent the night in a hotel we had not booked and had to wait to check in on the first morning of our short city break. The hotel and also the hotel manager promised that they would refund the first night of our trip but never did. When questioned the person at the desk advised that they did this as people cancelled and this happened regularly. It was a shame that they did not respond to my e-mail asking them to confirm that everything was ok the week previously - so they should have known that there was no need double book us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BaxterFamily
Reviews.Content: ....we came to stay at the Novotel on Jan. 5th-8th after we had been to Seattle visiting friends for N.Year's. We have stayed in NY b4 but down 42nd St. so we wanted to stay nearer to Times Sq. We were on the 27th floor and had a great view of it! The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and beds were made each day, and we were only there for 3 days. Very impressed and hopefully we will stay there again. Loads of places to eat nearby, no need to go to their restaurant. We like to eat and drink with the New Yorkers!! Theatres were across the street and on the same block, very impressive! One good thing for me was that the soundproofing of the windows is excellent, you don't hear a thing. If you do open them, you can really tell the difference! All in all, a great stay and I highly recommend it. It wasn't very expensive for a family room which includes 2 doubles. Our kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Laren
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Novotel New York, and was a bit disappointed with it. It wasn't terrible, just not up to the standard I expected. The location is good, close to Times Square and the 7th Avenue subway stop on the E train. Everything in the room just looked rather cheap quality and the worse for wear, so it wasn't that appealing to return to each day. The bedroom seemed clean; I wouldn't say the bathroom was unclean, it just also looked a bit worn and not quite "sparkling" clean. I guess hotels in NYC are more expensive than elsewhere, but I'm glad this was a business trip as I would not have been happy with paying the rates at the Novotel out of my own pocket! I subsequently stayed one night at the Renaissance, also in the Times Square area, which was not substantially more expensive and was much nicer. I'd stay at the Novotel again if I had to, but personally I'd rather pay a little more and stay somewhere that I'd enjoy staying at more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Patty39
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here over Thanksgiving. Despite a very hectic time of year, everyone was exceptionally nice. Our room was perfect - clean, quiet and actually spacious by NY standards. I especially liked the intimate feel of the hotel where the staff got to know us and often greeted us by name.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: scoombes
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel twice and would definately stay again. both times that i stayed here i stayed on a high floor overlooking times square, this view makes up for the rooms being tired and dated. the front desk staff are friendly which is more than can be said for the front doormen. the bar and restaurant are great and the food is lovely. the decor in the reception, bar, restaurant area is far superior to the rooms but all in all good value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The checkin process was quick, but the staff were not at all friendly. The room was clean, but very worn and uncomfortable. There was also a major issue with the heating system - regardless of what temperature I set, it blew cold air. It just so happens that the weather was very cold, so that made the room even more uncomfortable. Overall, the hotel was average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanMan
Reviews.Content: In August our family took a vacation to New York City to see Broadway shows, eat good food, see the sights, and do the "tourist" thing. We did a great deal of research on hotels because of our unfamiliarity with New York City. We were very pleased with our choice of the Novotel. First, and foremost, we couldn't have asked for a better location. We were just down the street or around the corner from the theaters. From our 14th floor window we could see a portion of Times Square. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, or, at least, a subway station. Upon arrival, we were too early to check in; but the bell hops did an excellent job of getting us organized and watching over our bags while we spent our first hours in the city. We found it to be no problem having to take an elevator to the lobby. In fact, we met interesting people in the elevator! Being a French owned hotel, there were plenty of international folks which really added to the "flavor" of the hotel. The staff was helpful, courteous, and attentive. The lobby is bright and welcoming, and has a restaurant that literally overlooks Times Square. Our room was a decent-sized room with two double beds. We had no problem housing a family of four for six nights. The room was clean, and was attended to each and every day by an attentive maid. We would, without question, stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view, but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over New Years. The view and location are the best. However, the hotel itself is average. I have read on some webpages that Novotel is rated 3.5 stars. For its location, certainly, but not for the amenities. The rooms are just average and the service perhaps below. If you care for the location of a hotel, Novotel is probably ideal. If you want all the comforts, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PWR
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Novotel 18 - 21st Dec 2004. Location is excellent close to Times Square. Room was clean and comforatable and staff were very helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flossy_h
Reviews.Content: Me and my Fiance just got back from staying at the Novotel. We stayed there 24th-28th December for Christmas. The room we had was 2401 and had a view of Times Square. The room was nice and clean, and was everything we expected for a Three star hotel. I stayed there based on the reviews on this site. I would stay there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “We were pretty happy here.”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at The Milford Plaza. They called us 3 days before our reservation to inform us that the hotel had water damage and we were going to be moved to The Ramada New Yorker. When we found out it was 11 blocks South and across from Penn Station we decided to scramble to find something near Times Square since that is where all our activities were planned. Novotel was within our budget and in the location we wanted. The rooms were clean and we could easily see Times Square from our room. The staff were kind and couteous and quick to help with anything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 6-8, 2004. We arrived late at night, along with a busload of French Air crew. Check in went very smoothly. The room was large and clean with a wonderful view of Times Square. We shut out all the lights just to take in the view at night. This hotel is within walking distance of Rockefellar Center, St. Peter's Cathedral, Radio City Music Hall, Fox and NBC studios. We enjoyed the close proximity of the sights. If you go east you will find more residential areas, and some great delis. Try the hot pastrami on rye. The subway is close and hailing a cab was very easy. We had a great breakfast at the restaraunt, again another wonderful view. We did not get the buffet. We ordered ala cart. We liked Novotel so much we are returning for our Christmas holiday trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler00
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending a night at the Novotel and I just had to write a review. My travel agent booked me there when she couldn't find a room at any of my company's standard 2-star places, for which we usually pay about $150. The Novotel was the least expensive place she could find in the city on short notice and we paid $289. It was so worth it! Without any special request, they put me on the 27th floor with an amazing view of Time Square -- my typical hotel has a view of a brick wall. Staff were all very nice. Room service was timely and tasty. The bath ammenities smelled great, and the best part was that the bed was actually quite comfortable. Perhaps because I was so high up, I heard very little street noise, so I got a great night's sleep before my day of meetings. I didn't use the bar or restaurant, but they looked very stylish and lively. While I'd give the room itself 3 stars (rug & headboard could use a refresh, could use a mirror in the main room for doing make-up in natural light), it was certainly a 4 star visit overall. I hope that I'll be able to stay there again on my text trip to NYC and will look for the Novotel/Sofitel chain in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: dino durham
Reviews.Content: My prime concern before booking this hotel was the area around it, I was a little aprehensive to say the least. However spurred on by other members comments on this site, I went ahead and i got an excellent deal through UTELL website, $179 per night instead of $299 quoted on the hotels own web page. I was not disappointed, the hotel is a stones throw from all that Times Square has to offer, infact you can watch the goings on from the hotel veranda just through the bar area, its that close. An organisation called the Times Square Alliance has security guards patrolling the streets, very helpful when we asked for directions, so not just there for troublesome times. Anyway, more on the Novotel.....Slight drawback is the lifts/elevators, you need to take one lift from the street entrance to the reception area, then a short walk to another set of lifts which takes you to the hotel rooms. The room was pretty big for New York, 2 queen size beds, table, easy chair, TV, desk/unit, safe and plenty of storage space should you need it (we rarely unpack our luggage anyway!). Spotless bathroom, although the tub was a bit shallow, a pity as I like a long soak after a hard days sightseeing(minor fault though).
