We never dined in the hotel so can't comment on that but the bar was lively on an evening, can recommed the draught Sam Adams Ale, good service also with plenty of complimentary nibbles(just to make you more thirsty, I know!!). Location is very handy for the popular musical Hairspray, as the theatre is next door but one to the Novotel, also deli opposite is open late for any emergency late night snacks!! All in all, I can say I was pleasantly surprised with the Novotel & would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at better but location is convenient”
Reviews.Author: Choco8
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was okay but the setup was slightly akward and gave and room a very small feeling. The 2 beds were on one side of the room and everything else was on the other wall all wedge in there. The beds were not the most comfortable - Sheraton's sleeper beds are definitely much better. Walls were not are sound proof as I'd like and I told the front desk that I am a light sleeper. The concierge was not helpful when we checked in and was gone the whole time we were there. She didn't know anything about the antiques show going on that weekend-I got the info from the magazines they had out and then when there is no concierge you think they would leave the materials out for you but the 2 days there there were none to be found. My son who's stayed in many hotels with us says that this hotel only deserves a 2 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of October. This was our second time staying at the Novotel. The room was relatively large, clean with a superb bathroom. The location can't be beat. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice ...”
Reviews.Author: CACTeam
Reviews.Content: Five friends visited NYC from 23 - 28 October, 2004. I consulted this site avidly whilst booking our hotel and this one had a generally ok review. We had a great time and the hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We ate at the hotel and the breakfasts were excellent with great value for money! In fact, one of the biggest surprises to me was the cost of food etc. compared with London. I thought I'd be spending far more money on food than I did. Both our rooms had a view over Times Square and Broadway. The rooms were clean and larger than I had been led to believe. A problem arose with our in-room safe and within ten minutes of reporting it, our very own safe-cracker was sorting out our problem. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel without reservation and you'd be hard pressed to find a better one for location and price in the heart of the city. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Novotel about 5 times. Each time I was less pleased because rooms were getting old. I don't know if they've renovated. But anyway, the location is great. A few blocks from Times Square. Rooms were spacious and with all amenities. It's one of the best hotels to stay at if spending a New Years Eve in NY because there's always a huge party on the balcony and you can see all that's happening at Times Square wityhout having to be in the middle of the crowd

Reviews.Title: “location and view superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for three nights at the end of Sep 2004. Having read the reviews of others I was unsure of the welcome we would receive from the staff. However we had no problems at check in and all the staff we met were very helpful and friendly. The view of Time Square from our window had the wow factor and was well worth the extra we paid. To arrive and open the curtains and see that view made the holiday for me. The rooms were basic but comfortable, we did miss the lack of coffee making items, but expected the lack of them from other reviews of this hotel. Would stay here again and had a fantastic time in N.Y.C.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT TIME AT THE NOVOTEL”
Reviews.Author: westchez3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for five nights in November 03, and it was fab, my previous experience of NYC hotels has been dismal, but I was really pleased with the Novotel. The room was a quad room and was large enough and very clean. The bell boys were helpful and brought our cases to our room. My only critcism would be that they forgot to give us one of our large suitcases when we checked out and my friend had to take plane home to Scotland on her own, granted they sent the case in a taxi in rush hr to JFK The location was fab right on Broadway and the view to Times Square was excellent, if you want cheap Broadway show tickets use the TKTS booth nr Times Square and you get them half price for that evenings performances, most shows were available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel in September 2004. Overall impression was very positive. The room was a good size and clean throughout, the view from the 15th floor down to Times Square was amazing. I found the hotel staff to be pleasant and helpful, they even let us stay in our room on check out day longer than the 12 noon vacation time. The only downside was the cost of breakfast in the morning, unless you have children do not eat there ($16 each, children eat free) There is a loveley cafe called the Art cafe just outside, much more reasonable and good food. Would recommend a helicopter trip, bit pricey but well worth it and also the subway, cheap to ride and fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's all folks!”
Reviews.Author: sarah123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2004, priamrily for the location, which is great, just off Time Square. However, the entrance is shabby and the lobby is a lift ride away, which is not clearly signposted. The bell man was less than helpful on arrival too. Check in staff were unfriendly and not customer-orientated. Room was reasonable, but small with small, shabby bathroom. A nasty surprise on leaving was the charge for bag storage per item. Only stay if you get a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing worh the money was location and view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I jsut got back from New York and we stayed at the Novotel. First of all we walked into our room and it felt like a sauna. The controls were so messed up, we were either sweating or freezing! It was horrible. The carpet had ripples in it and was so trashy looking. The only thing I liked was the view and location. The lobby was so deceiving, it was nice nothing like our room. When you pay $300.00 a night (including the CRAZY New York taxes) you expect a nicer room. They also tried to charge me for items moved in the mini bar, whatever you do if you go, don't even open it up unless you plan on paying for it. They need to train the employees that check you in better people skills too along with better English. New York was fun, but I won't stay at the Novotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - modest accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. However the accommodations were modest and standard. They charged extra for things like storing bags that many hotels would include as a free service.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you 're looking for a great location that's convenient to the theaters, Times Square, and other great tourist spots, Novotel will meet this need. If you're lookng for modest accommodations, do not expect your room to look like the promo- pictures. If you are in your room at the time the maid it making the rounds, do not expect the maid to return. Be prepared to call housekeeping. We spent as much time away from the hotel enjoying the affordable restaurants, fun tours, great bargains, terrific shows, fantastic shopping and friendly and helpful tourists. One plug for Novotel is the wonderful toiletries especially the body lotion and the little soap. These should be available for purchase in a larger size in the gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Alabama
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Novotel Hotel in New York, mainly because of its location. The Novotel is a good choice for that reason, but not for much else; our room was comfortable, but ordinary in most respects and pretty expensive. We paid extra for a great view of Broadway, but the same view was free at street level. Some of the amenities that are included in most hotels anywhere else for less than half the price, like a coffee maker or continental breakfast, arenâ€™t included at Novotel. They do, however, offer a simple breakfast for something like $16. Skip their breakfast and go to the Art CafÃ© just around the cornerâ€¦their prices are very reasonable and the food is great. Go for lunch or dinner and get the cheesecake -- youâ€™ll love it! The hotel also tried to charge us for an extra, apparently invisible person in our room and succeeded in charging us for two bottles of water that we merely moved to another shelf in the minibar. Another little irritation is having to take one elevator just to get to the lobby, then another elevator to get to the rooms. Novotel is right in the middle of everything, so it might be a good choice solely for its location, but do yourself a favor and check out the other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have spent our first time in NYC and we were cery impressed. The location near of Broadway and Times Sq. could not have been better. The room was very clean and big. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore New York”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Went there in June 2004. First time in New York. The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is in middle of Broadway and a few minutes from Time Square. It is conveniently located for a lot of other landmarks such as Central Park, 5th Avenue. The rooms were spacious and clean. Although the hot and cold water taps were puzzling, I got boiling water from both taps on several occasions. We got late check out, a good buffet breakfast, and the staff were friendly in the diner. The buffet breakfast can seem pricey unless you have kids as they eat for free. Other reviewers recommend nearby diners for breakfast, but i did not think they were any cheaper, especially if you have children. Charging a dollar for each luggage is a bit mean, but overall this hotel was good value, and good standard. Also found this part of New York to be safe, taxi drivers knew where they were going and could speak English, and good bargains were on offer during the June sales. A good tip, for foreign visitors is to register with customers services in shops such as Macys and Bloomingdales. You will get discounts off your shopping, free gifts etc. Take your passport with you to confirm that you are a visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, few problems”
Reviews.Author: JoshThePilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights after switching from another hotel last August. The hotel is very good in terms of location. I didn't see any problem with the service. View from my room 14th floor was very good, except we were close to the ice machine and it was very loud a lot of the time. Rooms were very large and clean. Only 2 problems arose. The first is I was charged for food I did not consume from the minibar (a few people said they reported this) and second was I was charged for using the in room music system when it claimed I was able to receive a "free trial". The restaurant was also very good. Lots of airline crews, including the Air France "equipage" who stay at Novotels around the world. There are lots of airline crews in Manhattan. All the better for us aviation enthusiasts to chat with! Definitely will stay there again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRISPBISC
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner has a great time at this hotel. It was very comfortable, clean, spacious and staff friendly. We were given a room with 2 double beds. The location was good and it was a few minutes walk to Times Square and the subway was close by. Room service was good and so was the food although it was fairly expensive but you were given good size potions. The porters were also very helpful. I would definitely stay there again. However we did get a good deal when we went in March 2003.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rome_at_Easter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Broadway 19 - 22 July 2004. We had a 15th floor room with views of times square it was amazing. The two queen beds were ample for ourselves and our two kids. The room was clean as was the bathroom. We only dealt with the check in staff and they were very helpful. Check out was a breeze. We ate out as there is such a choice. Local delis are great for breakfast - making it fresh while you wait. We went to rosie o'gradys for evening meal - quite expensive but a great steak! Taxi fare from JFK was 45 dollars and to La Guardia was 40. Right in the middle of theatre land - we looked down on The winter garden showing Mama Mia also could see Hairspary and Wicked. Open top bus tours of New York could be picked up just a short walk away are well worth the money. They may seem expensive but the tickets are good for 2 days and you can hop on and off as much as you like. Soak up the atmosphere of broadway here for as little as GBP 116 per room per night for up to 4 people. If you want to kids eat free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Honkycat
Reviews.Content: Perfect location....walking distance to lots of attractions (and Broadway shows). Very clean, air conditioned room which had a good view. One excellent feature for us was that kids eat free with adults which, having 3 hungry ones, saved us a lot. We ate in the restaurant each day and had a spectacular view of Time Square. I found the staff to be extremely welcoming and helpful...I know one of the other reviews said the opposite, but like all hotels, everyone has off days and it depends who you get on the day. I had no complaints. All in all an extremely positive experience for our first visit to NYC and at the price they charge...fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellant location only surpassed the service. Everyone was solicitous and unfailingly polite. Great view from the 32nd floor! Clean-spacious-I would stay again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time to NYC and the location and view of Broadway and Times Sq. from our room could not have been better. I was able to arrange a late check-out and we were able to leave our bags at the hotel while we went to a matinee. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I've stayed at the Novotel and was very impressed both times. We were able to leave our luggage with the doorman while we parked across the street and he brought it up to our room as soon as we checked in (which was a very quick process.) We had a room overlooking Broadway and we were able to see Times Square. Spent a lot of time people-watching from that window! Felt very secure in the hotel at all times. The concierge was very helpful with directions to attractions in the city we wanted to visit. Check-out was a breeze -- did it from our tv in the room and just stopped by the desk to pick up our receipt. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very big rooms with nice view of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at Le Marquis and Super 8 Hotel, the Novotel Hotel was a break from the small rooms. I got a room on the Broadway St side and it was very big-- even has a sofa. Reasons to stay in this hotel: Big rooms; location; nice street view (request for the room overlooking Time Square); Reasons not to stay: Long processing time during check-in and check out; reception desk personnel are snobish and rude; they charge $1/bag for keeping luggages upon check out;

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: irlhelen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel in June 04. The rooms were spacious for what I was expecting. They had everything you need. The air conditioning was a welcome relief from the hot/humid weather. It was temperature controlled so you didn't have to freeze or boil in the night. The housekeeping staff was extremely helpful. Booked $169 for 7 nights via Novotel website and it was a bargain. You could walk almost everywhere and the subway stop was less than two blocks away. No problems at check-in or check-out. With the great views of Times Square (for the cheap rate!) and the 9th floor I was worried about noise. Didn't need to be. I never heard anything from the street with the windows closed and even though our room had a connecting door I didn't hear a thing from neighboring rooms. My husband is quite sensitive to noise in hotel rooms and he didn't have a problem. Not many Americans staying there, though, mostly tour groups and airline crews. Didn't try the breakfast as over $9 for continental breakfast seemed a bit steep. Go to one of the many diners around the area and get a HUGE hot breakfast and coffee for under $8 each. Overall, it's great value for money and I'd stay there again. If you're looking for a romantic getaway, it's probably not for you, but as a base for a holiday in New York it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Not #1 at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Novotel. The location of this hotel was outstanding as many NYC attractions were within a reasonable walking distance and the subway stop was closeby. However, we did not find the majority of the Novotel staff to be helpful or hospitable. Simple questions appeared to irritate them. Based on the location alone I would consider staying at the Novotel but the staff needs to realize that they are members of the service industry before I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: brianinvan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for the weekend in June 04, and I was pleasantly surprised at just about everything. Based on other reviews on this site, I was expecting surly reception staff and smallish rooms. Instead the staff at reception was very efficient and fairly pleasant. The lobby was always busy and it often looked like the Paris airport with lots of flight crews from Air France. The room was bigger than I imagined, with room for the king bed, a sofa, desk, TV. And the bathroom had wood flooring, which is a great alternative to tile. The air conditioning was central (not window unit) and was relatively silent. I was lucky enough to get a room that looked out onto Times Square, and there is a terrasse/bar which has the same view. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: enaj47
Reviews.Content: excellent location. can walk anywhere in midtown from here. close to all broadway shows and david letterman show. clean room with a good view of broadway. great internet price for a times square hotel. only drawback during our june 2004 stay was the balky air conditioning system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was so convenient it made mine and my boyfriend's stay so much fun! We could go shopping and drop our bags in the hotel whenever we were tired. The hotel is so close to Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that goes to NY. The rooms were the usual standard hotel type bedroom, for a 4Star hotel I admit I did expect something a bit more plush. However, it is nice and clean. Some staff were nice and friendly (mainly the maids!) and the others were average (the people at the reception desk).........

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel New York Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 226 W 52nd Street, New York City, NY 10019
